title: 5.0 out of 5 stars Best for modern music; fine for general purpose use
author: Glut & Lack: troublemaking twins
content: Love this little speaker for the music I (and most of us) listen to. Extremely bass heavy, so it's great for the thumping stuff; not sure it would do well for classical music.Even with adjustment, it's a little muddy for voices (eg, audible books), but it does the job. If I'm gonna compromise, it'll be on that, not on music.So, I am entirely happy with it as an all-purpose speaker. It connects fast and reliably and has plenty range (past most people's normal listening distance).It's compact and robust. Very happy that its controls can be distinguished in the dark and be used without worries even when I'm wearing gloves or have damp, dirty hands.I got lucky with a Black Friday deal.Oh, and a lot of choices for cases exist. I wanted a stash case - not while-in-use - with full protection. The clamshell cases are cute, and some are offered in (possibly) matching colors. But I didn't want to fiddle with a long stitched hinge and a cornered zipper (both presenting stress points) so I kept looking and found a cylindrical case with a top that zips open. It fits the FLIP 6 perfectly.Worpie Carrying Travel Case for Flip 6 Flip 5 Flip 4 Flip 3 Portable Speakerhttps://a.co/d/abH8lV3

title: 5.0 out of 5 stars INSANE Speaker! Quality, volume, battery, and features make this THE BEST!
author: Jeremy
content: The JBL Charge 5 is the BEST speaker I have ever owned. I have had the average run-of-the-mill bluetooth speaker that has around a $20 value, for over a year, and I thought it was good sound quality, and I never thought I needed something ‚Äúfancy.‚Äù Well, that speaker started having problems, and I was carefully searching for another speaker. I found this speaker and I thought I would try something new. I only had one thought as I played music out of it for the first time. WOW! The JBL Charge 5 has the best sound quality I had ever heard from a bluetooth speaker. I don‚Äôt ever plan on getting another speaker; that is, a speaker that isn‚Äôt JBL or an upgraded version of the Charge 5. The clarity is absolutely stunning! The bass is DEEP. I can feel the bass through my whole room! The volume is insane. I rarely have it over 50%, but in the event where I need it louder, I turn it up. I once had music filling a whole event center that was quite a reasonable size. If I could choose one word to describe this speaker, it would be ‚ÄúStunning,‚Äù ‚ÄúPowerful,‚Äù or ‚ÄúSupercharged!(Pun intended.)‚Äù On that note, the battery life on this thing is long! I once had the speaker provide some background noise for about two days and the battery life was barely lower than 70% (I think‚Ä¶it‚Äôs hard to tell exactly with the battery indicator; definitely above 60%). Of course, the battery drains quicker when you have the speaker playing at high volumes. Also, it can take some water. Some being a little, I prefer not to put it to the test. Here is my takeaway:DESIGN: 9/10 Great! I love the fabric covering. The JBL logo is made of metal, which makes it look very nice and official. The buttons are easy to distinguish, and the light is on the power, bluetooth, and there is a ring of light around those two buttons when PartyBoost is in effect. There is a battery bar right below the JBL Logo, and it serves as a general battery indicator. You can get the 100%, 75%, 50%, and 25%. You can get more info on the battery via the app. The weight is surprisingly light, considering the volume this speaker is capable of. Although, it isn‚Äôt the most portable of portable speakers as it is a little big and has a football shape. You can get a case for it that has a strap though. For the skip feature, you have to press the play/pause button twice. Make sure that when you do this, you maintain a consistent interval of time between the two presses. If you do it too fast it will just pause. If you do it too slow, it will just pause then play again.BATTERY: 10/10 Perfect! I absolutely love the battery. I‚Äôm the kind of person that prefers the longest possible battery, and doing whatever it takes to preserve it. I don‚Äôt have to worry much about this battery. Like I said, it has provided some low music for almost 2 days and the battery wasn‚Äôt that affected. However, the battery life will drain much more rapidly when using the speaker at high volumes. I currently use this speaker with a projector to watch TV. I have watched lots of movies and TV shows, and I don‚Äôt have to pay much attention to the battery. I just plug it in every other night, and it does great! And having a battery bank is the cherry on top. I haven‚Äôt used it much, as I keep most of my devices fully charged, but I think it is awesome that it has a battery bank if I need it.SOUND QUALITY: 10/10(10.5/10) Stunning! I didn‚Äôt expect that sound quality could get this good for a bluetooth speaker. JBL means business! When I turn it to high volumes, I can actually feel air blowing from it! On that note, it can go REALLY high in volume. I did not expect that at all. Insane volume. As stated earlier, I use this with a projector, and for all my TV. Watching movies with this speaker makes the entire experience cinematic! A much bigger upgrade compared to the sound TV‚Äôs come with. I would even say that it can contend with some soundbars out there (not the JBL Surround Sound System though‚Ä¶that one seems like the top-tier of JBL). This speaker was my first experience with JBL speakers (other than the car speakers) and I was very impressed. It has been the best sound experience I have ever had. Really clear and crisp audio, and when I say ‚Äúreally,‚Äù I mean truly! When playing music, I can hear every instrument, every breath, and incredible bass. The bass is a superstar in and of itself. Like I said, the bass shakes my whole room when playing music, and when watching movies! The side radiators really, really pack a punch! There is even an adjustable EQ on the app. Though I prefer what the speaker came with. It is a little pricey, (just a little) but know that you get what you pay for! I don‚Äôt think that I can ever go back to what I had‚Ä¶PARTYBOOST: 9/10 Great! I had one, so I bought two more so I could create a surround sound with my TV. It kinda worked. I think I had some sort of connectivity issue, so all I‚Äôll say is that the range might not be that great, so make sure you keep them somewhat close. If you have a projector that has bluetooth and you want to use PartyBoost, I would consider researching what you can do with the Bluetooth latency (As stated earlier, I watch TV with this, and please note there IS some lag between sound and video, as bluetooth will do. However, that is just bluetooth technology, not JBL. Over time my ears and eyes have adjusted, and now it is not that big a deal). In addition to standard bluetooth latency, PartyBoost will make this delay greater (I ended up returning the other two because of this issue). For music, this is not a problem, because it is just sound and no video. With music, PartyBoost is pretty cool! It really creates a much louder and much cooler sound experience. You can even use just two for a stereo effect, and it works great!Overall, this has been the BEST bluetooth speaker experience I have ever had. You better believe I‚Äôll be there for the Charge 6 or 7 or wherever they decide to take this. They really have something good going here. I would 110% recommend this! If you are reading this review, and you would like an upgrade to your typical listening experience, know that this is one of the best out there! And if you catch this at a discounted price, you‚Äôll know you are getting a great deal. JBL has been the best listening experience for me. I will continue buying their products if they keep supplying a high-quality experience. I mean, let the 27,000 ratings with a 4.8 overall rating speak for itself. Here is a simplified pro-con list:PROS-Excellent audio clarity-Excellent bass-Excellent overall sound-Exceptional volume-Long battery life-Battery bank feature-Waterproof feature-Adjustable EQ-Stereo Effect-PartyBoost for multiple speakersCONS-Button timing for the skip track-Could be slightly more portable (We do have the Flip speakers for that though)

content: After years of experimenting with various Bluetooth speakers, I finally decided to invest in the Bose SoundLink Flex, and I can confidently say it was worth every penny. title: 5.0 out of 5 stars Awesome little speaker with great sound
author: Jimbo
content: The media could not be loaded. My last small speaker was a skull candy air raid and back over 10 years ago it was awesome. I gifted the SC speaker to my daughter years back. Then I went and got a JBL partybox100 and love the darn thing but it is heavy. I knew I needed a small portable speaker for when I grill or I an in the garage working on something. I wanted clear sound on a small portable package that could fill a small room. I immediately went to check the JBL portable speakers around the same size. I sampled several but I really liked the sound of the Bose. I never had any bose anything before. It was going for $119 and it has an app to control the features on the speaker. It is very light weight for the size, I wanted something other than black and went with the blue. The construction feels good, it‚Äôs waterproof and shock resistant. The bluetooth picked up right away. I walked outside my house with my phone and never lost connectivity. Now the battery life, this is not for the whole day. If you have the EQ setting with a lower bass setting at 70% volume you are loosing 10% charge around every hour it was my estimation. So at a good high volume you can get a good solid 8-9 hours of play. If you have it lets say on your desk close to you at a 20% volume you might get the 12 hours. Now you can play while charging, it might take longer to charge but you will still get to enjoy your music. Charge cable provided is a usb-c to usb-a but you can use a usb-c to usb-c cable with any wall charger 12watt or higher. Match your cable watt rating to your wall plug watt rating. Meaning its better to have a higher rated cable than your wall plug. Example: 20watt wall plug with 60 watt usb-c cable its all you need. Buy quality chargers and cables Anker is one of my preferred brands. Highly recommend getting the free Bose app as it will update the software of your speaker when ever it drops and you can adjust your EQ settings. If you want a thumper go with a JBL it puts out more bass. If you want a bit clearer more balanced sound get the Bose. Pretty happy with my purchase. Posted a video but the sound from the recording does not do it justice.
timestamp: Reviewed in the United States April 15, 2025

content: First off, I just want to say that this speaker is really awesome. For the price, look, style, and sound and everything you're getting this for, it's honestly a great deal. However, I prefer my Bose SoundLink Max in so many ways (and yes, it does cost more than this does so it's not a fair direct comparison).So, this speaker looks so sleek and fantastic, I love the design of it and it's very much a Sony branded product. The idea for being able to hide/remove the clips for the carrying strap for this is great, and it's so cool and innovative with how they designed it.The strap itself is awesome, easily blows away any other strap I've used before both in looks and comfort (it seriously looks cool, I love the lettering and how they colored it all the way across the side of the strap), I love that and it was even included which is great since some speakers (I'm looking at you Bose SoundLink Max) make you pay extra for that.As for the sound, I always prefer a bit more bass to my speakers, so to be honest this one didn't really do It for me compared to my Sonos Move and Bose SoundLink Max which both have significantly better bass, but this had a very balanced sound and could get quite loud without any distortion so I'm still really happy with this.This speaker is also MUCH lighter than the Bose and Sonos speakers I have, like it probably weighs almost half of what either of those weigh, so that's a huge thing this has going for it, it has style and portability while still sounding great.The pairing process is easy to use on this, and the software has gotten a LOT better than it used to be for Sony apps. I stil l prefer the Bose and Sonos apps compared to the Sony one because they're faster, easier to use, and a lot simpler to navigate, but the Sony one is leagues beyond where it used to be in terms of looks and usability.Overall, I have to say, I am really impressed with this speaker and give it a 10/10, definitely recommend. While this definitely won't be my main speaker (that will stay with my Bose SoundLink Max) because I prefer the bass and design of my other speakers, this one is so lightweight and portable and sounds so good for it's size and price, this is pretty much unbeatable at this price point in my opinion, especially since it includes such a sweet looking strap to carry it around places.My recommendation, I would say get this if you want something pretty lightweight and easy to carry around but that sounds good, but if you want some really solid bass and a better overall audio experience and are okay paying a bit more and having a bit of a heavier speaker, maybe look at the Bose SoundLink Max instead, but both are phenomenal options in their price range, and I couldn't be happier with this for what it is.
timestamp: Reviewed in the United States April 14, 2025
product_name: Sony ULT Field 3 - Waterproof Portable Bluetooth Speaker

title: 5.0 out of 5 stars Shockingly Good Sound in a Tough, Travel-Ready Package
author: Pickles
content: I've had the Sony ULT Field 3 for about a week and a half now, and even though I haven‚Äôt had long stretches of use, I‚Äôve used it pretty much every day‚Äîand it‚Äôs still sitting at 80% battery. That was a surprise in the best way. I have a bunch of Bluetooth speakers (Beats, Bose, Soundcore, JBL‚Ä¶ you name it), but this is my first Sony portable speaker, and honestly, it‚Äôs made a strong first impression.Probably the biggest thing for me is the sound quality. It‚Äôs kind of wild how full and balanced this thing sounds considering its size. The bass is deep and punchy, but it doesn‚Äôt drown out the mids and highs. Everything comes through really clean. I‚Äôve mostly kept it on the ULT sound setting though you can use the Sony app, which has a really intuitive EQ and lets you tweak things if you want. That setting just hits the sweet spot for my ears‚Äîrich bass without muddying everything else.I‚Äôve got it paired to both my iPhone and iPad, and switching between them has been seamless. No connection drops, no delays‚Äîjust smooth transitions. It supports Bluetooth multipoint, so that‚Äôs a big convenience if you tend to bounce between devices like I do.Design-wise, it‚Äôs larger than something like the Beats Pill or Bose SoundLink Flex, but still very portable. It feels incredibly solid‚Äîlike it could take a few accidental drops without breaking a sweat‚Äîbut it‚Äôs not heavy. That balance between durability and portability really works in its favor. Sony throws in a shoulder strap, which is actually really nice quality, but I haven‚Äôt had a use for it yet. If I were headed to the beach or hiking, I‚Äôd probably throw it on, but for around-the-house or backyard use, it‚Äôs not really necessary.Battery life is excellent. Like I mentioned, I‚Äôve barely made a dent in it, and that‚Äôs with near-daily use. The speaker gives you a verbal battery update when you power it on (which you can toggle on/off through the app), and that‚Äôs been super handy. I wish more speakers did that. It‚Äôs also IP67 rated, which means it‚Äôs waterproof, dustproof, and generally built like a tank. I haven‚Äôt tested it in extreme conditions, but knowing it can handle those situations is reassuring.As for downsides? Honestly, not much to complain about. It‚Äôs a bit pricier than some competitors, but to me, the sound quality and build more than justify it. Some people might prefer something smaller or more subtle, but if you want a speaker that really fills a room (or yard), this is worth the extra cash. I also haven‚Äôt felt the need to buy a second one for stereo or party mode, because it already gets more than loud enough for my uses‚Äîbut it‚Äôs tempting.If you're trying to decide between this and something like a JBL Charge or a Bose Flex, this Sony definitely holds its own, especially if sound quality is a priority. It has the clarity and depth that a lot of similarly sized speakers just don‚Äôt quite hit. Another observation on the sound quality: it sounds excellent at high or low volume and does not lose it's depth or clarity in either scenario.In summary:Sound: Excellent‚Äîclear across the board, with rich bassBattery: Long-lasting, smart notifications via the appDesign: Tough but light, easy to carryConnectivity: Reliable, seamless between devicesApp Support: Useful and intuitiveNegatives: Slightly larger than some, a bit pricey‚Äîbut worth itIf you‚Äôre on the fence, I‚Äôd say go for it. I didn‚Äôt expect to like it this much, but it‚Äôs quickly become my go to speaker.

timestamp: Reviewed in the United States April 14, 2025

title: 5.0 out of 5 stars Sounds great
author: Edub
content: I already have 2 Era 100's and a Sub mini in my Family room. They sound fantastic. Some times I like to sit in my Living room and read, or meditate. But I would turn the volume up in the family room so I could hear those speakers. So I decided to get a third Era 100 for my living room. I put it on a small decorative shelf. I must say it is everything I imagined it would be. When setting it up I didn't know I could turn off selected speakers. This was a unexpected plus for me. So if I am in my living room I could just have the one Era 100 speaker play and vice versa. Or I could have all three and the sub mini playing at the same time. After having the 2 Era 100's and Sub mini for a couple of months now, I had forgotten how good just 1 Era 100 speaker sound. I did notice the two Era 100's paired with the sub sound more clear and crisp than the single Era 100's. That's because the Sub mini is using the low that the Era 100's would had normally played. Great concept in sound and speakers. I just turned the treble up a little bit more in the single Era 100 to get more highs. Sounds good. It's too bad Sonos doesn't allow for multiple Sub minis connected in the same group, it would be phenomenal. I had read somewhere that it wasn't cost effective for the consumer to buy 2 Sub minis when 1 Gen 3 Sub woofer has more output than two Sub minis. I say who cares Sonos? If a consumer wants to spend their money on a second Sub mini and put in in another room in the same speaker group it's their prerogative. If that's true then their business model doesn't make since to me. Set up was a breeze too. Because I didn't use a tutorial to set this up, it took me a few minutes to figure out how to select the speaker, because at first the single Era 100 didn't play although it was connected. But the setup was a breeze. Very easy. I may get another Era 100 (this time used) and put it in my kitchen and I'll have sound throughout all of downstairs. I've been fortunate to not have problems with the app, unlike many others. I am very impressed and satisfied.
timestamp: Reviewed in the United States October 17, 2024

title: 1.0 out of 5 stars Want my money back. Utterly Useless for streaming music due to horrible software
author: CPalmer
content: What a shame. When they work the sound is amazing. The problem. They never work for streaming music because of a woeful update to its software. Even the NYT, which once recommended the system as the best has changed its mind. About three months ago Sonos updated its system software that literally rendered my entire Sonos speaker system (This Sonos Era 100 included) useless. To use this system as a music streaming device, you must use the Sonos App. Sonos used to have one of the best apps in the business. Intuitive with amazing functionality. A few months ago they tried to update it, basically trying to make it look more like Amazon music. It was an utter failure. Folks like me are wanting to sell their entire system. I stayed with sonos for three months now since they promised they would make things right. They have not. The speakers stop streaming music after playing just one song. Nearly no commands work correctly. When I tell it to stop playing a song. It does not listen. I manually have to press the button on the speaker. This system was developed so you could talk to it and play all music across an entire CD. That used to be possible. Now it is not. Literally stops playing after one song. Via voice prompt, when you tell it to go to the next song, it cannot. We Sonos music streamers have lost the capability to stream music directly from our device's own music library. Many of us bought Sonos because we wanted to have great speakers that would directly play music from our phones or our shared music library folders on our computers. That functionality has ceased to exist. Run! Don't walk. And return these speakers. Their only use today is as a bluetooth device where you have to physically press each song you want to move onto via whatever controlling system you have for bluetooth. The Sonos incompetence here I cannot overstate. A once great company and music system has fallen. Such a shame. It did not have to be this way. If I could speak to the CEO of Sonos I would tell him this: Your bread and butter was your speaker system, not headphones, not other products. Get back to the basics. Restore the streaming functionality that allowed us to enjoy music via touchless voice commands and software that was once top notch. I have five Sonos speakers for sale. I hate to do it, but I am making all my speakers Amazon speakers. At least Amazon respects it customers by doing research before launching new products that destroy the functionality of what used to be. Goodbye, Sonos. Forever!

timestamp: Reviewed in the United States December 10, 2024

title: 5.0 out of 5 stars Really good with a couple of flaws
author: CTM
content: I love TWS earbuds. I have many including buds from Sony, Samsung, AKG, Amazon, Soundpeats and more. I was intrigued by small size of the 1More Minis and wanted to try them. For the most part, they are wonderful. They are literally half the size of my other buds with most of the same features. Remarkable. I don't really like large buds hanging out of my ears and really loathe the stemmed variety like Airpods. These minis almost disappear and their extremely light weight makes them very comfortable. The sound is really good, they have very decent ANC and transparency modes, they have in ear detection and an app for some customization. I have no idea how they can manage to squeeze all of these features into such a small bud. On top of the features, the buds last 5 hours with ANC and 6 hours without. Amazing. I would unconditionally recommend these buds except for two annoyances that EVERY YouTube reviewer has complained about. First, limited customization of tap controls. These don't have single tap capability. I understand that to some degree because the buds are so small that it would probably be impossible to reposition them without stopping or starting your music. The bigger problem is 1More's use of Sound ID rather than "real" equalizer controls. Sound ID works by offering A/B samples that you select and it creates a profile based on your selections. It's horrible and doesn't work at all for me. I tried it at least 10 times and the Sound ID profile was always worse than the out of the box sound. I have been forced to use third part equalizers on my phone to get them to sound the way I want. 1More, if you want to keep your Sound ID, please add some presets and a manual equalizer the way many others do like Soundcore for example. I dislike Sound ID so much that it prevented me from buying their new EVO buds. I had the buds in my cart and then cancelled the order. The EVO cost more than the mini and I simply didn't want to deal with Sound ID again. If 1More adds equalization and perhaps allows for more tap options, these buds would be fantastic. As it is, I really like them and will workaround the app shortcomings. 1More, if you are listening, I know you can fix these problems. You can make a great product even greater!
timestamp: Reviewed in the United States May 14, 2022

title: 4.0 out of 5 stars I wish I could rate 5 stars, but‚Ä¶
author: Gianna
content: ‚Ä¶I just can‚Äôt. Because as useful as these earbuds are, there‚Äôs one huge caveat to them that needs to be made clear.Let‚Äôs start with the positive: the ComfoBuds Mini are incredible for sleeping. While they‚Äôre not advertised as sleep buds, I find it hard to believe that they weren‚Äôt designed with sleep in mind. The flat shape, the small size, the selection of noise-blocking ambient sounds included in the app, even a sleep timer‚Ä¶while you certainly CAN use them as everyday buds (and if you have very small ears, you might want to) these are clearly intended for being comfortable enough to wear at night and block out unwanted noises. I love them for that. I previously hated wearing noise-cancelling earbuds at night, which was somewhat of a necessity to me due to my wife‚Äôs snoring problem; with these buds, I ditched the discomfort and pain and accidental button triggering in favor of a much more comfortable experience, to the point where I actually enjoyed putting them in every night. They‚Äôre not called the ‚ÄúComfoBuds‚Äù for nothing.The ANC is not the best I‚Äôve ever tried, but gets the job done as far as helping to seal out those pesky nighttime disruptions. Sound quality is admittedly not the greatest. Don‚Äôt get me wrong, it‚Äôs perfectly acceptable, it just suffers in a few areas that probably directly relate to the size of the buds. Soundstage is poor, instrument separation is very poor, and the volume tends to skew on the quiet side, but if you‚Äôre using these for sleep, none of that matters too much.Now here comes the real caveat.1MORE is clearly having a serious quality control issue with the ComfoBuds mini. I can‚Äôt say for certain whether this extends to their other models, as this is the only product of theirs I‚Äôve tried. And while the idea is fantastic and they‚Äôve clearly put a lot of effort into the design of these buds, there‚Äôs a persistent issue with one or both earbuds suddenly losing its noise-cancelling ability after a very short period of time, producing whooshing or roaring noises instead of blocking sound.‚ÄúIt‚Äôs just earwax blocking up the buds!‚Äù insist the apologist reviewers, as well as 1MORE themselves. ‚ÄúClean them and they‚Äôll be fine!‚Äù But I beg to differ. With my first pair of these, the whooshing started in the right earbud after about two months of use. I immediately followed every bit of advice I could find about cleaning them, to no avail. I thought, okay, that‚Äôs a bummer, and I sent them back and ordered another pair. The left earbud of the second pair started whooshing within two weeks. I repeat: TWO WEEKS. I had used them less than ten times since I got them, plus I was being very careful about cleaning my ears every day, so there is NO WAY that they accumulated enough earwax during that time to block them up. Something else is going on. I wonder if trying to cram so much tech into such a small package is backfiring, and the components are interfering with each other somehow. Maybe that‚Äôs why you don‚Äôt normally see ANC in buds of this size.1MORE will replace malfunctioning buds for you, but the process does take a while, and you‚Äôll be without them in the meantime. It seems they‚Äôre aware of the issue, which is good. I really hope that they‚Äôll figure out what‚Äôs wrong and release a second version of the ComfoBuds Mini that doesn‚Äôt have these problems.I should probably take off more than one star for the quality control issue‚Ä¶but I just can‚Äôt bring myself to. Because when these buds are working, they‚Äôre really the perfect sleep buds, and I just can‚Äôt see myself ditching them; nothing blocks out my wife‚Äôs snoring more comfortably than these. I only hope that they‚Äôll continue to improve in the future. In the meantime, it‚Äôs up to you to decide if the risks outweigh the benefits.
timestamp: Reviewed in the United States July 22, 2023

title: 5.0 out of 5 stars Basically perfect, fantastic wind ANC, perfect case
author: Colin M.
content: I needed a replacement for my Galaxy buds pro's that have the fatal ANC "roar in one ear" that Samsung won't fix, and they don't stay in the ear. Bring an absolutely ENORMOUS fan of the 1more comfobuds z (the single best sleep focused earbuds at any price) I liked that these are also small, the case shape is wonderful (flip top, tiny, wireless charger) and they're relatively inexpensive.The sound quality uses 1more's app to do a "sounds" hearing preference test. I would prefer a proper EQ option but it works well enough. I prefer real audiophile iem's and headphones, but enjoyed the Galaxy buds on bass boost, they almost hit like planar magnetics. These are about 80% there. They're totally serviceable, with the only standout being a pretty good technical performance, with genuinely solid imaging and separation. They absolutely do need the soundID set up though, I hate the stock tuning. For tiny little things they are, I am perfectly happy with the sound quality when I want music on my bike or public transit.The ANC is stellar. They have a specific mode for wind reduction that downright curbstomps Samsung and apple. If you ride a bike, you need 1more ANC buds. The transparency mode is great too, very natural sounding. It doesn't have that "talk and it switches to transparency" gimmick, but I found it obnoxious on Samsung.Touch controls are easily customized and no "single touch" feature means you don't accidentally press anything readjusting or putting them in. Auto pauses when you take one out, your can use just one or the other no problemThe app features depend on the product but these are meant to be usable for sleeping, do they come preloaded with a library of sleep/ambient sounds. I just use my own but it's a nice feature. I can easily fall asleep with them in and I'm a very picky side sleeper, but I do prefer the absolutely microscopic comfobuds z's.The stock eartips did bother me a bit, they have a little ridge from the mold that irritated my ears after a few hours of use. They have a very odd mounting system that I was only able to find one option for, spinfit 1025 tips are shallow enough to fit and still let the case close (the wells for the eartips is a bit to shallow, id like it if they addressed this on a revision) so if you don't like the tips, spinfit 1025's.The case magnets that hold the buds in are hilariously strong. Your have to SMACK it to dislodge them. Very nice detail. The case size is tiny and perfectly shaped to slide into pockets, with a flip top that you can open one handedFor being so small they also stay put well. Not perfect, but I can work out or mow the lawn, an impossible task of the Galaxy buds pro.Overall though, these things rock. They're exactly what I need as a paramedic who also rides a bicycle. 1more is a serious brand with some seriously well thought out products at extremely competitive prices. I can sleep on my side with a podcast and still be able to wake up for a call, they crush wind nose when I'm riding my bike, they sound perfectly adequately tuned with impressive imaging (once you run the sound id feature once) and the case is (slightly too shallow recessions for the eartips aside) very nice in the hand and perfectly shaped.Highly recommend.
timestamp: Reviewed in the United States August 18, 2022

title: 1.0 out of 5 stars Decent but Defective
author: Aquila
content: UPDATE 6/24/22: As of 6/23/22, my replacement earbuds have the same problem. Sound is reduced then completely lost in the right earbud just a couple of weeks after normal use. Down to 1 star instead of 3 stars. Returning them. Stay within high quality brands like Sony, Bose, and Sennheiser. Replacing them with Sony WFC 500‚Äôs.UPDATE 6/5/22: Amazon replaced my earbuds after some arm twisting. My updated review is underneath the original:After my cheap but mighty pair of Sony wired earphones finally died after years of use, I decided to do some research and finally try earbuds after years of scoffing at the wireless craze. I decided on these due to having small ears. My first pair of comfobuds mini were defective. The right earbud made a ringing noise as soon as I began to use them out of the box. 2 weeks after purchase, the right earbud had no sound. Max sound volume doesn‚Äôt sound very loud unless you have ANC mode turned on. It does not have a proper equalizer. With my defective pair, ANC mode drowned out the melodies even though the bass was good, so the sound wasn‚Äôt very balanced. The touch controls hardly work nor are they very customizable. You sacrifice some features that should be included in this price point for the small size.Review for replacement earbuds:The packaging was different. These came in a black box with a manufacture date of 4/2022. My defective pair was in a white box with a 2/2022 manufacture date. Both pairs of the earbuds were black. The touch controls are more responsive and they work 70% of the time instead of the 20% success rate of my defective pair, but the controls are still very limited for the price point. These definitely are as loud as they should be at max volume. Bass is good and the sound is more balanced. The bass in the defective pair was definitely stronger, but it overpowered and drowned out the melodies, making the sound unbalanced and less dynamic. I‚Äôm not sure if this has to do with the pair itself or the firmware. I have been on firmware version 0.10.38 for both pairs and have not yet updated, so it may be the pair itself. Eartips are comfortable but they may be problematic as they don‚Äôt create enough of a buffer between your ear and the mesh, so your mesh may get waxy which may impact the sound. Keep them and your ears clean and I recommend buying better aftermarket eartips. Since this is my first pair of wireless earbuds ever, I really can‚Äôt accurately measure how good the ANC is as I have nothing to compare it to yet. I ride trains frequently and I never hear my surroundings when ANC is turned on. The battery life seems low at a 4 hour play time with ANC enabled, but the charging case replenishes life fairly quickly. 1more customer service was fine and replied to me quickly, but I ended up getting the replacement faster through Amazon customer service. Overall I‚Äôll bump the earbuds up to a 3 out of 5 stars. They lose points for the lack of touch controls, lack of a real equalizer, and being overpriced. The sound is decent, the size is great, and they are light-weight and comfortable. While I still prefer the sound quality of wired earphones, I‚Äôll keep these in my collection if they don‚Äôt fizzle out on me too fast again.
timestamp: Reviewed in the United States June 3, 2022

title: 3.0 out of 5 stars I went with soundcore instead
author: Frankie
content: So out of the box these tiny buds surprised me. The fit was amazing for me considering I‚Äôm one of those with extremely tiny ears. The sound was okay but after setting up soundid they sounded pretty good with nice bass and clarity. Now on to the bad.ANC.. was alright then I started noticing the left bud wouldn‚Äôt function like the right one. A day later whenever anc was enabled the left bud would vibrate and distort sound. Tried resetting and all of that but it‚Äôs clearly a hardware issue as it now happens whenever I try to use them. These buds also lack a mono sound when only one is in use. I own many buds and I‚Äôve never run into that before so when using one bud you‚Äôre missing out on a lot of tucked away frequencies. When anc was functioning properly it was eh at best. To me more sound was canceled out with all functions turned off. I‚Äôve literally only had these for 3 days and they‚Äôre defective already which is a shame because I like the sound and how they fit. timestamp: Reviewed in the United States June 18, 2022

title: 4.0 out of 5 stars Good, comfortable headphones
author: Victoria
content: I'm very impressed with these little earbuds. I bought them because I have noisy upstairs neighbors and needed some noise cancelling headphones to help me sleep. I'm a side sleeper, and while these aren't totally perfect for that, they're comfortable enough that I don't have trouble falling asleep. It helps if you use a very squishy pillow (my memory foam pillow is too firm and makes them dig into my ears). They're very comfortable for regular daily use too. I have an oddly shaped ear canal that makes earbuds constantly fall out of my left ear, but these are small enough that they fit snugly.I'm no audiophile, but the sound is good. Can't complain. They don't sound as good as my Bose headphones that I normally wear, but they're like 1/50 of the size so I can't really fault them for that. I wish the app let you adjust the sound settings manually. As far as I can tell, you can only adjust them by taking their sound preference quiz. The touch controls are a little annoying. The tutorial said you double tap to play/pause, but I've never gotten that to work. They do sometimes randomly pause when I remove or adjust them, though.The noise cancelling works really well. I was kind of blown away by it, since I've never had earbuds with ANC capabilities before. I can't hear the thumping from my neighbors' music at ALL. Way better than I was expecting. It also blocks out the sound of my fan completely. I can definitely still hear sudden, abrupt noises, but it's very muffled. The "transparent" setting is also nice, since I like to be able to hear my surroundings when I'm out walking.These aren't marketed as sleep headphones, and I suspect that is partly because of the battery life. They last around 4 hours with ANC enabled, so they won't last you a full night's sleep. Not a huge deal for me since my neighbors usually cool it with the music at around 4am, but it wouldn't be ideal if you were trying to block out a snoring partner, loud AC unit, etc. For the price I didn't really expect much more than that, but it's significantly less than all of the other wireless earbuds I've owned. They do charge quickly, at least.

title: 4.0 out of 5 stars Finally
author: TJ Lewis
content: First this is coming someone who's worked in the tech industry for almost 30 years. I own my own IT/technology company and I am truly passionate about technology. Simply put these are the best fitting perfect size earbuds on the market. There are no competitors who make earbuds that aren't giant or hang out of medium to small ears. By combining all metrics that earbuds are judged by today the Comfo Buds minis are in a league of their own. The sound quality iis good, noise canceling decent and has the basic features (transparency, basic touch controls) that we have come expect. With that said it's impossible to provide a negative review of these earbuds without attempting to nitpick, are doing a deep comparison in the technical specifics that ultimately most users don't understand. There are very few things in the technology space that are the best at every facet of their market. If you are someone who has smaller ears or just thinks the average size of earbuds is ridiculous than these earbuds are perfect. No they're not top sound quality top noise canceling, top battery life. They are good everywhere. Let's hope 1More is the company that finally drives true innovation in the earbuds market regarding fit and size. Based on price feature set, fit and sound quality the Comfo buds mini have made all my other buds obsolete. My Samsung buds pro, My sound core Liberty pro 3s no longer have a place in my day. I just ordered the Galaxy s23 ultra and in the deal was included a set of Samsung Galaxy buds pro 2. I will update this review once I get my hands on them.My guess is they will be much larger and not have such overwhelming sound quality, ANC and battery life to overtake the 1More Comfo Buds minis. I finally having a full featured small set of earbuds that Make them very convenient for day-to-day use. Let's not forget you can get two or three pairs of these for the price of the "high end" brands. If you are a person with common sense you will love these buds. Let's be honest the majority of negative reviews come from people who see themselves as experts , love to talk detailed acronyms and technical statistics or those who don't quite understand how to use the product. FACT earbud size and fit is the number one failure across the earbud market. IMO 1More realized this simple obvious fact and provided a great product at a great price. As stated before let's hope all earbud manufacturers follow their lead. It's 2023! Manufacturing processes and the technology is there for all manufacturers to create a small size product with all features.

title: 4.0 out of 5 stars Common issues people experiene are easily fixed and avoidable
author: Evan Reeves-Fortney
content: These are really great earbuds, especially for their size.There are common issues that people run into, which have them replacing the buds using the warranty over and over again before giving up and saying the earbuds seem to suffer from poor quality control or cheap components which fail after a few weeks or months.These issues are a high pitch squeaking noise, and very low volume or no sound. These issues can occur in one side only, or both sides.All you have to do is clean the metal mesh, it's become clogged with your earwax. Trust me, I guarantee that is what the problem is. You have to unclog all the little holes, I used a bristle from a brush which was thin enough to fit. The holes are very tiny.You might start to have volume issues with an earbud not being as loud as the other. It's the holes getting clogged. Once they're all clogged up, you won't be able to hear anything except a very quiet, constant, white noise.The screeching noise occurs when trying to use active noise canceling, while the metal screen is clogged. Don't ask me why, I'm not an expert, but for some reason that's what happens when the mesh is plugged up and you switch to ANC mode. The problem will be completely fixed once you clear out all those tiny holes.Tons of people report these issues occurring after about a month of use, and exchanging them only to run into similar issues with the new pair. It's not the earbuds, it's you. You've got gunk in your ears. You can prevent running into these problems by making sure your ears are clean before using them, cleaning off any earwax after you take them out and before putting them back in the case, and making sure the part of the case where the buds go is clean as well. If you do those three things, you won't end up with clogged up earbuds.

If I turn them on to listen to something it‚Äôs been fine, but when it comes to leaving them out or nearby or in my pocket not in the case they seem to have a mind of their own. I do not have my phone set up for voice control but these earbuds somehow activate it on and it has called random people in my contact list. It even contacted someone on my blocked list. I have an iPhone 10 so I just recommend if you‚Äôre using them on your phone to put them in case when not in use so it will shut them off.

title: 5.0 out of 5 stars Ignore the first video review, I love these!
author: John Weaver
content: I was able to snag these on sale for $85. They are definitely the most comfortable and so far THE ONLY pair of earbuds I've forgotten they were in my ear. They don't wiggle loose which is fantastic. I tried to originally put Spin fit tips on these, but they would not fit in the case. The case is very shallow for the eartips, so you have to use what comes in the box. There is 4 sizes, so you should be to find a good fit. No sound quality is not fantastic, but I'm also not paying $300 for audiophile earbuds. The case has a great feel in the hand. It has a sturdy fell to it and the case lid is held by a magnet. I dropped them before I even put them on and the buds didn't go flying. It's how I lost the last 2 pairs of galaxy buds2. Ignore the first video review and get you a pair! Only complaint is no equalizer. There's a cool AI equalizer, but I wish I could refine it further. Only other complain is that the Large eartip ripped trying to put it on the earbud. I struggled putting them on, but Amazon support got my problem solved. Great buy!

title: 4.0 out of 5 stars Good value. Small profile. Squeaks can be fixed.

content: Happy with these. Good sound and ANC for price. Low profile and comfy. Lasting battery. Ordered Sept 25, received 27, left bud stopped working October 30. Deleted app and installed and all seems fine again.These are small so super comfortable, but note that you have to use the silicon covers that come with the buds; standard covers will not fit (you cannot close charging cover)....Eight months in and I suddenly had drastically lowered volume, then squeaking if I tried the noise cancellation. title: 1.0 out of 5 stars Completely unreliable
author: Skirkwo2
content: I would recommend looking elsewhere for earbuds unless it absolutely has to be these. From a technical perspective battery life, sound quality, and reliability were my major issues. I knew the batteries lasted less than 8 hours with anc on but personally think 8 hours needs to be the target to get you through long haul flights. Then comes the audio quality which is good but not great they do have an app to adjust the equalizer, though not directly, and it did make it sound better to my ears but still fell a bit flat. The final issue that I have gone through 2 pair in less than a month. It starts off as a low hum/click in the left ear bud when anc or passthrough are active that gets worse over time. It is low and might be missed by many but if you go through the reviews you will find others reporting the same issue. It appears many people either don‚Äôt have this problem or it doesn‚Äôt bother them so you might get lucky but at the MSRP it wouldn‚Äôt be worth the risk for me.On the positive side these buds are the smallest I have ever tried and I love them for that.m. Other than the slight ear pressure I have forgotten they are in. I also have found the ANC is reasonable but don‚Äôt perform anywhere close the Sony xm2 headphones. I would say they fall in the middle of the pack of noise canceling headphones nothing to special but nothing to complain about.Overall, because of the prevalent quality issue that exists in late 2022/early 2023 and my personal experiences, I give this a solid one star but would be back to try a version 2 because they have a unique product and quite a bit of potential.

title: 2.0 out of 5 stars Left ear bud died on 2 different pairs of earbuds
author: JReimer
content: I got these earbuds as a Christmas gift. I confirmed this by putting the earbuds in the opposite ears to confim the issue wasn't with me and also tested wired earbuds to check the phone audio. I assumed that I must have gotten a bad pair of earbuds and returned them and got a replacement pair.Well now after a month of use again the replacement pair is exhibiting the same exact issue! The sound difference is even greater than before. I have no idea why this same exact issue happened and why both happened after just about a month of normal use.I'm assuming this issue can't be happening to all pairs of these earbuds otherwise I'd expect there to be considerably more negative reviews. product_name: JBL Tune 230NC TWS - Noise Cancelling Wireless Earbuds

title: 5.0 out of 5 stars Amazing sound quality
author: Amazon Customer
content: This review is representative of my first impressions after receiving the item.Fit - 4/5: While I've had better fitting earbuds in the past, I would say that these aren't problematic at all, but not perfect either. The buds fit fairly snugly in my ears, and its quite nice that they've included a few tips. They don't seem to move around if I shake my head, so I have decent confidence that if I take them to the gym or on a run, I wouldn't have problems. That said, they don't quite fit perfectly, but everyones ear is a bit different so others might find it better or worse.Sound - 5/5: All I can say is wow do I love the sound that these produce. The level of bass is far beyond anything that I've had from my other earbuds (Jabra Elite 65t and Jlabs JBuds Air). The app includes equalizer settings that actually make quite a lot of difference (unlike other headphone apps I have used) and I am blown away by how much bass can come from these headphones. I have also noticed with other wireless buds that they tend to be on the quiet side, not reaching the same volume that my larger Sony headphones can, but that is not at all the case here. These get LOUD. As someone who plans to mainly use these for workouts, this is exactly what I hoped for.Battery - 5/5: So far I have not had a chance to use these until they die, so I have to disclaim that. However, if the battery matches up or comes close to their claims, which I expect they will given it is a reputable brand, then I will be impressed. My other buds max out at around 8 hours, so getting almost 4x the total battery life is excellent. 8 hours without recharging is very impressive.Look and feel - 3/5: The case looks nice and I think the aesthetics are fine. But the buds themselves are polished smooth, which makes them a bit tricky to handle with your fingertips. Once they're in, its no problem. But a matte finish or some texture would have been better for usability.I'll update this review if I find any reason to, but I am extremely impressed by the headphones, especially for the price point. Highly recommend!
timestamp: Reviewed in the United States July 19, 2024

title: 5.0 out of 5 stars At 50% or more off, these are great.
author: Dru Ha
content: I have one pair for work and one for home/going out. I wouldn‚Äôt have spent $100 on each pair but at $50 per pair they‚Äôre a good deal.The ANC is pretty impressive for little earbuds. Makes the background sounds in an IHOP at 9:30 on a Sunday nearly disappear. They also eliminate the sound of snoring dogs and humans.Took a recent trip on an airplane and opted to bring these instead of my Sennheiser Momentum 3‚Äôs. I‚Äôm an audiophile on a budget. They can‚Äôt compete with the over-ear Momentum for sound reproduction. But for earbuds they‚Äôre a great product at the sale price.There is a JBL app you can download to your smartphone but the controls are reasonably intuitive. I have big fingers so I probably miss the sweet-spot for function control more than the average person. I‚Äôve found the bass to be a little lacking but I think that‚Äôs due to the EQ setting I‚Äôve selected. You do have some EQ presets to choose between in the app.They come with three sets of the rubber earplugs for various sizes of ear-canals. Medium worked for me. I can use them to sleep, travel, shut out the loud noises in restaurants, and for Zoom calls.Consider the color you want to stand out against your bedding when they fall out if falling asleep with them in.I like them enough that I bought a second, dedicated pair for work.The ANC has three settings but so far I haven‚Äôt found one that totally mutes audio output from your device in the ‚Äúambient-aware‚Äù or ‚Äútalk through‚Äù modes. That‚Äôs a feature I like on my Momentum. It can be accomplished by the extra step of just pausing playback with a tap on the right, then tap the left to toggle through the three ANC modes.They work great with an iPhone as well as Windows 10/11 computers.Much greater clarity the the JLAB go, which don‚Äôt seem to have any functional ANC. I should have spent the extra money at the get-go.Buy them when on sale. They‚Äôll probably be fine for you.If ANC and a variety of EQ options are the most important features for you, spring for the current $300 - $400 Sony over-ears. I have a pair of those in the house-too. Their ANC is better but for the music I listen to the Sennheisers are #1. However I would recommend the Sonys for over-ear for the average listener and these for travel, etc. it‚Äôs a lot harder to lose a big set of cans than earbuds so I don‚Äôt want to invest too much in these little guys.JBL has always served me pretty well for the price in the pro-audio and live sound amplification area so I had some confidence in the name when I bought these.

product_name: JBL Tune 230NC TWS - Noise Cancelling Wireless Earbuds

title: 5.0 out of 5 stars Wow, these are good sounding earbuds
author: Mike
content: There are review sites around that test headphones and earbuds and as far accuracy in frequency response and imaging, these earbuds outrank most other brand's more expensive earbuds.I have the JBL Tune 600BTNC headphones which are a great over the ear headphones and these earbuds sound just as good and even a bit clearer. That's hard to do. Both, these 230NC and the 600BTNC have bass between 20Hz and 100Hz elevated by 3db to 5db, the 230NC being a bit more accurate. That's Ok because I like my bass a few decibels higher.These earbuds have really good punch as well as ultra low bass down to 20HZ. Comparing these 230NC to your subwoofer is a great way to see how good or weak your subwoofer is. Since these 230NC earbuds are accurate from 20Hz to 60Hz within 1db or +4db above 100Hz, most subwoofers can't provide the bass these earbuds can.The clarity in the midrange and treble is great, and without elevation to make music sound bright and fatiguing.I have tried the JBL Club Pro Plus and Tune 125TWS and neither would seal correctly or be comfortable to wear more than 10 minutes. Mainly because of the big club at the end of the actual ear piece. Those earbuds don't fit good in every ear because they are big. The 230NC doesn't have club at the end of the earpiece but a small thin stalk like most "wired" earbuds that fit everyone good. These 230NC with their long thin stalks fit my ears good and seal good, plus they are actually more comfortable than my 600BTNC headphones. The Club Pro Plus actually hurt my ears and left them in pain for an hour after only wearing them for 10 minutes.These 230NC earbuds sound great, seal good, and are comfortable enough to wear for hours. I don't see doing any better than some $300 earbuds or headphone for sound quality.The one thing they fall down in and so do my 600BTNC is that they use the lower class active noise cancelling instead of the adaptive noise canceling. Honestly they sound great even in a noisy plant with the active noise cancelling.For the price slashing Amazon does to the retail price, they are a bargain IMO.The only thing I wish they had was function to test if they are sealed correctly like the Club Pro Plus had in it's app. That way you know you are getting the maximum bass response that these earbuds can produce. I simply test using music with ultra low bass that I'm very familiar with.
timestamp: Reviewed in the United States February 7, 2023
product_name: JBL Tune 230NC TWS - Noise Cancelling Wireless Earbuds

title: 4.0 out of 5 stars A satisfactory pair of earbuds with a decent attempt at noise cancellation
author: Tonigiri
content: In this review, I will compare the jbl 230 nc wireless earbuds with some of the best wireless earbuds of 2023, based on four criteria: noise cancellation, sound quality, battery life, and design.Noise cancellation: The jbl 230 nc wireless earbuds have active noise cancellation, which works well in most situations, but may not be effective in very loud environments. The Sony WF-1000XM5 wireless earbuds are the best in this category, with outstanding noise-canceling performance that adapts to your surroundings and personal preferences. The Bose QuietComfort Earbuds 2 are also excellent, with adjustable noise cancellation levels and a transparency mode. The Apple AirPods Pro 2 is another good option, with effective noise cancellation and spatial audio support.Sound quality: The jbl 230 nc wireless earbuds deliver a decent sound quality, with a balanced and clear output. However, they may not satisfy audiophiles who prefer a more detailed and dynamic sound. The Technics EAH-AZ80 wireless earbuds are the best in this category in my opinion, with a superb sound quality that rivals some of the best over-ear headphones. They have a rich and balanced sound signature, with deep bass, clear mids, and crisp highs. They also support high-resolution audio codecs and have a dedicated app for EQ customization. The Sony WF-1000XM5 wireless earbuds are also great, with a dynamic and engaging sound that can be tweaked via the Sony Headphones Connect app. The Bose QuietComfort Earbuds 2 are also impressive, with a top-notch sound quality that is well-balanced and natural. Keep in mind that the jbl 230 nc sits in a very different price point than the earbuds above so it's still punching way above its weight in this regard.Battery life: The jbl 230 nc wireless earbuds have a battery life of about four hours, which is average for wireless earbuds. They come with a charging case that can provide an additional 12 hours of playback. The Sony WF-1000XM5 wireless earbuds are the best in this category, with a battery life of up to eight hours with noise cancellation on, and up to 24 hours with the charging case. They also have a quick charge feature that can give you an hour of listening time with just 10 minutes of charging. The Apple AirPods Pro 2 are also good, with a battery life of up to six hours with noise cancellation on, and up to 30 hours with the charging case. They also support wireless charging and have a fast charge feature that can give you an hour of listening time with just five minutes of charging.Design: The jbl 230 nc wireless earbuds have a simple and sleek design, with a matte black finish and a jbl logo on each earbud. They are lightweight and comfortable to wear, with three sizes of silicone ear tips to choose from. They are also water-resistant, which means they can withstand sweat and rain. The Apple AirPods Pro 2 is the best in this category, with a sleek and ergonomic design that fits snugly in your ears. They have an open design without tips, which means they don't block out the outside sound completely. They also have force sensors on each stem that let you control music playback, calls, noise cancellation, and voice assistants. The Beats Fit Pro wireless earbuds are also stylish and comfortable, with a winged design that keeps them secure in your ears. They have an IPX4 rating for water resistance and have touch controls on each earbud.Conclusion: The jbl 230 nc wireless earbuds are a decent pair of headphones for casual listeners who want to escape the noise of the world. However, they are not the best in any category, and they face stiff competition from other models that offer better performance and features. If you want the best noise cancellation, sound quality, battery life, or design, you may want to consider other options such as the Sony WF-1000XM5, the Technics EAH-AZ80, the Bose QuietComfort Earbuds 2, or the Apple AirPods Pro 2. At this price point however, which is often lower (I bought mine on sale for 50% off), the jbl 230 nc is a no-brainer and will give you a value you can't say no to.

content: I bought these to replace my skullcandy sesh Evo. I had the skillcandy for over a year & recently I lost the left bud & then the right ear bud decided it was gonna be finicky about charging. When I woke up this morning I went to use the left one & the app said it only had 20% battery even though it was in the charger all night. In messing with them I realized even in the case the left was still connected & playing. I finally got it to connect to the charger & work properly. But I feel like it shouldn't be this difficult. It's not rocket science placing the ear buds in the case. I am using these for music, podcasts, & watching shows. The sound is great. I haven't made calls with them. title: 4.0 out of 5 stars Best battery life, Great noise cancelling, awkward fit in case
author: N8
content: I have only used wired headphones for years. This is the first time I've ever purchased Bluetooth wireless ear buds - so, know going forwards that I don't have anything to compare these to.That being said, I do have a few pairs of Bluetooth wireless headphones, and I'm making some assumptions, based upon these.So, the first thing I'll say is that the Noise Canceling feature in these is downright amazing. I mean, for something so small to be able to block out so much noise is just quite unbelievable.In addition, the Ambient Aware mode is quite amazing as well, as you can literally hear everything around you, while still hearing the music quite clearly - you can tell that a lot of R & D went into these.The Talk Through mode is also good - although I think it makes the music so low that you really can't even hear it - but it is handy in case you need to have a conversation. I've had a conversation with Ambient Aware mode turned on, and I can hear the other person just fine.Okay, here is where I'll start making some assumptions. I don't have another pair of BT earbuds to compare to, so I'm assuming that other companies would create apps similar to the ones for their BT headphones when making apps for their ear buds.The JBL app is my favorite one. It's very easy to get into, has some settings you can change (like what each ear bud does when you touch it certain ways), as well as allows you to change the audio mode that you've enabled.Now, I have a pair of Anker BT headphones, and they are really comfy, but the app is nowhere near as feature-rich as the JBL app is.I guess if there is anything that I don't like about these it would be the inability to turn them off without using the app. You can set them to time out after a set amount of time, so they would turn themselves off at some point, but I think that is a waste of the battery, so I use the app to turn them off.Another thing I don't like is the case - the ear buds fit into it in a very awkward way - I'm always having to twist my wrists to get them in correctly. I think this was a major design flaw, but it's minor compared to all the other benefits of these.One thing I absolutely love on these is the battery. I've used these for about an hour, turned them off (via the app), kept them outside of the case, and come back to them a month later, and they are still at the same battery percentage as a month ago - unbelievable.I should also mention that the battery lasts a fair amount of time when actually listening to them. I use these when working out, and they last plenty of time for me to run and lift weights.I've never actually tried to figure out exactly how long they last on one charge, but if I'd have to guess, it's probably upwards of 5 hrs at least.To save battery power, I usually put mine in a ziplock bag, along with the case - so that the battery gets to run-down without being recharged all the time. I only put them back into the case when the battery is actually low.The case also charges very quickly (as do the ear buds as well).So, overall, I'd highly recommend these ear buds. They have some minor issues that I've discussed, but in my opinion, the pro's far outweigh the con's for these.If you found this review helpful, please click on "helpful" or the thumb's up.Thanks.

title: 3.0 out of 5 stars Not good for motorcycle use, but excellent sound quality.
author: Jeffrey Jenkins
content: I bought these in an attempt to improve upon the mediocre sound quality of the "MiPeace" earbuds I've been using on my motorcycle for about a year now, and in that respect the JBL did not disappoint - these really are quite good sounding (almost as good as my old Etymotic ER-6 wired earbuds). Sitting on my bike with the engine running but not moving the active noise cancellation seemed to work very well - I couldn't hear the engine at all, actually - but once I started moving things weren't quite so rosy. It seems the active noise cancellation is just a tad too slow to respond to wind buffeting noise because the music is horribly distorted as if one is listening to speakers through the spinning blades of a fan. Unfortunately, with the active noise cancellation turned off the silicone cup style earplugs don't do near as good a job of passively blocking ambient sounds as the silicone triple-rib style earplugs on the MiPeace (or the Elgin's I replaced these with), so I reluctantly returned them.

(The Apple earbuds just turn off, so there‚Äôs no jarring loud beep in your ears.) This is especially annoying when it happens in the middle of a song.- This one is weird ‚Äî If you hold the two earbuds in your hand, and they touch in a certain way, it makes a loud chirping noise. (Almost like the feedback of two microphones being too close together.)- They‚Äôre kind of bulky, and fall out of my ears more often than the Apple AirPods did. Even after changing the rubber tips. (The bright side is that because they‚Äôre so bulky, they‚Äôre easier to find on the ground.)- Though you can use the JBL app to find your earbuds, it doesn‚Äôt help you find the charging chase.Conclusion:- For $50, I‚Äôll keep ‚Äòem! The sound quality is truly excellent enough to look past the weird quirks.And if they get lost, as most earbuds often do, it won‚Äôt break my wallet to do so. (The Apple ones are comfy and have less quirks, but kind of overrated at that price point.)So I would buy JBL earbuds again ‚Äî though I might look into the smaller models, that maybe (hopefully) aren‚Äôt as prone to pop out of the ear like a cartoon bean.

title: 3.0 out of 5 stars Disappointing
author: Ken
content: There are several things I like about the JBL 230. The sound quality is pretty good and the noise cancelling is excellent for this price range. So, if you're in a noisy office or work environment, these may work for you. The battery life is great, and the JBL app provides a good equalizer for customizing your sound. I love the blue color, and the touch controls work, even if finding that "sweet" spot takes a bit of practice.What I don't like is that every time you put the earbuds in, they start in the "Ambient Aware" mode (sounds around you are amplified). It's great, if you want to hear what Margret down in accounting thinks about Bob's new haircut from across the room, but I hate it. I'm typically putting in earbuds to block out the sound around me, not to make it louder. Plus, the Ambient Aware function uses battery life. I'd much rather have the ability to start in a "normal" (non-amplified) setting, but that's not available. You have to start with them active and either open up the app to turn it off or set the buds to use a touch feature to turn it off (meaning you can't use the touch feature to control your music, change volume or anything else).My second gripe is around the microphones and wind. Any slight breeze makes it impossible for you to be heard at the other end of a phone call. I'm often outside and I simply can't make phone calls if there's a breeze. Likewise, driving with the windows down while on the phone is a no-go. The wind drowns out everything else. If you happen to have Ambient Aware turned on (remember, it's the default?), it amplifies that wind noise in your ears, as well, even if you're not on the phone. This is a real deal breaker, and everyone from Apple to Samsung and Sony do a much better job of limiting wind noise on phone calls with their buds.There are other minor things. The buds are very lightweight, which is good, but they stick a little too far out of my ear, so they're always getting knocked loose. They sit in the case with the speakers facing outward, so you always have to turn them around when taking them out or putting them away, since most people are designed with their ear canals going *in* to their heads (this design makes zero sense). The app is slow to load. You can't do anything in the app until it finds and connects to your buds, so you have to have at least one bud in to use the app for anything, which is weird (I can't even view the app right now to tell you about it because my buds are at home, so the app won't open), and many app features aren't accessible unless you have both buds in.I really wanted to like these, but the inability to use them in 90% of the cases I want them just makes them worthless to me.

title: 4.0 out of 5 stars Nice sound quality, terrible case
author: Izabella
content: Usually I wouldn't take off an entire star for something as seemingly mere as the case, but I am with these earbuds. This case is so slippery. I am someone very mindful of my electronics and have never so much as cracked a phone screen, but I can't even count how many times this case has just slipped out of my hands or off of a surface. The charging lights on the case have began to malfunction. I like these earbuds, but I would recommend storing the case in a pouch or something with a little more grip to it.As for the earbuds themselves, they're great. I've had them for a year now and they work wonderfully. The audio quality is great, not the best but worth the price. They fit into my ears wonderfully and don't slip out easily which is quite rare for me. The Bluetooth range also seems to be quite large and I never have issues with that.One other thing is that the battery has definitely dwindled rapidly in the past year, but I use these earbuds everyday for at least a few hours, so that's to be expected. I don't mind charging them more often. The earbuds themselves still last about five to seven hours on a full charge, which is absolutely perfect for me.I like these earbuds a lot. I've never disliked a JBL product, really. I just wish the case wasn't so slick.

title: 3.0 out of 5 stars Ambient Aware white noise
author: Adam
content: Edit: Dropping original 5/5 for both earbuds to 3.5/5. Connectivity problems occasionally. I had the microphone just straight up gave up in the middle of a call and had to restart my computer to get it back to work again, unpair and pair didn't work. Occasionally, they randomly disconnect for a second or so, like every couple of hours on average. When that happens, there's a chance for one ear bud to be slightly delayed than the other, and has to unpair and pair to fix.If you use both earbuds all the time, then it's great for $50-60. 5/5Comfortably fit in my ears and don't fall out much when jogging. They'll still fall out when the moving is too much, but that's unavoidable in any earbuds like this. ANC works wonders. The sound quality is good for the price. Microphone is hit and miss like every other earbud out there, but generally works well.If you ever use just the right earbud, then it's awful. 0/5The ambient aware gives out a very audible white noise all the time. And it will automatically be turned on if you only use the right earbud. You cannot turn it off because the ambient aware setting is on the left earbud only. You can only turn that off in the phone app. But if the earbud is not connected to the phone, then you can't change it.One work around is to go to the phone app and let both earbud to have the ambient aware on off functions, but you will lose the right earbud's play/pause function. And you need to turn it off every single time you use it.The connection chime and setting change chimes are extremely loud and I can't find a way to lower the volume. So that's further annoyance. This applies to both single and both earbuds modes.I personally hate these and will be returning the earbuds. Such a shame.

title: 5.0 out of 5 stars Purchased for watching TV without disturbing others.
author: brian
content: This is my first Bluetooth listening device, thou not my first JBL product purchase. That would be a pair of L26 speakers, I purchased on lay-a-way, when I was 16, back in 1976 for $875. That would be over $6000 in 2023 dollars. Later I purchased JBL's J2050 Book-Shelf speakers and later still JBL's Media 100 Desk-Top speakers. I guess you would say, I would recommend JBL products, since I've had a 48 year relationship with their brand.I was on the brink of returning the JBL Tune 230NC TWS True Wireless In-Ear Noise Cancelling Ear-Buds but decided to contact JBL Customer support, to find out why I was unable to connect my ear-buds to my TV. I submitted a fairly detailed explanation, sufficient for their support staff to realize I was already paired to my phone. So I learned that ear-buds come in single-pairing and multi-point-pairing. The JBL Tune 230NC TWS True Wireless In-Ear Noise Cancelling Ear-Buds are single-pairing, which is just fine for me. These ear-buds can be very immersive, watching TV or Listening to music. The noise cancellation does a nice job of muffling surrounding noise. I had taken them with me on walks to listen to music or books-recordings and I became a bit concerned at how much of the sound around me was deadened. You then have to keep your head on a swivel.As these are my first ear-buds, I don't know if this is common but while out for a walk, the microphone ports, built into the ear-buds, pick up and transmit the sound of the wind scouring the microphone ports.

content: I looked all over the internet for wireless earbuds that are actually affordable (less than $30) and work well overall, and I found these! after having them for about a year, i can confidently say these are perfect (for me and maybe you)(1) they have a small case meaning its easy to take anywhere(2) the whole case and buds have magnets meaning nothing with pop out if you drop it from a short distance (they will if its at a higher distance but ultimately these are reliable)(3) because they are wireless, small and black, im able to wear these in class under my hair without my teacher knowing(4) the charging cable is great as i can charge it anywhere without needing an extra cable(5) the price is great for the quality(6) these are super easy to use (with the taps and stuff found in the manual given)(7) the battery life is amazing (takes less than 2 hours to fully charge the case and it lasts me like 5 days)(8) its practical (i can use the buds separately to extend the battery life and they rarely fall from my ear)(9) it does have some noise cancellation and the sound doesn't escape (just make sure not to blast it)(10) you can easily connect it to multiple devicesalso cause im lowkey a clumsy person, ive dropped these like 30 times so i ended up killing the left bud, but the right one still worked (how?)
