title: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great sound at a good price
author: Ben W.
content: I recently lost my AirPods on a trip and was looking for something to replace them. I didn‚Äôt want to pay what they wanted for the AirPod pros and I wasn‚Äôt really impressed with the sound quality of the AirPods, so I went looking for the best sounding sub 130$ wireless earbuds I could find. I settled on the CXs and received them today. I‚Äôll get to the sound quality at the end but first let me go over some other aspects. The set up was extremely simple, there are clear directions, I just pulled them out of the box removed the very obvious and labeled plastic covers on the battery contacts and then charged the earbuds for about an hour. Once they were charged they paired with my iPhone no problem I also downloaded the app which worked without issue. The fit is slightly less comfortable then the AirPods however they are not uncomfortable and feel quite secure. These buds lack ANC however I don‚Äôt think that will be an issue as they are very effective at blocking outside noise. The touch controls are intuitive and work smoothly. So far I have used them both together and one at a time and have taken them in and out of the case and have no issue with connectivity, you do have to reconnect to the app if you disconnect from Bluetooth however the app does have to be running for the earbuds to work, only if you want to run the equalizer also reconnecting to the app is very simple. The only ‚Äúissue‚Äù I have had so far is when I updated the firmware; everything went fine however be prepared to have your phone and earbuds tied up for about 40 minutes while the firmware updates; during this process the app needs to stay open and the earbuds need to be close to the phone. It‚Äôs a little nerve racking because I was worried if for some reason the update was interrupted it could brick the earbuds, that being said it went fine just took a long time(the app does give a fairly accurate countdown so that helps a little). So how do they sound? There is no doubt these are the best sounding pair of earbuds I have personally heard in my life. I‚Äôve owned the AirPods, the Jabra 65t, first generation beats, and a couple different Chinese pairs; none of those are even in the same category. These where the first earbuds I‚Äôve had that do not sound like music is just being pumped into my ear canals; the music sounds like it‚Äôs naturally coming from the surroundings. Every instrument and vocal track are clear and separate. The bass and treble sound great and balanced and if you really like pronounced bass you can turn it up in the equalizer and it thumps. It‚Äôs really hard for me to overstate how awesome the sound is, I listened to a few songs that are now in lossless Dolby atmos on Apple Music and it‚Äôs nothing short of incredible. The best metaphor I can think of is all of my old earbuds were like Standard definition and these are 4K. So if your looking for the best sound for your money and probably the best sound for under 200$ these are the way to go.

title: 4.0 out of 5 stars Solid choice for ear buds
author: Crotorious
content: I've used these ear buds for almost 2 years and strongly considered re-buying them once I started facing issues. When it comes to sound quality, they're good, and the latency is small, but you'll notice it's there. The best part of these ear buds has to be the battery life; these things last all day, and can be fully charged back up twice with the case. Though if you're looking for something with strong noise cancellation, you might want to consider looking for a different pair of ear buds, as these are really only capable of blocking out most speech. Overall, they're a pretty good pair of ear buds, but I do have a few problems with them.First, when they get to low battery, the text to speech voice will say "Recharge headset" just frequently enough to become mildly vexing. This is my primary complaint about these ear buds.Now mind you, I haven't treated these ear buds very well, they went through constant abuse and were used in sub-optimal environments the entire time I've owned them. The next two complaints are likely a result of my poor treatment of these.Second, after about two years of use, their connectivity isn't as great anymore; the range in which I can use these has dropped considerably. I used to be able to walk in my backyard without issues, but now I can barely leave the room without the connection dropping constantly.Lastly, the left earbud has recently developed a problem with connecting to the case; it seems the leads just don't connect half the time. This occasionally causes small inconveniences with the left ear bud turning on in the case and randomly hijacking the audio output of my pc, or it just doesn't end up charging and I'm stuck with a single ear bud until I manage to get it to charge again.Overall, this is a pretty good product. I'd recommend it to anyone who needs a pair of long-lasting wireless earbuds and doesn't need the best sound quality or noise cancellation.

title: 1.0 out of 5 stars Only really lasted 8 months
author: Jake Boop
content: Edit: originally rated 1 star as the earbuds that I received were open-box/used. I don‚Äôt think it‚Äôs fair to Sennheiser that my 1 star rating remains on here because that was a fault of Amazon. These earbuds sound great. Absolutely great. The connection seems to be good so far as well (I‚Äôve seen a lot of negative reviews saying otherwise). They are very comfortable for my ears, I‚Äôm a Tool Maker/machinist and wear an earbud in one ear I all day and other earbuds that I‚Äôve tried get uncomfortable or start to fall out but I have had no issues with fit at all. As far as the features on the app: the equalization is only a 3-band eq which is a shame, I‚Äôd much rather at least a 5 or 7-band eq but it‚Äôs better than nothing for sure. The side tone feature is supposed to use the mic to feed into the speaker, allowing you to hear outside talking, but it doesn‚Äôt seem to really work at all. I haven‚Äôt tested a phone call using them yet so maybe my mic is defective but I really wouldn‚Äôt care because I don‚Äôt need it. Overall this is a great pair of earbuds for the price.Original review: This item came in with the packaging already opened with another piece of tape over the original seal. The earbuds were covered in earwax and ear hair. Disgusting. If I wanted to buy an ‚Äúopen box/used‚Äù I would‚Äôve selected that option instead of paying full price for it.Edit 3/14/2023: it's been 8 months and the connectivity issues have been becoming a decent problem. I take them out of the case and they won't connect, so I put them back it and take them out again and usually they'll connect after the second try. But lately I've been having to re-pair them to my phone. I'll take them out of the case and instead of the usual "power on..... connected" notification, it's just silence. And it's not as simple as just re-pairing them because they won't go into pairing mode unless I reset them. The battery life is also taking a dive.I started out really loving these, now I've been very disappointed because they're just such a hassle to deal with. With all of this, especially only being 8 months of use, I'm going to have to update my review from 5 stars to 2.Edit 7/17/2023: the right earbud just stopped working all together, it'll power on but refuses to connect to BluetoothEdit 1/24/2024: I've been trying to get as much use out of these just to justify the amount I spent on them before I replace them but all it has really given me is issues with connectivity and reliability. I expect any earbuds at this price range to last years, I should have no problem getting the same life out of earbuds that you would expect from a phone. I wish I would've just either returned them or thrown them away a long time ago. I'm going to start looking into replacements now. Adjusting my 2 star rating to a 1 star.

title: 5.0 out of 5 stars Comparison with Momentum TW
author: Steve Kranyec
content: I have a pair of CX's that are about 1.5 years old, and another set that I just recently purchased. In the middle, I have a pair of Momentum TW 3's that are ~6 months old. The TLDR here is that instead of repurchasing the Momentum, I got another pair of the CX's.I'm not an audiophile, and I mostly listen to audiobooks and make calls with earbuds, so I'm not going to be speaking to audio quality at all. For me, it's fine.My six month old Momentum's have a dead left earbud. Possibly this is anecdotal, but if anything I was more gentle with the Momentum's than the CX's, and the CX's have lasted three times as long. Yes, I drop them. Yes, the dead left Momentum died after the most recent drop. I'm not saying that earbuds should survive infinite drops, but in my experience, the CX's are more durable.I did really really like the ANC on the Momentum's. It killed the battery life, but when you need ANC, it was great to have. The pass-through audio was also awesome. It was almost like having a mini-hearing-aide.The CX's have been substantially less finicky than the Momentum. They connect quicker, I've had to reset them fewer times, and they seem to have better range.Between the (substantial) difference in price and the areas where the CX's are superior, I my opinion, the CX's are the better option. If dropping $150 every six months on earbuds is within your budget, I fully endorse the Momentums. For me, I need to have two working sets around at any given time as I wear them a substantial amount of my waking hours, so I'd rather swap to an overear model when I need ANC and go with the cheaper and more durable option.Quick recommendation -- splurge on the foam eartips. If you're like me and wear earbuds an unhealthy amount of time, they're substantially more comfortable. They do wear out, and they're not cheap, but the added comfort for long-wears is huge.

title: 3.0 out of 5 stars Good sound, Horrible mic for calls
author: billyillyilly
content: The good, these ear buds have a decent battery life, sit well in the ear without falling out (held with just the rubber insert), have good (not great) sound quality. A perfect example of the sound is with FFDP "A little bit off" which has extremely clean sound on a quality system. These ear buds lack the clean treble when the high hat hits and the deep tones of the bass. If you just want sound without worrying being an audiophile they're good.The bad, no noise cancelling... at all! During phone calls the mic is good in a quiet place. if there is ANY background noise, they will pick up that noise over your voice. I tried them multiple times in different cars and no matter the amount of road noise it drowned out my voice making conversations almost impossible unless I yelled. In an office environment the sound of the keyboard while typing would make conversation hard to understand for whoever was sorry enough to be on the other end of the call.I've been a Sennheiser fan for a long time and have had many of their headphones (still use some old wired buds CX100II for listening to music at work and love them), these are the first that I am returning due to be unusable for conversation.

title: 2.0 out of 5 stars Not quite what I expected
author: Michal D. Wisteria
content: So I'll start with the positive. The headphones are comfortable, the sound is great, and the battery life is pretty good too (supposed to be 9.5 hours, I got around 7). The bass felt great, skipping songs was a breeze, and the sound quality when answering calls on them was decent as well.The less great parts. After 6 1/2 hours or so, one headphone would die, usually the left one. Then the right would reconnect, and I could keep listening to things for a bit longer. But the biggest reason for the 2 star review is that my right earbud broke after about 11 months. I took good care of these headphones; they were usually in their case or in my ear. Last week I noticed the right earbud had no sound. I thought I just had to restart them and reconnect, but after a few tries of that I heard just hints of sound for half a second when moving the earbud in the ear, so I knew the audio wasn't working. But all the other features were. I could still pause, skip songs, etc with the right or left earbud. I went on my order page on Amazon and found the support section. There was a link to a product support site for Sannheiser... It was 404, page not found. There was a phone number too.... It was disconnected apparently. So now I have just a left side, good-sounding earbud.

title: 3.0 out of 5 stars Great sound, good physical construction outside. Elsewhere, not so much
author: Ben
content: I've owned a few pairs of earbuds, all wired. I prefer over-ear headphones, but needed something small, portable and more discreet for work.These looked decent and my past experiences with Sennheiser sound quality also helped make my decision at the time.Sound quality is excellent, overall noise isolation is pretty good for no ANC, bass mids and highs are all present and clear. I do own several pairs of studio/reference headphones, which these obviously don't compare to, but they do manage to make a good account of themselves. Battery lifespan is excellent too and despite no wireless charging (not that it was a deal breaker in my case) the case charged very quickly. Just would have been nice if the charging cable was longer than the dinky one supplied.I used the smallest set of ear cushions, these are decently comfortable for up to a couple hours but do start to press against my ears for longer periods.Construction quality of the case and buds is decent, not too heavy but not feather light either. It's a shame that doesn't go into the internal electronics.First off, the Bluetooth connectivity is not a win. These would repeatedly disconnect themselves when bringing them out of "sleep" always one or the other bud. The Sennheiser Smart Control App does allow customization of the buds controls and a graphic equalizer. But it would keep proclaiming it needed a update, even though it was the most up-to-date version.Now these, when they paired, sounded great. After using these for nearly a year, the right bud suddenly had an internal fault and produced flakey, weak sound. That was not a Bluetooth issue, but rather the hardware either failing on a circuit level or a wire becoming loose due to a cold solder joint. I've owned plenty of headphones that are more cheaply made than these with worse sound quality but still function as intended.Looking up this problem seems to be inherit with the CX True Wireless, with complaints occuring anywhere from a few months of ownership to nearly a year or more. Replacements from Sennheiser have been described as having a repeat issue after a similar period of time, or are merely DOA.Shame, this isn't the Sennheiser I knew. Time for a different pair from a different manufacturer. Why bother going through the hassle of dealing with Sennheiser support only to get the same problem again eventually?

title: 4.0 out of 5 stars Good BT earbuds
author: Photographer
content: I generally prefer over the ear headphones, but I use earbuds only when I am exercising or doing yardwork. I bought a pair of name brand earbuds that was on sale during BF. Long story short, I had to return it because the sound quality was unacceptable.Rather than trying to find a diamond in haystack so to speak, I picked Sennheiser as it is a brand that I have good experience with. Furthermore, I opted for a higher price point than the rock bottom price I was hoping for.I forgo noise cancelling since I don't need it most of the time. Sonically, this pair of earbuds is very good, bearing typical Sennheiser sound of open and balance. It is still no match for my over the ear headphones, but it is also significantly cheaper. Sound quality is by far the most important aspect, other features are distant seconds and thirds.BT connectivity is, however, not Sennheiser's strength. It took some work to get it connected to all of my devices; I have a pair of Sennheiser over the ear BT headphone that behaves similarly. All of my cheaper BT earbuds have no BT connectivity issues. This weakness is not a showstopper.

title: 4.0 out of 5 stars Sennheiser knows headphones
author: Baron
content: I had some Klipsch ear pods I had to return. Sure they had the metal case and metallic earbuds and all those sizes earbud tips but internal quality was bad a constant buzzing sound from a bad chip so I ordered a second pair still bad so returned both of them. I started think what headphones do I she that just simply worked no gimmicks no flash just pure bonafide Hi-Fi then j realized Sennheiser of course. When I bought these they had just come out no Amazon reviews but I took the chance cause I love my HD-25s and I haven‚Äôt looked back. I‚Äôm an engineer a job that requires focus by my office is smack dab in the middle of a factory floor full of loud noise forklifts , bulldozers firing up for test, people grinding metal , all of that on top of the normal office chatter and these headphones cut right through that while I work at my desk and get work done.Now yes these are 100% plastic but they don‚Äôt feel cheap and that plastic also means they don‚Äôt feel cold touching your skinYes they use standard ear bud tips which I was apprehensive about cause I‚Äôve had issue with those falling off or coming off in my ear but these are designed with an aggressive ridge to keep the tips attached to the headphone.No wireless charging but who cares it‚Äôs USB-C just plug it in at night and go about your day they last all my work dayAnd the sound is probably as good as it gets from reasonably priced Bluetooth earbuds so yeah no bass boomy but that‚Äôs inherent in the form factor bass requires big drivers and lots of power which kills your battery life and adds weight.Could you get better sound sure but why it‚Äôs Bluetooth off your phone into tiny battery powered earbuds so your quality is limited already so this is probably that sweet spot where diminishing marginal returns kicks in where you have to spend way more money or buy big Bluetooth headphones to get better soundIf you buy these as earbuds for work or travel where portability and battery life trumps fidelity then you‚Äôll love these if you expect fidelity similar to much pricier wired headphones you‚Äôll be disappointed but only because your expectations were unrealistic.0

title: 4.0 out of 5 stars Comprehensive rating: Sennheiser puts sound first (as usual)
author: Scott Herron
content: After years of using cheap-o headphones and dealing with cable noise, listening to music with the headphones feels like i'm hearing each song for the very first time. I'm hearing details in songs I never heard before, it honestly made me tear up. Incredibly clarity, customizable EQ, AMAZING sound for 100$. You could easily get something with comparable sound that costs twice as much. The sound is why I bought these. Sennheiser is a sound-focused brand. However, there are some places where these headphones cut corners that would not be a problem if you bought 200$+ dollar headphones.Security: I'm a dancer, and I want my headphones to stay on while I'm working in the studio. However, the earbuds aren't the most secure in my ears. They fly out during chain√©e turns, sometimes even just as I'm walking they'll fall out.Comfort: Not the most comfortable for hours of listening. After 2-3 hours of extended use, my ears ached. Changing up the plastic tips didn't help.Noise cancelling: I heard the ANC takes the edge off the sound quality, which is why I bought these and not the active noise cancelling ones. You can definitely tell. I can hear each step I take as I walk thudding in my ears. It's a little odd.Delay: I've tried to use these to watch tiktoks on my phone, and I've noticed a delay in the screen and the sound. I can see the person on my screen moving their mouth, but the words come out into my headphones a little later. It's not the worst, but it's noticeable.Overall: Great for audiophiles on a budget. The app allows you to customize, so there's something to love for everyone, whether you love a sparkling, bright treble or you're a total basshead. For sitting down and listening while you're at your computer, these are an excellent choice. If you're mainly wearing these for working out, maybe something else would suit your needs better. I do equal parts both, which is why I like these a lot. mp3 files can massacre the music quality, and bad headphones can make the sound even muddier. These are an excellent buy. I've had them for about a month, will update if something changes or I have issues.

title: 3.0 out of 5 stars Great sound quality, hounded by connectivity/app issues
author: Eric Notmyrealname
content: Great sound quality, hounded by electronics/connectivity issuesI‚Äôd give this 3.5 stars if I could. Having owned multiple headphones/earphones over the years this is product is in-line with Sennheiser ‚Äì great sound quality for the price (they lowered it), but you pay with electronics/wiring issues. This maybe the last Sennheiser product I get for a while, but not in a good way‚Ä¶Goal: Portable ‚Äúdo everything‚Äù earphones with good sound quality. I wanted to be able use them around the home: smartphone music, binging Netflix, work computer for Zoom calls, etc. I‚Äôd been using whatever generic thing $40 could get; this time I decided to splurge past $100 (purchased at was $130 w/ points).Pros:‚Ä¢ Sound quality. I‚Äôm not an audiophile, but I‚Äôve owned 10+ headphones/earphones, different brands. The sound is lively, bass is strong without being overwhelming.‚Ä¢ Case ‚Äì form factor is great! Fits in my pocket, doesn‚Äôt looks scuffed after many months of use.‚Ä¢ Battery life ‚Äì lasts for many hours before needing a charge. Could probably use it 2-3 days of regular use before getting a warning.‚Ä¢ Mic works ‚Äì gets the job done.‚Ä¢ Sennheiser app ‚Äì you can change what device it connects to and adjust EQ settings.Cons:‚Ä¢ Connectivity: atrocious. I‚Äôve had to soft reset / hard reset this too many times. Bluetooth isn‚Äôt a new technology. This should be ‚Äúset it and forget it.‚Äù * About 5% of the time, only 1 earphone connects. Disconnecting and reconnecting doesn‚Äôt do anything and I have to do a soft reset. * When using the app, it sometimes refuses to disconnect from the current device so I can connect to what the device I want. Real fun 3 minutes before your Zoom meeting! * Sometimes doesn‚Äôt ‚Äúremember‚Äù how to connect to specific device(s). I‚Äôve had to delete all pairings and reestablish connections twice so far in 9 months.‚Ä¢ App: clunky. Randomly asks to update the firmware ‚Äì no, Sennheiser! When I open this app, 99% of the time I want to switch devices! Do it right the first time!‚Ä¢ Features: this thing lacks soooo many features that exist on $40 earphones today. For this product not to have things like wireless charging, noise cancellation, connecting to multiple devices, the only thing I can think of is a paywall (greed: wanting to upsell a more expensive product).

title: 3.0 out of 5 stars Sound is good, shape is awkward
author: Jennifer C.
content: These earbuds have a really good sound. And I love that there is an equalizer in the app so you can adjust it to sound the way you want it. They offer a lot of cool features that apparently not all earbuds have. You can change what the different taps do, but they are capable of answering your phone, raising and lowering the volume, fast forwarding, rewinding, or skipping tracks of songs, pausing and playing - all just buy tapping on the earbuds. Even though it is not one of their advertised features, they also do a very good job of noise canceling as long as they fit in your ear properly.So here's the downside that I found... These earbuds are large and square. Most ears are pretty round. I realize that all ears are shaped differently, but I have a hard time believing that these fit comfortably in most ears. If you're just sitting still at your desk or in the car, it's not too bad. But if you smile really big, they come loose, and If you lean over, they fall out of your ear entirely. When the Stem is seated properly in your ear, The big square part rubs uncomfortably against the outer ear. For this reason alone I am debating whether to return these, or Just suffer with it since I mostly use them in the car or at work. These could be great earbuds if they were more organomically designed.One last note - I don't have a lot to compare it to. But they advertise that the battery life is superior on these, and i'm not convinced. Now I admit I had them running for most of an 8 hour workday. But I had to switch between the left ear and the right ear while one of them was charging in the case, i'd use the other one. So from my experience, I could not run both of them for 6 or 8 hours continuously.

title: 4.0 out of 5 stars I like them, but I‚Äôm not an audiophile
author: Matt Hersman
content: I have had these for a long while now and they‚Äôre one of the better pairs of earbuds I‚Äôve had. I have had pretty shoddy luck with headphones, but I had heard good things about this brand, so I thought I‚Äôd give them a go. Their sound is overall above average from what I‚Äôve listened to. They‚Äôre not super bassy like the Beats and Raycons I‚Äôve had, which in some ways are better. I think a lot of people‚Äôs problems with these is that they aren‚Äôt proper Audiophile material like some of Sennheiser‚Äôs other products, but if you‚Äôre looking for wireless buds, you probably aren‚Äôt really looking for the greatest sound on the market.I like the software that these use. The app lets you tweak the bass, mids and highs a bit so you can get get the sound a bit more to your liking. It also lets you switch between sources more easily than some other Bluetooth headphones.I will say that these aren‚Äôt the most ergonomic earbuds ever, they fit just fine normally, but if you try to sleep with them, or put any pressure on your ear with a hat or something, they really dig into your ears, but that‚Äôs a non issue to most people.The noise cancellation is decent, but I‚Äôm pretty sure there‚Äôs not any tech behind it like with the AirPods, I think these just plug up your ears so you don‚Äôt hear the outside noise, and they do that pretty well.The case is pretty good too. title: 2.0 out of 5 stars This one doesn't live up to the Sennheiser name
author: Nicky
content: I had a Sennheiser full over-the-ear headphones some years ago and was satisfied with it. I bought this one on Black Friday and have been using it for several days. I now have three pairs of earbuds: Apple AirPods, SkullCandy and this one, which took me the most time to pair and connect.1) The small paper guide conveniently didn't mention that a small film on the mental contact must be peeled off. The charging case showed green light after a couple hours charging but I couldn't get them to connect. It was only after researching the questions section that I learned about this step (so apparently others were confused too).2) The shape of the earbuds make it difficult to grab and pull them out of the charging case. Each time it takes more than one try.3) No indicator light on the front of earbuds themselves to show the battery level. My SkullCandy (much cheaper but equally good sound quality) has indicator light on the earbuds. It would become red to tell me to put it back in the charging case.4) To connect to a device for the first time is confusing. A YouTube clip tells me to watch the little light in the back to blink red/blue to indicate it's ready to pair/connect. But when I tried to connect with a second device (after disconnecting from the first one), it didn't blink. The guide shows to put fingers on the earbuds (after inserting into the ears) to put it in paring mode. The SkullCandy doesn't require any additional step: after the earbuds are taken out of the case, a voice tells you that it's ready to connect.5) It won't let you switch from one device to another easily. When I turn off the Bluetooth on my iPad and tried to switch to my cellphone (with earbuds still in my ears), I can't connect right away. I wound up having to put them back in the case and then take them out to connect to the second device (unlike SkullCandy, which stays in pairing mode and lets you connect to the 2nd device right away).All in all, It's not worth the value compared to a cheaper but better product like SkullCandy.Added 12/27/2022: Now that I‚Äôve used for more than three weeks (bought on Black Friday), I should downgrade the rating from my initial 3 stars to 2 stars. I finally managed to connect it with my laptop after several attempts but it seemed random and I still don‚Äôt know how it happened. And it happened several times that one of the earbuds would lose sound for no apparent reason while I was using them. I would need to take them out of my ears, put them back into the case, took them out to reconnect again. Or sometimes only one earbud got connected with the device after taking both out of the charging case. I would not buy it again.

title: 3.0 out of 5 stars Good at first
author: Nathan
content: So, I have bought alot of earbuds. In the last year I've probably got 5 pairs, because most of them share the same issue. Connection problem.Eventually most earbuds will start disconnecting from my phone, ToZo, ILuv, Senheiserner, ect ect...These earbuds are no exception.Now for the first two weeks these earbuds were perfect, they had great sound, great connectivity, the app worked without issue.But after week two, they started not connecting to my phone, sometimes they would cut out randomly, and I had to restart them. title: 3.0 out of 5 stars Not what I'd expect from Sennheiser...
author: Cody Groat
content: I bought these after I lost my JBL Live 300's. Was looking for something equally as good but for a bit cheaper. Stumbled across these and looked at some reviews. Flossy Carter's review is what gave me the go ahead, but boy was he wrong on this one.These are extremely cheaply made (case and earbuds feel horrible to the touch), the earbuds are uncomfortable to wear for more than 30 minutes, the sounds quality is nothing as you'd expect from Sennheiser. And the horrid app is nearly unusable.Normally I'd excuse the sound quality when you can set your own equalizer, but the app to do that doesn't work half the time. When you launch it, it just flat out doesn't connect to the earbuds. It will show them for a second but then say connection failed. If you get pass this, the app is extremely slow and buggy. Even if the app worked, the equalizer only includes bass, mids, and highs so you can't fully customize it to your liking.For some good points about these earbuds. They are lightweight and don't move around easily in your ear. The magnets to secure the earbuds and close the case feel great. The touch controls are very responsive. The sound queues and tones are clear and easy to understand. And the battery life is good + it charges quickly.So give these earbuds a pass and go with the JBL Live 300's. Much better sound quality, and an app that works. They are $150 retail but frequently go on sale for $100 (I got them for $75 on amazon). You'll also be getting auto play/pause, and a slightly better water resistance rating at IPX5.

title: 5.0 out of 5 stars Bang For Your Buck
author: Josh B
content: I like a good sounding headphones/earbuds. I think most of us do, at least anyone looking into something like Sennheiser.That being said, I usually go to Bose, because they have fantastic sound, and, they are the most comfortable for me. The wingtips really help keep them in my ears, and since they're soft silicone, it's comfortable.I typically don't like in ears with this design. They annoy my ears to the point that I just can't wear them for more than an hour. These on the other hand are actually quite comfortable. They aren't the most comfortable thing on the planet, but I find myself able to wear them for hours at a time without feeling any fatigue.The noise canceling does leave a little to be desired, but it's definitely present. It doesn't suck the world out like a nice pair of over ears or a really, really nice sent of ANC in ears. But, for the price point, they weren't so far away from things double, or even almost triple the price. They're great.The best thing about these earbuds, though, is their sound quality. They sound absolutely fantastic. Now, if you're a basshead, they probably aren't quite for you. But if you want to hear the nice boomy bass, punchy kids, and sparkly highs; these are fantastic. You can hear the low end a bit better with the bass boost profile, you can even EQ them in app to your preferences. But for me, the take home with these was the solid sound signature. I could hear all of the lower undertones of sound work in the high end, while getting a nice clear sounding low end. Again, if you're really looking for that low end - low kids punch, these probably won't do it for you. But if you want all aspects of your song to stand out equally, these are great.At this price, if you're thinking about getting them. I say go for it. An absolute 10/10, again, especially at the price.

title: 1.0 out of 5 stars UPDATE: Filled with problems, waste of $130...AVOID!
author: Gio Arenas
content: Initial set up (WITHOUT the app, which I'll get to later) was easy and they quickly paired with my Tab S7. I tested it with different types of music (rock, hip-hop, spanish, etc), as well as some podcasts. While the sound quality across the board is good, it didn't outperform a $50 pair of Enacfire E90 earbuds I had before they stopped working. When it comes to bass, the old E90's actually did BETTER than these. The comfort is decent, and aren't heavy enough to fall off your ears. Unfortunately, I can't say anything about the battery life since these STOPPED working less than 24 hours after they were delivered!Oh and about the failure, I mainly blame their (stupid) "Smart Control" app for this. Like I said before, the earbuds worked fine and paired quicky...until I used this dumpster fire of an app. At first, I was able to link the earbuds with the app and then I tried to update the firmware since it was available. Big, BIG MISTAKE. Even though the earbuds were (supposedly) at 90% battery and were recently charged with a fully charged case, I was instructed to put them them back into the case in order to start the update. After doing so and waiting an hour, the earbuds have refused to go into Bluetooth pairing mode.***UPDATE 08/22/2021***After contacting Sennheiser support via email, they suggested that I get a replacement pair, which is what I did. After getting them, I have to say, I now LOVE these earbuds! I don't know why, but this pair sounds a LOT better than the first ones I got. I can now safely say thay sound better than anything else I've tried, including my old E90's. Pairing was simple and fast, using a single earbud was effortless, and the range is fantastic.While I didn't get the 9 hrs of battery life that was advertised, the most I've gotten so far is about 7.5 hrs, which is still great for true wireless earbuds. Regardless of what you listen to, these earbuds sound amazing and have a great amount of bass. While a few have said that these are too heavy for their ears, it wasn't the case for me. I work in a warehouse where I'm constantly on the move, and I NEVER experienced a moment where I felt like these were going to fall off. That being said, I stand by my previous comment where I say that these won't fall off your ears, even if you're moving around. These are rated as IPX4 water resistant, which I'm going to say is legit since the warehouse does get hot and as a result, I do get pretty sweaty.***UPDATE #2, 09/10/2021***I once again find myself HATING these earbuds! After working perfectly for a few weeks, the left earbud of the REPLACEMENT (2nd) pair I got stopped working. Just like the 1st pair, I tried multiple resets, both soft and factory, and I get no audio from left side whatsoever. I also checked my devices' settings and can confirm that they work perfectly and are not the issue. At this point, I probably won't bother contacting support again and will just get rid of them. $130 in the trash thanks to Sennheiser!

content: They sound fine when they work. However, I have had to request replacement pairs three times now, within about 13 months of ownership. But how many times do I need to pay to return faulty earbuds? The warranty is only for 2 years. After that, I will not be buying Sennheiser earbuds again.

title: 4.0 out of 5 stars Excellent Sound
author: jarrod424
content: I was gifted some Airpod Pros last Christmas and I really didn't like them. To my ears they sounded overly bass-heavy and I prefer a flat EQ. They also had all kinds of connection issues with my phone (an iPhone, no less). So I decided to try these Sennheisers out as a replacement, and I'm really glad I did. The clarity and overall sound quality is leaps and bounds better than the Airpods. And the battery life is far superior as well. I take long walks every day with these, and only need to charge them maybe once every other week? Phenomenal.My only two gripes would be 1. the size of the case, which is somewhat bulky when shoved into a jeans pocket, and 2. the rubber tips that are included. Although they do provide 3 sizes (small, medium, large), I found all sizes of the Sennheiser tips to be too shallow for my ear canal, causing the buds to fall out rather easily. However, I replaced the tips with some slightly deeper ones (from an old pair of $30 sony's), and now they fit perfectly with no issue.

title: 5.0 out of 5 stars Fantastic Sound Quality in a Low Price range
author: halfcentaur
content: I actually own the first MOMENTUM true wireless and used them for years at work. They have superb sound quality, but there were a lot of issues I had with them. They were large with annoying battery leakage and fast battery depletion. I bought these in April when I started a new job because I would be taking a train regularly. I wanted something affordable but didn't want to sacrifice the sound quality that I was enjoying before, with a much better battery quality. These really haven't disappointed. They're not quite as good sound as the MOMENTUMS, but they are still very good for $70. I reckon most other brands you'd have to be spending at least $150 for this quality of sound. The battery life is incredible on them and they're my daily use when I'm commuting. The touch controls are great, much more intuitive than the MOMENTUMs. Their size is a massive improvement over the first MOMENTUMS, they do not stress my ears nearly as bad. Couldn't have been happier with this purchase. Sennheiser is the only audio company I purchase from, and they have rarely missed for me. At this price range, it's an automatic recommendation if anyone ever asks. With the MOMENTUM line is was always harder since the price range was generally extreme.

title: 2.0 out of 5 stars Painfully Mediocre
author: Lui
content: Where to start. The (8 HOUR MAX) battery life is valid for only one of the earbuds, the other dies in half the time causing the other to also start spewing its "Battery Low" message until you set it back to charge. They say 27 hour only because you get about 3 Charges from the case, which is also Sad. The material they're made of (including the case) provides ZERO grip so you'll most likely have them simply slipping out of your grasp AND your ears. They refuse to stay in even during something as simple as a light walk, you'll find yourself constantly having to push them back in place. As for the connection, it's Horrid. As many other reviews state, sometimes one bud doesn't connect and you have to factory reset them about three times in a row to fix the issue. The Range is hot garbage. Doesn't even extend down a 12 ft. hallway. My 7+ year old Skullcandy Hesh headphones have a longer range. A joke to be sure. The $15 earbuds that I bought to use at work were an infinitely better investment. Don't bother with these at $89.

I can hear vocals, instruments etc with excellent detail in the mids, highs, lows. I am currently listening to Angelina Jordan exclusively right now and it almost sounds as if she is here with me. title: 5.0 out of 5 stars Sennheiser signature open sound
author: Soren
content: Sennheiser is known for making headphones that are open in their sound. This means that when they are on your ears or in your ears, you feel like the sound is outside of your ears instead of right in your eardrum. This creates a soundstage with more depth and clarity. These are not the headphones to bump your trap music to. These are headphones to enjoy great acoustic music, classical music, jazz, watch movies, and enjoy some rock music. With rock music, it should be understood that you will get a nice open sound, but that you will not be getting the blistering loudness that comes with other headphones, especially wired headphones. In some ways this is a better things, especially in regards to your long term ear health.I am 2 days into enjoying them, so I will update if the charging and individual earbud dying issue comes up. It is stated as having a 2 year warranty, so all of these issues should be covered if you ever encounter them.As it stands, the price is right and they often get discounted another 20% for Black Friday, Cyber Monday, and Prime Day.

title: 5.0 out of 5 stars I feel like I owe Sennheiser money...
author: Carlos Valencia
content: I'll start by saying that I got these earbuds for $80, and for that amount of money these are hands-down the absolute best option under $100, even without ANC.Even at their list price of $130 they'd definitely be worth it, but for $80 I feel like I owe Sennheiser money!It all comes down to sound quality. I'm no audiophile, but I've owned a pair of Phillips Fidelio X2HR for a while now and the Sennheiser CX sound just as good if not better. Except the CX are tiny wireless earbuds! It's unbelievable.I listen to all kinds of music and was blown away by the amount of detail that comes through when listening to classical music, you can hear different instruments come from different directions. It's really cool.I think the sound is perfectly balanced right out of the box, but you can customize it within the app. Bass heads will probably enjoy the bass boost function but personally I think the bass sounds fantastic in the neutral setting even with hip hop and EDM.I don't really plan on using the earbuds for anything else other than listening to music, so I can't comment on call quality but for $80 I am positive that this is the best option for that price.If I had to mention any negatives it's just that I wish these were just a little louder, but other than that these earbuds are incredible.

content: I recommend that you do not buy Sennheiser earbuds. If there is no audio for a few minutes, they disconnect but they will re-connect with a single click which is a minor inconvenience. However, they also just stop working randomly and will not re-connect at all. That could be a problem connecting with Bluetooth, but often one earbud will continue working when the other earbud is dead and must be re-charged. Frequently I need to remove them from my Bluetooth list then re-pair them which is a major inconvenience. I used to have a pair of wireless Sennheiser headphones that also would not stay connected. title: 3.0 out of 5 stars Decent but disappointing overall
author: Scott Spencer
content: I've decided it's a bad idea to reply too much on reviews for headphones. Everyone has different hearing, individual preferences and varying levels of ability to detect (or even care about) audio fidelity. First impression out of the box: Well-made and beautifully packaged. It took me far too long to figure out why they weren't charging; turns out there was plastic film over the terminals, which I don't believe the documentation mentioned. (The documentation is pretty lame, btw...) Once over that hump, as soon as I got them connected to Bluetooth and to the app, it asked for a firmware update; this took an incredibly long time. First impression of the sound: crisp, clear, not quite loud enough (for me), but the low end is sorely lacking. Treble perhaps too bright. The EQ inside the app is pretty clever and helped improve the sound, but I was still hoping for more...ooomph...presence...<insert other audiophile words>. (For reference, I was listening to Spotify Premium (highest quality) over Bluetooth.) Phone call performance is excellent. Fairly comfortable/good fit. Overall, these are probably better than I'm making them sound. I anticipate using them for everything except critical listening; for that I'll keep using my over-ear ones.

title: 5.0 out of 5 stars I use these daily and couldn't imagine going on without them
author: Ted S
content: These headphones are amazing! I use them daily and love them for calls in particular. I have very bad hearing and these ear buds keep me from having to crank the volume up on calls. They also pick up sound very well which is great because I'm usually working on something when I get a call. The sound quality for music is fantastic as well. Unlike a lot of other brands, these ear buds are great for all types of music, not just loud bass-driven music as the mid-range is well represented in the mix when playing music. I prefer to listen to music with these headphones over all of my other headphones and speakers as the quality can't be beat. Sennheiser makes fantastic headphones, on par with industry leaders. I cannot recommend these particular ear buds enough. They're so great that I would not want to go a day without them.

title: 1.0 out of 5 stars Complete Garbage Profiting On the Sennheiser Name
author: User
content: I should have taken this as a bad omen when my first pair died a week after purchasing them. They are the only headphones that I've ever had just cease operating. I returned them, and my experience with my second pair has been a complete nightmare.The- Inconsistent battery life- Drastically different EQ on left and right sides- Poorly designed charging caseAre just a few small issues I've had. The main issue is that sometimes one or both headphones will stop working or desync from my phone for no reason and with no solution. I have gone months (Multiple times) with only one headphone working while the other one blinks red and green like a Christmas tree only to fix itself randomly months later. Again, this has happened several times with both headphones. Sometimes for days, sometimes for months. They have also reset any settings that I had changed in the Sennheiser app, so that's useless.And to add insult to injury, they sound just as good as the $30 TaoTronics I had a few years back. Not bad... But you won't be catching any fine detail in your music. Definitely not worth the asking price.Just don't buy these. They are complete e-waste, and I have read similar problems in others' reviews. They are a total waste of money. Get some Anker SoundCores or something. You'll probably have better luck with a pair of Bluetooth earbuds from the dollar store. At least they will properly sync.

I love green so a matcha color was perfect but there are very bug issues with it. 1st big issue is the charging, the buds dont always snap in to the case and connect with the magnetic prongs that charge them leading to me having to push them down (not hard but still) in order to make their they charge and often check on them. This also doesn't help thay their aren't really any indication lights other than 1 one the Case so unless you plug it up you really ain't got a way of knowing if the case is charged or not. Issue 2 the pairing & connecting, the right bud when pulled out with reconnect most of the time but sometimes needs me to manually select them in the Bluetooth menu while the left bud needs to be manually paired each and every time I use it just about, it's as if the bud is able to have a reconnecting memory unlike other skull candy products. 3 issue, this one is very minor but the hinge on the case is just to low you need to hold the cas a very special way or on a table to open or your finger will hold the cases lid shut which is just bad design and I honestly don't know how that made it pass concepts. 4th issue another small one but the Cases lid just opens way to easily when dropped as there's no magnet or just clip helping hold it shut like other brands or even skullcandys just literally sitting ontop of the cases lower part. For 24.99 I expected a product I wouldn't have to fight to use, and for a skullcandy product I expected quality but yet clearly there isn't a lot here in the products functionality. The sound is good as all skullcandys are but thr issues weight that down by a lot.
timestamp: Reviewed in the United States May 24, 2024

title: 4.0 out of 5 stars Comfortable, love the color, long lasting charge
author: MJ
content: I have been a Skullcandy fan for years. My previous buds the ‚ÄúIndy Evo‚Äù lasted almost 3.5 years. Excellent for midrange $. Hence I immediately returned to the brand for my next bud. I decided to try a different bud now we are in 2024 and the technology has evolved a bit more. Budget matters now more then ever in this economy. After looking at multiple reviews and several different new options they have out, I really was liking these for the look, fit and $. After having them home now and using them for about a week, here is my humble opinion. Pros: LONG battery life. I mean I think I charged it once overnight after it came home and put it on the charger again to check the status and it was still green. It is pleasing in appearance and definitely travels well in a pocket or purse. It has that little charge cord you see in my pictures. The c end goes to the case and usb to your computer, laptop or usb cube. I like the light indicator which tells you how charged the case is. The box comes with three different sized tips to ensure a good fit. The actual bud sits pretty comfortably because of the design. I have small ears and they don‚Äôt hurt after 4+hrs of wear. Decent connectivity. I can leave my phone on the table and walk into an ajoining room. It depends on if there is to much between the phone and signal. If I go out to the yard to lock up the chickens and leave my phone in the house, that‚Äôs about 30‚Äô, I loose connection, but it automatically re-connects when in range. Cons: volume on these puppies with one bud and max volume on my phone is low, I mean like I am struggling to hear. I do have some very mild hearing loss, but I mean I am talking volume on max and it sounds like it‚Äôs on low. I didn‚Äôt have this issue with the Indy Evo. The next and bigger issue is loose fit. Although ergonomically shaped for the ear, they are not secure for me. If I am just sitting working on something and listing or walking around listening not to bad, but as I continue to move my head around you can feel them coming loose. Over time they feel insecure. I constantly fiddle with them to re-secure them in place. I used to take daily walks at lunch with my Indy Evo, not sure I would feel safe doing that with these. I wouldn‚Äôt want to lose a bud or drop it in the dirt. I might try sizing down to the small tips even though medium feels comfortable, just to see if this somehow gives a better secure fit? I miss the little fins on Indy Evo. They pretty much guaranteed those little suckers went nowhere. Overall I think I got what I paid for. In this day and age of technology and insane $$ this is a decent tech, good looking, excellent charge, easy carry and easy on the wallet. If I want something for they gym or what have you I would probably invest a little more money so I get something I don‚Äôt have to worry about possibly losing. Still üíó me some üíÄ üç≠
timestamp: Reviewed in the United States May 11, 2024

title: 4.0 out of 5 stars Battery in these is amazing for the $.
author: Jaybo
content: Tired of cords and cheapo Bluetooth buds so I stepped up and spent a little on these. Extremely impressed with this product. The buds charge so fast in the little box, it's absurd. Been jamming out for the past 3 hours and still at 90 percent. Only complaint is you have no way to skip the track forward and back without using the assistant. Love the switchable equalizer built in. Pairs very well with my Motorola which comes with Dolby Atmos. Bluetooth connectivity works excellent. I can walk into another room in the house, door closed, without my phone and it won't even skip a beat. There are different tones that play in the headphone each time you press the skulls on the sides, so you can count your clicks, which I thought was pretty cool. Buds each have same functions, so can operate independently or together with ease.

title: 5.0 out of 5 stars Easy pairing, comfortable fit and excellent sound quality under $25
author: geotrick
content: These are the third version of SkullCandy earbuds I have had. My first were a pair of wired Smokin Buds I found in a parking lot. I was shocked at well they sound, so I ordered a few pair off ebay. I used these mostly cardio on treadmills. Sound quality was excellent with a nice bass. The fit always seemed to need adjusting.A few years ago I tried the sport bluetooth version of Smokin Buds that go around the neck. these had same qualities of the wired version.Now for these wireless Smokin Buds II. I have paired them to 5 different devices: Motorola, Samsung Apple iPhones and an iMac. Sound and fit are excellent. There are 3 built in eq settings: standard, movie and music, that can be changed easily by tapping 4 times on the Skull icon on either earbud. As for the sound the bass seemed deeper on the wired version but not by much.There are small medium and large ear adapters. I believe I am using the smallest ones.There is a charging cradle. You can charge the cradle even when you are wearing the earbuds. When you put the earbuds away the cradle will transfer power to the earbuds without them needing to be plugged in.USB-C charging port with a short USB-A to USB-C cable.Fit: I have shaken my head and the earbuds didn't move. The fit is snug.I have not tried them with exercise yet.Pairing: touch one of the Skull icons for 3 sec. and you will hear "ready for pairing"For $25 dollars these are excellent, Enjoy!
timestamp: Reviewed in the United States January 30, 2024

title: 5.0 out of 5 stars First Impressions
author: Whyborg
content: Long time fan of Sony products. Have the WH-1000XM4, WF-1000XM4, and other brands. Just got these this morning and listening now. Pretty happy with sound quality, the Sony app helps as I like a punchy bass and have typical high frequency loss for male adults. Once set up with the app, clear bass turned up almost to max and treble up I‚Äôm enjoying the sound. Sounds very much like the WF-1000XM4. Noise cancellation seems similar but need to do more listening in different conditions. Got the XM4 reconditioned and unfortunately the right battery is failing to hold a charge after about a year and a half so got these to satisfy my earbud itch until the XM5 is released. Actually liking the push button as opposed to the touch controls of XM4. Not better, but not worse. A bit smaller which I‚Äôm pleased with as I like to sleep with audiobooks on. I can sleep on my side with a soft pillow and not feel very much pressure. Did have them pause as I have the right side on default to pause and skip but only once so far so I don‚Äôt think it will be a problem. Contrary to some reviews either side can he configured to volume with the app. I have volume on the left now. Single press notches up, holding lowers volume. Default is to switch between noise cancellation or ambient mode. I have cancellation on most of the time so volume is more important to me. Also saw criticism about them not automatically pausing when removing, not a problem to me as I can easily pause touching the right side button. I also have some QCY buds that were surprisingly good for the price, and Soundcore A40 witch were also a good find, paid $99 but now $79. They‚Äôre almost as comfortable as these for bed but protrude a bit further so when sleeping on my side more pressure on my ear than the Sony. So far noise cancellation on the Sony is the best, almost as good as the XM4.For the price, I think this is a very good alternative to the XM4. Battery life is rated to 7.5 hours and the Soundcore are rated to about the same but by early morning I get a rudely loud charging notification. We‚Äôll see how the Sony last with similar use and update this review later. Overall in direct comparison of the XM4 I‚Äôd say these are just about as good but maybe not as broad of a soundstage. If you like Sony or are just looking for a good quality earbud with noise cancellation at a reasonable price these would be a good selection. One major improvement for me is the tips for the buds. I have large ear canals and the memory tips on the XM4 were a huge disappointment, they would not seal in my ears which is terrible for sound quality and noise. I keep all the tips from many earbuds over the years and even with other brands need to dip into them to find larger tips to seal in my ears. Pleasantly surprised the included large tips actually fit me. I included a photo of the Soundcore, QCY, XM4, and the WF-C700N for comparison. The WF-C700N seems to be the most comfortable so far. Slightly smaller than the Soundcore and definitely smaller then the XM4.So after using these about a month I‚Äôm still happy with them. I do have the occasional problem when listening to audiobooks in bed with the buttons for pause or volume getting just a little too much pressure and activating. Fortunately for volume one notch is louder but if you hold it the volume is reduced so at least I haven‚Äôt been blasted by max volume. Much as I like Sony products the other buds I mentioned would probably suit most people fine with a lower cost. But they‚Äôre not Sony! Still anxiously waiting for the soon to be released WF-1000XM5. Hoping for the lighter weight than the XM4 and the comfort of these with touch controls instead of push buttons. But for a mid-price bud these are still my favorites.Another update, these are not working for me to sleep with. My left ear gets a little raw spot on the edge of some cartilage. I‚Äôm primarily using the Sony WF-1000XM5 )got them 2 weeks ago) and the Soundcore A40 for audiobooks in bed. The headphones until my ears get too hot and the A40‚Äôs when I want to lay on my side.The Sony has some edge or something on it that makes a tiny little sore spot on the cartilage in my ear. Still like them a lot but now using them when I do my indoor cycling. I have a couple big blower fans on me and the Sony blocks out a lot of the noise and are better then the QCY I‚Äôd been using. They‚Äôre more rounded and I get less wind noise also.WF-1000XM5 just released, expecting mine Friday. I REALLY hope they don‚Äôt irritate my ear the way these do.So I‚Äôd still recommend these. It‚Äôs probably just my personal ear shape causing me an issue, no problem on the right side but nobody is perfectly symmetrical‚Ä¶8/523Update. Got the XM5 2 weeks ago and loving them. Fantastic sound, lighter than the XM4, better bass, more comfortable. But again the tips don‚Äôt fit. Airtight seal is critical on noise cancelling earbuds. The app is the same for The 700‚Äôs and XM5 but the 700‚Äôs do not have the feature enabled that checks for a seal. I discovered the left bud on the 700‚Äôs and the new XM5 just won‚Äôt quit seal. I found a hack to make the tips moldable. If you get Sugro glue (kind of like clay) roll a bit up, pull up the mushroom part of the ear tip, take the rolled up piece of Sugro and wrap it around the fitting to the bud, roll the tip back down and now you have a moldable tip. Insert in your ears and make sure they a good seal. You may have to reshape it a bit with your fingers if you work it too much. Once you have a good seal let it set a few hours and now you have a fitted tip. Works with my big ear holes‚Ä¶I have to reiterate, the 700‚Äôs have a very pleasing sound once you get the equalizer and clear bass setting adjusted to your taste. I just finished using them for 4 hours straight on loud during a 2 hour indoor cycling session, walking the dog, and making my lunch. Enjoying music I haven‚Äôt listened to for too long. They were comfortable (almost forget they‚Äôre in) sound excellent, and just put them away with 50% battery left.I really think most people would like these and would not be disappointed in any way, especially at the price. The XM5 are better, but to most people probably not $200 better (but I love them too!).9/22/23 a note about the app and the codecs used. I feel like a dummy now that I finally noticed right at the top in the headphone connect app it tells me on my iPhone it‚Äôs definitely using the AAC codec and shows if DSEE is on or not. DSEE definitely improves the sound. Compared the noise cancellation against the WF-1000XM5 and the XM5 do a better job with the 2 blower fans I have on me during my indoor cycling. But I still prefer using the C700n just because I want to be very careful with the more expensive buds.10/23/23Lost these! Looked all around but can‚Äôt locate. I was able to replace them @ $88 so not hugely upset, ordered a new pair and happy all over again. One of the reasons I really like these is how light they are. Even after 4-5 hours of wear I almost forget they‚Äôre in. Still one of my favorite pairs.Revisiting noise cancellation, walking my dog with light traffic only a few feet away I‚Äôve had the chance with the new pair (left button default is now toggle ANC transparency off or on. With it off I‚Äôm not hearing much of anything but my music. In transparency mode I can hear everything around me. I‚Äôd give these a 9 from 1-10. About as good as any ANC buds I‚Äôve tried.12/22/23Found the lost pair so now I have 2 pairs of the WF-C700n and not unhappy about it. These are definitely my go to buds, use them more than the XM5‚Äôs as they‚Äôre so light and comfortable and now at $76 I don‚Äôt worry as much about loss or damage as with the pricy XM5. If you haven‚Äôt tried them yet you should!
timestamp: Reviewed in the United States April 22, 2023

title: 5.0 out of 5 stars Perfect for running and comfortable
author: Rick
content: I typically run anywhere from 20min to 1 hour several times per week. I also sweat very heavily. To the point where clothes and towels are soaked.After trying half a dozen ear buds... The Sony c700n is the only one that stayed in my ear the whole time without falling. And they did so comfortably. The fit, comfort and grip is just phenomenal. It's almost as if Sony designed these for my ears. The default ear tips they came with the buds miraculously worked and I didn't even have to try the others.Some of the grip and stability is probably due to the weight of the buds as they are very light and sit very well in your ear.Flagship models are obviously fine but they have a huge disadvantage to runners since they are a lot bigger and heavier and therefore lose some grip and stability.The sound quality on the C700s is excellent as compared to my Galaxy Buds Pro 2. Honestly I can't tell the difference in quality. Even without the advanced codecs.ANC is probably where I see a difference compared to my Galaxy Buds. The Samsung ones are better but not by leaps and bounds. Id call the Sony c700 adequate and works sufficiently well at the gym to block most noise. With music on you won't hear any outside noise.Phone calls is an are where these struggled for me. I can hear other people just fine and clear... The issue is other people cannot hear me... Complaints I often hear is that I sound very far away and the noise cancelling for some reason does not work well during calls. Calls I made in moderately loud places were a near disaster. If you're in a quiet environment maybe they will work better. Hopefully they can fix this with a software update.I can't fault these buds though... I got them for sports/running and good audio quality... And for my use cases I am blown away! Especially at the price point.I prefer the push button interface rather than touch sensitive while running. This is because sometimes I need to adjust the buds without activating any commands. Touch sensitive earbuds are annoying for this matter. Sony designed the buttons well and they are easy to operate. It goes without saying that I can adjust the earbuds without accidentally activating any commands.The case could not be better for gym and sports. It is small, light and minimalist. Love the texture and they are small enough to keep in my pocket without noticing. Given the price point of the buds, I also wont mind if they get scratched of dented. The design is very practical and the "rough" plastic texture looks very nice to me.The app is very simple and works well. Besides software updates you can also adjust EQ to your liking. The app is very minimalist but gets the job done. I haven't explored the additional app features yet mostly because I don't think I have a use case for them.Buy these for the gym, very good audio quality and adequate but not stellar ANC. Do not buy these for personal or work phone calls.For the price, it is hard to believe the value these buds offer.

title: 1.0 out of 5 stars Will not enter pairing mode. Ever. Horrible instructions.
author: Verskate
content: Update: Feb 2024 After having these for about 6 months, I figured out the pairing issue. It's hard to explain but it is done using the Sony Headphones app and disabling the option for connecting to more than 1 device at a time.New issue - charging. Actually not new, but every now ant then the earbuds just won't charge. You place them in the container, the light turn on and glows green, then shuts off. All the while 1 or both earbuds will be just about empty on battery life. So you have to play the game of removing them from the case, placing them back in the case, over and over. That doesn't work all the time either, so then you need to plug them into a power source and remove/place in the case until you get a solid orange light that doesn't disappear in 2 seconds. It's a pain in the a$$. Especially when you know the case has a full charge and you want to use the earbuds only to find out 1 or both are dead. Huge let down from Sony. Calling their support line, maybe I can get a different pair. These suck.Maybe I just got a bad set, but these are the absolute most difficult earbuds that I've ever owned. I've factory reset them at least 5 times and have wasted a good 2 hours of my life trying to pair 2 different devices. The instructions to pair a second device are to place the earbuds in the case, leave the lid open, hold the button on the back for 5 seconds. Sounds easy right? Nope. It's not. The buds will not enter pairing mode. Ever. I can connect to the first device, but good luck with the second. One thing I did learn when I was able to get two devices to pair, that one time, was to be sure to disconnect the earbuds from the first device. Besides the over-complicated method of entering pairing mode, I've had the earbuds only connect one bud, on a few occasions. So you'll get 1 bud to connect, and the other is dead. Trying to get them both to turn on was another clunky nightmare and I ended up just factory resetting them. I'm done messing with them, and they're going back to hell where they came from.UPDATE - If you're using the "Headphone" app on an Android and want to connect to "pair" with a second device. DO NOT FOLLOW THE INSTRUCTIONS ON SONY'S WEBSITE. They will only mess up your earbuds and make you frustrated. In the app under "status" locate the "Connected Device(s)" and tap that. The next screen you'll see a + button on the bottom right. Click that! That will put the earbuds into pairing mode. Good lord they made that difficult. 2.5 hours later I have them paired.
timestamp: Reviewed in the United States August 23, 2023

title: 3.0 out of 5 stars Decent Sound, ANC Not For Airplanes
author: Artie Deco
content: These are not bad. They fit my ears well. They are reasonably loud, but they won't be overpowering.The frequency response is pretty good. The associated phone app gives you some equalizer control that helps, too.There is some configurability for the buttons. Not completely customizable, as the actions are grouped across numbers of clicks (e.g. 1: pause, 2: next track, 3: previous track are a group). But I like the defaults, anyway.I also like the tactile buttons. You rarely accidentally push them while adjusting the buds, unlike touch buttons. There is definitely a significant delay for them to respond (I'm guessing a lot of this is waiting to see how many clicks you're going to do to determine which action to take), so the actual mechanical click lets you know you've pressed them.They did not hurt at all, even on 9-10 hr flights.And the battery life so far is crazy good. With ANC enabled, they were still about 15% after use for those entire long flights. Without ANC, they were like 80%! (That'll likely change with age.)But, the ANC is not useful for me. I bought these for airplane travel. A very old set of ANC headphones did wonderfully eliminating the airplane noise. These, not so much. They physically seal well, so they block sound pretty well with no ANC enabled. In the airplane, turning on the ANC changes the sound, but seems to trade one you can hear for another at roughly the same volume. On one 9 hr flight, this was a bit preferable. But it didn't make much difference on the other. They also didn't block crying babies better with ANC than without. However, they were plenty loud to drown out that noise with or without ANC.The passthrough mode is functional, but poor quality. It lets though the ambient sound, but it somehow boosts actual noise. Airplanes have air blowing all the time. Without the earbuds, you don't really notice it much. But with these in & turned to the monitor mode, the hiss of the air is very loud. But again, it's still functional for listening, even while being annoying.As mentioned, I bought these for airplane travel. I have Google Pixel Buds that have no ANC. Comparing to these, the seal is better with the Sonys, even though the ANC doesn't do much for airplane noise. And the equalizer allows adjustments that the Google Buds don't. Including the battery life & buttons, I've decided to keep these. But just be aware of the ANC limits.

title: 4.0 out of 5 stars Beyond Expectations for Budget Earbuds
author: Trenton
content: I can be pretty sensitive to noise, so I've been looking for a good, yet affordable set of noise-cancelling headphones for a while now, but have always been wary of cheaper models. I decided to give these a shot after listening to Sony's C720N's, and so far I've been pleasantly surprised!Noise-Cancelling:What really blew me away was the quality of the noise-cancellation for the price. I didn't have high hopes given that I only paid around $100, but after using these for the past week I've been pretty satisfied with their performance. I would say these earbuds are really good at filtering out lower-end noise, like fans, traffic, and TVs as well as more distant sound. I walked past an industrial AC unit on my way to work the other day and barely heard the thing, especially with music playing. These don't really excel with dealing with higher-end or particularly loud noises like close speech, dogs barking, or sirens, but they do significantly lower the sound, which is incredibly helpful for me. Turning the NC on with music playing is usually enough to block out the majority of offensive noise.Audio:The sound is also really well-balanced right out-of-the-box with good low-end and clear mids and highs unlike the flat or muddy sound you might get with other low-price headphones. Sony's app also allows you to customize your EQ further to get a mix that better suits your preferences, which is really nice. Speaking of the app, you can customize what the buttons on each earbud do through it and toggle the Adaptive Noise-Cancelling setting as well.Comfort:The earbuds themselves are honestly pretty comfortable and fit in my ears snugly. I don't feel them come loose at all as I'm moving about, and I can wear them for hours at a time without much issue. I haven't tried exercising or running with them yet, though. I have been running into a bit of discomfort in my left ear after a couple hours of wear, but I think that may have more to do with the shape of my ear since my right side is fine. I've just been letting the left earbud sit slightly away from the ear for now. which has been helping mitigate any discomfort with out sacrificing any noise-cancellation.Battery-Life:I use my earbuds with noise-cancellation on for at least two-four hours each day. When I'm done using them, they go back into their case to charge. In the week since I bought them, I've only had to charge the case twice. For me, that's not bad at all. The case has an LED indicator to let you know when your charge is getting low, and you can also check it via the app. Charging only takes a couple of hours.All in all, I've been pretty happy with these. I think they're a surprisingly good pair of earbuds for the price. The noise-cancelling of course won't compete for Sony's top-end models, but these do the job and they do it much better than expected.

title: 5.0 out of 5 stars True ANR Nlise canceling
author: DD1550
content: For those of you who want to purchase this product PLEASE READ THIS REVIEW. I'm going to try and make this short and accurate as possible. Many will tell you that the ANR noise reduction is just a bunch of white noise. THIS IS FALSE! This Bluetooth headset has two modes. ANR and a mode that is sort of a surround sound microphone mode. You can toggle between ANR and surround sound microphone mode with a single tap of the left headset button. You will know when you are in ANR mode because it will be very difficult to hear anything you are surrounded by while you have these headphones in your ears. You will also notice the sound of the music you are listening to is very sharp and clear with lots of bass. The surround sound micro phone mode helps you to hear the environment around you. They sort of turn into microphones and amplify surrounding sounds so you can hear them. This is too often misinterpreted as ANR white noise. Often when wearing these, you will get someone walking up to you talking, trying to communicate, but whatever they are saying will be inaudible if in ANR mode. If this happens, tap the left headset button once. This stops ANR mode and you will be able to hear them talking while still hearing music playing. For best results, tap the right headset button, it stops the music or whatever you are listening to. Then tap the left headset to get out of ANR mode so you can hear the person or environment you are in without removing the headphones from your ears. Its a really cool feature to have on these. The battery life is ok. My headphones will stop functioning at about 6.5 hours of use. Which is acceptable for me for the price. If 6.5 hours of use sounds ok for the price you pay for these, then get them. They are a good bluetooth headset for the money and DON'T LET THE REVIEWS WITH MISLEADING INFO BE A DECIDING FACTOR!!
timestamp: Reviewed in the United States February 11, 2024

title: 2.0 out of 5 stars For the Money - Not impressed.
author: Granular
content: I bought these earbuds to replace a set from a different manufacturer that started to not accept charge after around 3-4 years.First thing I noticed was the clunky application you are encouraged to download to make the most out of the ANC and Audio features. The product comes with literature telling you straight up - Made for Iphone/Ipad.. Works with Android - so right away, I felt a sense of dread because I'm an Android user.Through the setup process, you are asked if it's cool that Sony collects all of that sweet information about who you are, how you use the device, your mother's maiden name, etc.I clicked yes, because the audio without the app was on par with the 20 dollar set you can buy at the gas station. WITH the app, you are then asked if you want to install ANOTHER app that will make full use of the "capabilities" of the new earbuds you just bought.. for ~$100.. and that you MIGHT have to pay the digital audio fluffers a subscription to use their services. I declined this option and decided to see what the Sony app could do to digitally optimize the sound quality with what I assume are cheap and (too) small audio drivers.Long story short:-The bass is lacking.. seriously lacking - you have to turn the bass setting up to max to achieve what I would consider normal for an in-ear earbud.-The mids and highs are ok - nothing special about the sound.-The active noise cancelling is ok - probably better than the set it was intended to replace (but those were 4 years old.. and older model when I bought them)If you're going to spend ~$100 for a set of everyday use earbuds, I would look elsewhere. The set of Jabra Elite Active 75T's this was supposed to replace blow these away in terms of audio quality (no I don't get paid to write reviews.. yes I only write reviews when a product fails to meet my expectations).Unfortunately, I need these for work over the next few weeks - so I won't be returning them.. but I am VERY Underwhelmed.-
timestamp: Reviewed in the United States July 21, 2024

title: 5.0 out of 5 stars Very Impressive
author: Nick
content: These are replacing my Lypertek Z3 2.0 earbuds which began having battery issues after only a few months.The sound quality for these Sony earbuds is incredibly detailed.The "clear bass" function is mind blowing.It isn't at all like a typical bass boost.This function is more like adding a subwoofer to your setup. The low end is more encompassing and punchy without ever compromising clarity and quality of the other frequencies.I was a bit concerned about the lack of frequencies available for the graphic eq but these concerns proved to be unwarranted as I don't need to adjust anything.These ear buds sound so good, I just leave the eq flat and adjust the "clear bass" function as needed for extreme music changes.These are my first noise canceling earbuds (as opposed to just noise isolating) so I can't compare to comment too much on the ability here but they definitely reduce background noise.The ambient mode is pretty handy when you need to hear what's going on around you.With the new software update, these modes (noise canceling, ambient, off) are switchable with a simple click of the ear buds (as well as many other customizable click functions).As well, the size of the earbuds / charging case is small enough to put in my jeans pocket and not be annoying or uncomfortable.I have only had these for a few days so I can't comment on longevity but so far, I am really enjoying these earbuds.There are a lot of features, amazing sound quality, high comfort level and all at surprisingly reasonable price point. Right on.
