title: 4.0 out of 5 stars Good earbuds, not fantastic
author: Frank
content: I use many different earbuds and headphones. These JBL Tune buds produce a good sound with my iPhone, especially when using the JBL app which has preset equalizer settings for different sounds and can deliver amazing base. Overall these are fairly good earbuds at a sale price of around $50. The box includes 3 pairs of silicon tips, small, medium and large, the silicon material is too smooth and too thin, they slide out easily and do not sit very securely for me, but this is very subjective and can be different for everyone. The noise canceling is only ok, in my opinion it provides about 40-50% background noise cancelation (personal opinion, not scientifically measured). The sound quality is very good but it seems the volume level seems low compared to other buds I have. The microphone seems to function well, I have not heard complaints from people I have called so I assume it is good. Overall, pretty decent buds but not fantastic, I was expecting more as a JBL brand
timestamp: Reviewed in the United States January 11, 2024
product_name: JBL Tune Buds - True Wireless Noise Cancelling Earbuds

title: 5.0 out of 5 stars Fantastic sound, great battery life, a great buy!
author: TheRevenite
content: I bought these on the Black Friday sale and man, I'm so glad I did. I have several pairs of the lesser Vibes, which sound good, but these blow them out of the water.First, let's address the fitment. I see many say they don't fit, they fall out, or feel like they're going to fall out. Don't put the large ear pads on if you don't have large ear canal openings! This will cause the earbuds to push themselves out. Too large will push them out, while too small will obviously not have enough to grip your ear. Test them all to find the right fit, if not, reach out to JBL, I'm sure they have replacement pads of other sizes. You can also buy them here on Amazon as they're pretty universal.I find pushing them in, and turning them into place, with the proper pads, netted a great seal and no falling out.You HAVE to install the app on your phone; otherwise, you're getting the flat sound your phone manufacturer decided sounded good. The JBL app is available for Apple and Android - and it makes a massive difference, especially with the noise cancellation and frequency response.With these, I'm hearing songs I've listened to for decades for the first time. I'm hearing effects and instruments I never heard in the music. These are that clear. They also don't kill my ears! I've tried earbuds from $5 to $300, and while the more expensive ones sounded terrific, they hurt my ears physically. With these, I get great sound and a great fit with a tremendous battery life.I'm reading a lot of negative reviews where either the fit or the sound is the problem. Most of these would be positive if people were provided with either longer pads so they go a bit further into the ear and more sizes and those with sound complaints would actually install the app. Mine sounded horrible with the Dolby equalizer baked into Android 13. Installing the app AND turning off any phone equalizer or sound enhancer was the solution. I'd definitely buy these again!

title: 5.0 out of 5 stars Finally found decent performing earbuds
author: Photographer
content: My standard for headphones is fairly high. I have a few pairs of high-end (also expensive) wired headphones for indoor, critical listening. I also have a pair of inexpensive earbuds for exercise. The sound quality is obviously subpar. I have been looking for a replacement.I bought and returned many over the last couple years; none lived up to my standard. Most of them had poor sound quality. I did buy one pair last year that was decent, but it had connection problems. So I returned it.I pretty much gave up until I came across this one. The price was too good to pass up. It was delivered not quickly, but within the promised time frame. Given my experience, I have low expectations. But the JBL brand name does give me some hope of acceptable quality.BT Connection was fast and secure with no problems so far. Sound quality is much better than I expected, especially for the price. While the sound stage is not as open as my high-end wired headphones, imagining is excellent, which I did not expect. Tonal balance is also excellent with no treble fatigue or excessive bass; I set the equalizer to neutral flat. I can wear it for prolong periods. I like it enough to wear it while moving around the house.
timestamp: Reviewed in the United States July 19, 2024
product_name: JBL Tune Buds - True Wireless Noise Cancelling Earbuds

title: 3.0 out of 5 stars Wanted to really like these
author: Jason
content: Pros:Reputation Brand NameGood sound with JBL Headphone appPlenty of bass with JBL Headphone appCONS:FitBluetooth disconnectsI purchased these after mt galaxy bud 2 died, due to one bud falling out into my pool last year then finally died about a month ago.My primary use for ear buds is listening to music while doing yard work (mowing, weed eating, edging) and during pool maintenance (brushing the walls and vacuuming).When I first received these, I downloaded the app and they paired nicely with no issues. Capsule charge was at 75% while both buds were at 100%.Next I tried placing them in my ears. When i placed them in my ears and turn them counterclockwise the weren't very comfortable and felt loose like they were going to fall out, however they did say in place when i tilted my head to either side and shook my head. These earbuds are supplied additional ear cushions. I tried the bigger ones and for my ears these were too big for my ear canal and would not stay in very well. I tried the smaller ones and these wouldn't hold in place. I'd like to say they were like Goldilocks and the 3 bears, but none were just right. The closest for me were the medium size, but I still didn't trust them staying in while doing yard work.Today was the first day I've had to really put them to the test. I place them in and fiddle with them for a bit to get a "snug" fit. The only way I could achieve this was by turning them so that the J in the JBL logo was at about a 180 degrees facing upwards.I started Spotify and proceeded to start the yard work. I noticed myself constantly fiddling with the earbud, because the kept feeling like the were going to fall out, enough so that I kept activating the voice pass through.After about a hour and a half into the yard work I was met with a bluetooth disconnected message. When I looked at my phone (Samsung galaxy s23 ultra) it showed bluetooth was enabled and the buds were paired. I started Spotify again and the music resumed. So I was like ok????I did about another 2 hrs of yard work and they stayed connected, but I still constantly felt they were going to fall out.With today's experience, I will not be using these near my poolWould I recommend these to a friend? Probably notDo i think these were worth what I paid for them? No, with the fit issue, these should cost closer to $19.99

author: Value for Money, but not a great snuggled fit
content: Sound quality is just above average at this price range, bass is sharp and to the point, not too much not too low. title: 2.0 out of 5 stars Not as good as expected, lost one within a week.
author: Michael and Karrie
content: Don't get me wrong, these are decent earphones. On par with the good sounding off brand $30 sets. Big difference is that they have features that help with ambient sounds and has noise canceling. Thing though is I was very unimpressed with those features after owning a pair of Bose earphones. These were also really lightweight/cheap feeling compared to my Bose, and weren't as easy to use with the taps and stuff. Then there is the fitment issues. Do they have different size rubber pieces? Yes. 3 sizes, 1 set of each. None of them worked, to the point that almost every facial muscle movement or jaw movement caused them to fall out. Personally I like to be able to talk when I'm on a phone call, but these made it hard to. And trying to watch a movie while eating? Impossible! I spent more time catching/picking up my earbud and trying to resume the movie than I did eating.Ultimately my advice is that if you're not wanting to spend a lot of money on features like noise cancelation, take a chance with an off brand for a third of the price and you'll most likely still have the same sound quality. If you want thise features and are willing to pay this price, spend a little more and get Bose or a good brand that knows how to to it right. If you want them to stay in your ears, go with literally ANYTHING else!Battery life was great though!

title: 5.0 out of 5 stars The Perfect Storm!!! Flawless execution of what SHOULD BE
author: TheChrisSimon
content: 2 years ago I was I acquired a pair of the Galaxy Buds+. I would have never I have purchased them myself, as spending top dollar for a pair of earbuds or headphones to me was not something that I would have spit my money on. I had no instructions, just a little black case in the bottom of a drawer, that someone had left behind. What I discovered, was a piece of technology, that made my life better, and it's quality, simplicity, and joy that it bestowed upon my soul.I only had that unit for a period of maybe 2 months. During that time I use them to live. The full sound l, flawless amplification of surrounding noises, everything about these was amazing. The fit in my ear, the simplicity of touch controls, everything made them something I didn't know that I couldn't live without. Through sheer negligence, I I dropped the right bud into a toilet, and flust it before I realized what had happened. There was a period of grief. And that left bud sat in its case and a drawer for 4 months, as I did not have the disposable funds to go buy a new pair, until it occurred to me to just buy a replacement for the lost bud. Purchase of the second hand market I could never get it to pair and it just sent me further into sadness.Set that time I have made an emission, define a worthy replacement. I have spent conservatively $1,800 and tried every brand from generic to Apple to the Samsung's themselves come and nothing matched the pure perfection of the plus. Well what are you going to do they don't make them anymore. And then on prime I saw that Samsung was selling them, for more then they're top of the line current model. How's this possible? They quit selling them years ago?My theory is that the human ear, Is only so big. There was a team at Samsung that put this bud into the Universe, and those in the upper echelon know it is the Alpha qnd Omaga. I planned up the lessons, and the perfect bargain earbud does not make for the quarterly Prophets jump where the marketing team happy. So they have hidden this, for those that are only in the know. Hey now you know, I bought and Amazon refurbished pair, as well as the buds FE. As a birthday present. The buds FE arrived 3 days before the plus, and I did not unseal the package, because I knew in my heart. I went to my Amazon locker 3 days later with speed and haste that not felts in years. Went home and let them sit for a good I don't know hour and a half as I twittered about my apartment. And when I put them in my ear? Yeah, that's the stuff. Look no further. I mean wait I don't want you to take them all, keep your secret between us. Don't tell anybody about me, we will be the ones the know.

content: For the money, these buds are fantastic! title: 4.0 out of 5 stars Good buds!
author: David D
content: I recently purchased the SAMSUNG Galaxy Buds FE True Wireless Bluetooth Earbuds in the Graphite color and I have been extremely impressed with their performance. As someone who is always on the go and constantly listening to music or podcasts, having a reliable and comfortable pair of earbuds is essential for me. The Galaxy Buds FE have exceeded my expectations in both of these areas.First and foremost, the comfort and secure fit of these earbuds is top-notch. The wing-tip design ensures that they stay in place even during intense workouts or when I'm running errands. I have tried many other wireless earbuds in the past and have always struggled with finding a pair that stays in my ears comfortably. The Galaxy Buds FE have solved this problem for me and I can wear them for hours without any discomfort.The sound quality of these earbuds is also impressive. The audio is clear and crisp, with a good balance of bass and treble. I have used them for both music and phone calls and have been pleased with the sound in both scenarios. The touch controls on the earbuds are also very convenient and easy to use. I can easily pause or skip a song without having to take out my phone.One of the standout features of these earbuds is the auto switch audio. This allows me to seamlessly switch between my phone and laptop when I receive a call or want to listen to something on my computer. It's a small feature, but it has made a big difference in my daily routine.I also appreciate the built-in voice assistant feature. I can easily access my virtual assistant with just a touch of the earbud, making it convenient to make calls, send texts, or get directions without having to take out my phone.The battery life on these earbuds is also impressive. I can use them for several hours without needing to recharge, and the charging case provides additional battery life when I'm on the go. The case is also compact and easy to carry around.Overall, I highly recommend the SAMSUNG Galaxy Buds FE True Wireless Bluetooth Earbuds. They offer a comfortable and secure fit, great sound quality, and convenient features that make them a must-have for anyone looking for a reliable pair of wireless earbuds. Whether you're a music lover, fitness enthusiast, or just someone who wants a hassle-free listening experience, these earbuds are definitely worth considering.The only drawback is that the case is not wireless charging. Losing the one star.

title: 5.0 out of 5 stars No Way
author: Dillon
content: Mother of GOD these are good.1) Super comfortable and secure. I can't even get them to fall out with the most ridiculous of abrupt head movements.2) Easy as hell to set up with my Samsung Galaxy phone. As soon as I opened the case, my phone woke up and was like, "Eeeey, these yours?" And I was off to the races.3) Feature rich as all getout. Disclaimer. I am not somebody that likes very feature rich things. I like my audio devices to play audio. Nothing more. These changed my mind completely. It works so seamlessly with the phone it feels like an expansion pack or something. Answering calls is easy and has incredible mic quality. Not sure how. Playing, pausing, and playing next and previous songs all uses one touch surface and it's way easier than expected.4) My absolute favorite thing about these. Audio quality. I'm absolutely blown away by how good these sound. I didn't think it was possible to get such huge sound out of earbuds. These lil things are the size of a roided out bean and they absolutely dominate my entire skull. Most people are going to be like "Yo the bass is fire. Riz and bruh and other sounds," but it's so much more than that. They deliver rich and clean audio across all frequencies. Yes, bass included. Very very f****** included. I listen to a lot of metal, which can be really demanding of speakers. The genre often includes a wide range of audio input simultaneously. These handle anything you throw at them no problem.In short, buy these. Go. Do it. Begone.

content: After a failed trial run with the Amazon Echo Buds (which were a waste of money), me and my wife gave these a try. And let me tell you, we LOVE them! These are the first pair of buds with true ANC that ACTUALLY worked and worked very well. Ambient mode is great also, so I can wear 1 in my ear at work and still be able to hear everything around me perfectly, while still listening to my music. Was a little weary about the bad reviews for them not staying in the ear well, but they actually stay in great for the both of us. She was more worried because she has a LOT of piercings in and around each ear so finding good buds that fit comfortably AND stay in is very hard for her to find. The sound in them is also pretty great. I'm no expert but all i have to say is the sound is crisp. Really surprised we were able to get something with this type of quality and functionality for only $79. Super happy with our new ear buds!

title: 5.0 out of 5 stars These earbuds are pretty much perfect
author: vacuums
content: I had a pair of Galaxy Buds from years ago that I really like but were starting to act up. I looked at a lot of different options and even tried a set of Anker buds that I ended up returning. I came back to these, which I think are the newer version of what I had. Things I like:-The buttons are very easy to tap and double or triple tap. There are a lot of different options to customize what that does in the app.-Sound quality is great.-The fit is fantastic for me. I love the ear "wings". They make a nice secure fit that and it never feels like they are in danger of falling out.-Changing case is compact and these charge easily by dropping them in.-There is an option to set either the right or left earbud to toggle between noise canceling and ambient sound modes when you long press. Both these modes work great. Noise canceling is enough that I can mow the lawn without needing separate ear protection and I can quickly switch to ambient mode if I need to hear someone talking to me.-The biggest upside is that these are quite a bargain. Quite a bit less than some of Samsung's other models of earbuds.

title: 3.0 out of 5 stars Better to buy new and Best with Samsung phone
author: Julie
content: This is a bit long but I feel it provides good info regarding your phone or electronic device to be paired with earbuds and purchasing new vs used earbuds. If you have questions about these topics please read!I purchased these for my boyfriend. He has a Samsung S22. I have bought him multiple types of brand new earbuds in the $70-$80 range in the past. He had to charge all those daily in order to used for 1.5 hrs while he walked. I wanted to buy him something nicer so I bought these. I chose to buy a used set in hopes that they were in great condition and maybe the box was just torn. I changed them overnight on accident (I prefer not to charge too long). Then paired then with my iPhone. I have owned several versions and pairs of iPods and Beats Pro (over the ear). So my first reaction was disappointment because the sound quality did not compare and little things didn‚Äôt work the same. For example when you take your Beats out if your ear whatever your watching stops. That is not the case with these. Also when a call comes in, I had to manually change the option to the ear bud on my phone screen vs just answering by touching my ear. However, I still gave them to my boyfriend for Easter and when he paired them with his galaxy he was prompted to add an extra app that gave him different features than I had with my Apple. Initially he was not too impressed with the sound, he expected them to be louder. The noise canceling was so good, he had to take them out to hear me talk to him. What he loved about them was the length of time he was able to go before charging the case. Remember I charged them one time, then he used them off of my original charge after sitting in the box for a few days. He wore them everyday for 5 days without charging the case. At that point he was really happy with them. Enough to overlook the sound quality since it was not what he expected. Unfortunately when he charged the case he was not able to get the Right earbud to charge. We tried different troubleshooting methods. Unfortunately none of them have worked. We will be sending them back. I don‚Äôt have experience using Apple headphones or buds with Samsung phones but I feel if I had bought these brand new, he would keep them vs buying headphones like mine. I‚Äôd rather pay an extra $50 to get new products going forward. Please air on the side of caution if you buy used or refurbished version of these ear buds. Hopefully this helps someone trying to decide between new or used and Apple/Beats products vs Other earbuds to pair with an android phone.

title: 3.0 out of 5 stars Not overly impressed
author: Amazon Cutstomer
content: I've only had these a day but there are not many reviews so I'll give my 1st impressions. I wore them for a few hours doing yard work (using my Samsung S22) and tried them with some of my favorite test tracks connected to my PC and using Amazon HD music (using Exclusive mode)The first thing that surprised me was the white case... I ordered black, and at first thought they sent the wrong ones but opened the case and the buds themselves were black. I don't like white, but whatever.Looking at the case there is not much indication of what is the front and it's a bit fiddly to open. The magnet to suck the buds into place is not very strong, so a bit fiddly to lay them in the case.I don't like wearing buds much, but these were pretty comfortable right out of the box. The insertion was not quite as deep as I like but they stayed in well while I was moving around and I did not feel the need to keep adjusting them.How do they sound:I want to emphasize these are first impressions.These have a polite sound that would probably please many people. I'm not one of them. When I got the Lypertek buds for the same price I told people "I can't believe how good a sound you can get for $100 these days". With these, I would say "They are ok, most people would like them".They are "fine" for having something playing in your ear while you do something else but they did not bring out any joy in the music for me. Nothing stood out about the sound. Ordinary comes to mind or, nothing wrong but nothing right. I'm not into 'soundstage' the the lack of one while listening to live tracks actually stood out to me.The sound is a bit congested, the instruments kind of bunched into each other. There is no 'air' around the instruments. I found myself pushing the volume louder than I normally listen to "wake them up a bit".Detail retrieval is decent, but you are not going to notice the reverb, the grind of a distorted guitar, the 'ting' of the drumsticks on a cymbal, breath sounds, etc. The overall presentation is smooth enough from low to high, with no glaring holes, or peaks. If I had to fault the frequency response it would be male voices. Just a bit in your face at times. Bass get a bit tubby if you try to push it much. In "normal" mode I found it just about right.Let's see what I can 'fix' with EQ. The EQ in the App has 9 bands, cool! But that hardly matters if there is no custom EQ option. Seriously Samsung? The Sennheiser App only has 3 bands but at least they let you set a custom EQ, name it, and save it.There are 7 presets, but none of them really gave me something I liked. But there is enough variety that most people would find something they like.I'm mixed on keeping them. The sound is good enough for what I want them for. listening to music while I do something else. They are comfortable and stay in well, but I am not impressed with the sound. It's "fine", it's "okay", and "good enough" but not impressed with the sound for the $100 price point.

timestamp: Reviewed in the United States February 29, 2024

title: 4.0 out of 5 stars Good Clarity and Dynamics, lack fullness
author: J
content: I usually buy earbuds with a more balanced sound profile (Bose QuietComfort, Samsung Buds+, Jabra Elite 7 Pro). The same goes with Sony C500:1) The base is precise and it is not bloomy or overwhelming2) The treble is a little bright, but not harsh (Jabra Elite 7 Pro has a treble that hurts my ears). I use the equalizer to dial down the treble and dial up the mid just a bit to make it sounds slightly warmer.3) The mid is very detail. I can hear the singers express their emotions very clearly. Much more detail than Bose to my ears (but Bose sounds fuller and richer).4) The sound is dynamic. I feel it can bring out the excitement in music without being overwhelming (more than Bose but Bose has better instrument separation and "layering")Other Pros:1) It is super comfortable. I can listen to it many hours without taking it off.2) The equalizer is much better than Jabra. It shows the frequency as well as the decibel.A few things to watch out for:1) Even though the sound is very detail but it also sounds thin, especially for male vocals with deeper voice. Using the equalizer to dial up the mids helps a little bit.2) It sound pretty bad on voice calling.3) Noise Cancellation is not good. I can hear people chatting in the office. I guess it is a give-and-take. This earbud does not require a deep in-ear fit (to be comfortable), so it could be harder to get good noise cancellation. On the other hand, Jabra has good passive noise cancellation, but it is not nearly as comfortable (it has a deeper in-ear fit).I primarily look for a inexpensive earbuds to use in office with good sound and comfort. Given that I buy it on sale, I am happy with this investment. It has almost everything that I am looking for. Wish that it would sound a bit fuller (then it would be perfect).
timestamp: Reviewed in the United States November 16, 2022

title: 4.0 out of 5 stars Great all around wireless earbud for a great price
author: Mike N
content: I purchased these on daily deal from Amazon for $59 or so, and for the money I've been extremely pleased so far.Comfort: they fit well and are snug, they come with three sizes of tips so getting a good fit shouldn't be hard. They stay in place very well during intensive workoutsSound quality: For the money, I've pretty impressed with the sound quality. I own an amp and DAC, planar magnetic headphones, and a pair of wired balanced armature earbuds. So I love good headphones. These give my balanced armature earbuds a good run for their money. These don't have huge bass, but the bass is punchy and well controlled. Highs and mids are good, and there's decent separation and a nice airiness about these. Overall, these have a very well controlled sound profile and work well with most any music genre. These also isolate pretty well, so good that I see no need for wireless buds with noise cancellation, which I personally think is a gimmick that only causes increased drain on the batteries.Battery life: pretty decent, these don't have noise cancelling tech, so battery life is much better than buds that have that tech. One important note, I've found the right earbud will drain faster than the left if I use it frequently to advance or replay tracks.Sony headphone app: I'd recommend downloading the Sony headphone app as this allows you some equalizer features and let's you turn off the buds using the app. Also, the app has some other bells and whistles like an ear analyzer that takes a picture of your ear and optimizes sound to fit your ears. However, you'll need to download one of several 3rd party apps to take advantage of this feature.Overall, these are a fantastic deal for the money, with typical Sony quality and functionality. They work great with my Iphone and integrate with Siri, so you'll have that functionality as well.

title: 4.0 out of 5 stars Great ear buds
author: Amazon Customer
content: I purchased these a couple weeks ago. I wanted to write an honest review after using them for a while.I'm very happy with them. I tried a different brand but returned them after a couple days. These are heads and shoulder above those.I was concerned that they would fall out, but they fit snuggly, and they stay put without being uncomfortable. I use them when I workout, lifting, riding the bike or running, they have never fallen out. When I remove them, I have to gently tug on them for them to come out. Just make sure you are using the right size rubber attachments.I'm impressed with the sound quality. The app works well and you can actually hear the changes when you change modes.As far as noise cancellation--its more of the rubber inserts than the electronics IMHO. If I'm not listening to music or on a call they act like ear plugs. If you've ever talked wearing ear plugs, you know what I mean. However, when I'm walking the dogs or out in the wind, I can still hear the music with very little wind noise. It's almost as if I have over the ear headphones on.I'm still trying to determine the battery life. I wear them for a couple hours while exercising and a few hours after--I can wear them about 2 days like this until I need to recharge. I don't like to recharge until they are below 20%. The charging case will charge them up to about 75% in about an hour or less.I gave them a 4 because they are small and will sometimes slip out of my fingers when I remove them from my ears.I have the Bose noise cancelling over ear headphones and these are (almost) comparable to those for sound.
timestamp: Reviewed in the United States March 26, 2022

title: 4.0 out of 5 stars Used only a couple hours...update at a month
author: C.U. Soon
content: 5 Months...Still awesome...Blue tooth range is superb..60, 70, 90' sometimes. Nice not to have to carry my phone as I work!! Nothing bad as of yet.Sony WF-C500I hate the books some people write so short and sweet. I have always bought budget brand earbuds...lose/break etc... but paid a bit more for my last pair from Motorola. Unfortunately I lost one of them while out cruising on my bike. So decided to again pay a bit more for a better quality brand. Motorola was a nice pair and no real complaints other than the select switch on the bud was very touchy but not a deal breaker...just be more careful.Out of the box on normal basic Sony settings I was twice as impressed by the sound quality as the MOTO. Down loaded the Sony app and it made a nice improvement but not overwhelmingly so. Having said that, this is my best favorite pair in the 10 pair in 4 yrs I have been using wireless earbuds. Battery bud is bigger than I like but not a deal breaker...stays in place, sound is the best I have yet heard in a pair of buds(a bit to much bass for me...I like more treble than most younger people so the app helped me there).For the price you can't be to unhappy with this pair. If you are a uber discerning audiophile pay 3-400 and get the best but if just purely listening well floats your boat as it does me...these do an most excellent job.Now a several weeks in and still awesome...Connection- GreatSound- very good and very adjustable with appbattery/charging- GreatDefinitely repurchase if I lose or damage this pair!!2 months...still awesome...nothing bad to addBattery is greatStay put in the earSound is great

title: 4.0 out of 5 stars Very good
author: ariel villalona
content:
these in ears have several points to highlight.

1. Noise cancellation is passive, even with the headphones turned off, the outside noise is greatly reduced. Already with music on, it cancels out like 85% of the noise I feel this percentage lower depending on how loud the outside noise is.

2. The comfort is super super good, since I received them I use it 10 hours in a row every day, and it's as if I didn't have anything on. They don't fall off if I move my head, it doesn't bother, they fit well.

3. connectivity, the distance is very good. I can leave my cell phone in one place and walk around the house without losing sound quality.

4. I don't know if the battery is due to my use, but it lasts longer than the brand says. I charge them once every 3, 4 days.

5. the functions (buttons) are easy to use, and even though they are physical buttons, it doesn't bother to press them. And here's why I don't give them 5 stars:

when I use a single earphone, I lose all the functions of the headset that I'm not using. In my opinion, they should have kept the options of the right earphone, which are to change and pause the songs, because if I use only the left one I have to use the mobile phone if I want to pause or change a song.
timestamp: Reviewed in the United States January 16, 2023

title: 4.0 out of 5 stars Not this time Sony!
author: Josh G.
content: I bought these ear buds mainly for gym workouts and jogging outside. And overall they are decent earbuds but if you're a music holic like me than you may not be too satisfied. I always been a big fan of Sony products and have had their earbuds in the past so I thought these were going to be great for me. Pros: Battery life is amazing! I used them for about a week before the battery was even close to dying. And I don't use them just a few times a day, I listen to music bascally all day long after work and at gym. So I am extremely impressed with the battery life. Also, they feel very comfortable in your ear, you can barely feel they are in there. Another pro is that they are easy to store in their case and the case is small enough to put in your pocket to carry around. Cons: Doesn't have the best noise cancellation and volume is kind of low. title: 1.0 out of 5 stars Readme 1st: Not for Windows users... Mediocre sound quality even by Sony standards.
author: Persepolis
content: This is on the cheaper end of Sony's offerings, given the price tag I would at a minimum expect good quality... wrong. It falls short of a 10 year old wired Sony MDREX58V, at 3x the price...Here are the pro's and con's:Pro: Quick bluetooth connect/disconnects.Con: Audio quality is just BAD... tinny and weak out of the box. It falls short of an older Sony MDREX58V I have which is only $20, it falls short of most $20-$30 no-name ear buds, and falls, and falls pretty close to a set of freebie earbuds I got while flying United a few years back. This is not good! I think Sony tried to differentiate between their high end offerings so badly that they killed the quality on this one so they can fill the lower price tier.Pro: Comfortable fit, lighter than some of the other ear buds I've used.Con: Software to control behavior is only available on Android and iOS... so if you're using it on a Windows PC, while it will pair and it will "function", it sounds like crap... and it will stay that way. In 2019, there were about 850mil iPhones in use... and about 900mil Windows PC's in use... not sure the what ledge the MBA's hit their heads on before deciding Windows users don't get the app thats needed to properly use these earbuds. For yuks sake, I do have both an iOS device and an Android... and installed the app on both of those... and the sound quality didn't get much better by adjusting the equalization envelope. Increasing the base just seemed to eat away at the midrange... It was weird to say the least.Pro: It can be reasonably loud. So you're getting mediocre sound, just loud mediocre sound... LOL.Anyways... summary: This is a low price offering from Sony that has been neutered so they can offer you something for $60... the only problem is that it performs worse than the $20 offering from others.Lack of a Windows app was not a particularly good decision given how low performing these are... a little bit of signal processing could have helped save these a bit...Summary: Save your money... Go with something cheaper or better... these miss the mark.

title: 5.0 out of 5 stars Very impressive!
author: David L
content: I have enjoyed just about everything about using these. The sound quality is pretty great, the battery life is exceptional, the range is good enough that I can take the garbage out without taking these out... There's very little to dislike. And there are one or two nitpicks I have. The first is that, while the headphones recharge incredibly quickly in the carrying case (it takes about an hour for them to go from 0-100%, in my experience), the case itself charges pretty slowly. I would recommend charging it overnight. The second is that there are still some small technical problems. The headphones occasionally don't charge for whatever reason (this is typically fixed by just slightly moving them in their charging compartments), and I occasionally do need to restart my laptop to get them to reconnect. Neither of those are dealbreakers, and I would highly recommend these headphones, especially if they're going to stay at $70 for the foreseeable future.

title: 5.0 out of 5 stars Sony Quality Shines Through with these Earbuds!
author: Shawshank
content: I ordered these earbuds because I wanted a quality set of earbuds that weren't a cheap throwaway pair after a year but didn't want to drop the coin on a set of Apple or Bose earbuds. Sony has a good rep in the consumer electronics space and after doing a little research outside of Shamazon, I decided I would give the WF-C500's a shot. A few things I like about these specific buds.1. Fitment - they fit in my ears well and they stay in my ears without causing hot spots or pain points.2. Battery life - I can't give you a precise number, but I can use these earbuds throughout the day and even into the night and still have some battery life in the morning.3. Sound - These specific earbuds I use primarily for listening to Audible audiobooks, so I don't need an eardrum ticking base or eye-watering treble highs, that said I did test these out with a few of my favorite artists - Hank Williams, Willie Nelson, Armin Van Buuren, Tiesto, AC/DC, old Van Halen, Vivaldi, the usual stuff we all listen to and in each style of music, I was very pleased, it was accurately represented within the context of having a half thimble-sized device stuck in my ear. Win. I also use these for phone calls, when someone calls and interrupts my audiobook, and I've always gotten good feedback from the other person on the call, in terms of clarity, volume of voice, and even outdoors, the wind management seemed to not negatively impact my call.4. Earbud controls - There is a pro/con to the way you control these earbuds. I'll flat-out tell you I am not a fan of the touch-sensitive earbuds. I have big hand and rarely do I touch it in the way it wants to be touched and I end up hanging up on someone while I'm trying to turn up the volume or whatever the case is. The WF-C500's are more of a button-press kind of thing. It's tactile - you know exactly what your finger is doing when it's doing it because of that tactile feedback. I freaking love that. Super-duper simple!! So what's the con Shawshank? Glad you asked. It's probably a horrible habit but I use one of the earbuds when I go to sleep. Usually an audiobook, might be some Ludovico Einaudi, or that soothing ocean or thunderstorm sound with some good ol' scripture in the background. The problem is I'm a side-sleeper and SOMETIMES when I roll over to the side that has the earbud in it, the pillow will act like my finger and hit that little tactile button and pause whatever I'm listening to. I can hit it again and be a little more careful when I put my head back on the pillow, but that does happen. It's probably a bad habit anyway, but that's the con of the controls on these earbuds, from my POV anyway.5. Overall quality - I really can't complain about these earbuds. I've dropped them in the sink while washing my face, and forgotten to take them out when taking a shower (I realized after the water hit my head that I was still listening to whatever it was I was listening to, but they got a good dose of water sprayed on them, and there were times where one did fall out of my ear, primarily because I didn't seat it well.I have been so pleased with these earbuds, that I bought my 17 yr old son a pair and he is also very happy with them. He listens to music primarily, 70-80-90's music (yeah he has good taste in music for a teenager.) :-)An update after I had written this. I ran into a problem with the left earbud not connecting to BT. I contacted Sony support because they have a 1 yr limited warranty, and I bought these back in May of last year. We tried doing a full reset, which didn't correct the problem. The CSR provided me the info to send them back, I received an email with a FedEx shipping label, dropped them off at the Fedex in a Dollar General nearby, 2 days later they arrived at the Sony repair facility, 1 day after that, Sony notified they had ordered a brand new pair of WF-C500's for me and I should get them next week.I'm not usually the kind of guy that gets massively butt-hurt when something breaks. Stuff happens. What I don't enjoy is when I am trying to correct a problem, be it a defect or whatever, with the manufacturer or the store and it becomes a battle of will and plain old integrity of service. My experience with Sony was outstanding. They asked me to try and correct the issue by doing a hard reset and when that didn't work, they moved right into replacement mode. I dig and respect that. So I wholeheartedly recommend this product. Unlike the growing number of Shamazonians who get free stuff to test and write reviews even though in all honestly sometimes they don't know crap about the product, I am a guy who buys his own stuff and in this case, I was 110% daily user of these Sony WF-C500 earbuds - at home, in my truck, at the gym, in the kitchen, in the bathroom (oops), outside mowing my grass and running my airplane sounding weedeater, in all cases this audio was good, and most importantly, I didn't lose one out of my ear and run my mower over it. As far as "noise cancellation", I will just refer to the numerous times my bride yelled at me because I didn't hear her when she was talking to me. I suppose in some regards that counts as "noise cancellation". (my beautiful Brazilian bride, if you happen to read this, you know your man loves ya.)BLUF (Bottom Line Up Front): They feel good in the ear. They sound good in the ear. You don't look like you have a Chernobyl growth sticking out of your ears like some of the other earbuds. Perhaps best of all - Sony sticks behind their products and they understand what excellent customer service should be. These are the factors that drive my review and are the reason I bought a pair for my son, to whom I don't give him a rock when he asks for bread if you know what I mean. But he never asked for these, I knew the pair he had for 3+ years was having issues and wanted to surprise him. He was surprised on top of being happy. That's probably the highest recommendation I can provide, for what I give to the absolute pride and joy of my life - well I can't see these not being good enough for the King of England if they're good enough for my son.I'll TRY to remember and update my review with some pics when I get the new earbuds. Chances are however, that I will forget and probably remember when I'm in a situation that precludes me from executing the review update in that moment I'm thinking about it. But I'll try. BTW the price dropped on these. I paid $90 bucks for my pair and my sons pair, and I think I saw them for $70ish or $79 and they are worth every buck of that even at $90.
timestamp: Reviewed in the United States February 23, 2024

title: 5.0 out of 5 stars These are the best I have tried!
author: John
content: I don't write many reviews but after recently trying many different earbuds, I hope I can help others in their search. First off, I have spent over 20 years in the audio industry and consider myself myself somewhat of an audiophile - so sound quality is very important. Unfortunately, that time in the audio industry listening at high DBs has no doubt cost me some hearing - so strong volume is also very important to me.Thanks to Amazon's return policy I have tried many highly rated ear buds under $100 on the market:Ear Fun Free Pro 2 = Great sound, great NC, good volume but would NOT stay in my ears,Soundcore Anker Life P3 = great sound quality, features, but NOT loud enough.SoundPeats MiniPro AC = Great volume, good sound but stick out way too far and fall out of my ears.Palm Buds Pro = just not loud enough!Soundcore Life A2 NC+ = Great Sound, Great volume, great features but stick out too far and also fall out of my ers!Now on to these Sony WF-C500s = Great sound, very good volume, 10 hour battery life, well designed case, nice app, and fit my ears like a glove. Heck I can even side sleep and not usually press a control accidentally, I have had no problems with people hearing me on phone calls. I can work out and they don't fall out of my ears! While they are not overly bass heavy (more true to the music), it can't be beefed up with the EQ in the app. I made a Custom EQ with pretty much the same settings as the Treble Boost EQ but raised the Clear Bass setting. The result is more than adequate bass, good separation and very good volume. I ordered all the above buds about the same time and when I tried these Sony's I figured they were the keeper. After trying all the others I mentioned, I kept coming back to these WF-C500s! Did I mention these fit like they were actually designed to go in a person's ears?
timestamp: Reviewed in the United States April 5, 2022

title: 4.0 out of 5 stars First impression - You get what you pay for
author: Jake
content: Had these for a day now. They're alright.They stay in my ears surprisingly well, the battery lasts much longer than I'll ever need it to. The case is made of a pretty cheap feeling plastic, but the buds themselves feel higher quality.My main issue with these is that the audio quality (by default, at least) is HORRIBLE. Maybe I'm just spoiled by higher quality, wired earbuds but they are far below average by most standards. The saving grace, however, is that the app lets you tamper with the different levels and tune the audio to your liking. I managed to get it to sound a bit better, but I couldn't find a way to make the audio any louder which is unfortunate. The buds are very quiet.Overall they're pretty good. If you're able to spend more, it may be worth it, but they're great value for the price.

title: 5.0 out of 5 stars These provide so much value for such little cost.
author: DRenteria
content: I have had these for about two years now and they are still working as good as new. The battery holds an insane amount of charge time that allows you to use them for long durations before it needs to be charged. The sound quality is great, the noise cancellation is good, but most importantly it is a product that lasts.When you set these up they will try to convince you to download apps that are supposed to help with their sound quality or something. I would suggest downloading them, configuring them, then deleting the apps, as the apps themselves want permission to your Bluetooth and local network, no thanks. The headphones will continue to work perfectly fine across any device without their mobile apps installed.Good buy for portable use, as it wont be as devasting if they are lost or stolen.

title: 3.0 out of 5 stars My first wireless earbuds (good for on the go but that's it)
author: Scott D. Briggs
content: I've only had them for a day or two so haven't used them extensively yet, but, I can see whatthe usual Bluetooth shortcomings are. The comfort level isn't great although it depends on earsand type and size of the tips, ok, they fit snug, they charge easily and last a long time on charge,very convenient for running around town, etc. walks, exercise, shopping, etc. However, with myiPhone or lossless player, I never, ever achieve the type of power and volume and quality levelsthat I get with my full wired headphone amp/player Fiio rig. These get somewhat loud butnot very, they seem to be limited to a certain threshold and it doesn't matter what the sourceis. I never have those issues with my full wired headphone and IEM rig.For serious listeningI would opt for the latter, always, but the Sony C500 are good when I just want to run aroundtown and even drive and cannot use the full rig I have. The comfort level wasn't great,though, which is a reason I often don't love IEMs or earbuds. For the money these soundpretty good, clear, but I cannot get the type of audiophile performance from them I wouldhope for, due to the wireless, so I guess I just don't love wireless so far. Meanwhile I owna brand new 70 watts per channel BT speaker that blows these earbuds out of the waterin every respect. But that's a fully amped full range portable speaker.Until Sony and other mfgrs. come up with a fully built-in self-amplified BT IEM or earbud,these will be for convenience only, really. They are cool but don't make me want to sitwith them in my ears (uncomfortably) for hours on end. For the $45 that I paid for themthough, I guess they're a good value for on the go usage. They were easy to pair and easyto figure out how to use them for controlling them, and the Sony apps. I downloaded to usewith them seem to work just fine, but what's the use of EQ and all that when the deviceitself is limited totally in terms of amp power and volume? And the power coming outof the iPhone is limited?
timestamp: Reviewed in the United States October 13, 2022

title: 5.0 out of 5 stars Durability, dependability and excellent sound.
author: Kindle Customer
content: I purchased these ear buds 1 year 9 months ago, and use them virtually every day, for hours. I use one at a time, as I need to be aware of other things around me. They are sweat proof, I can vouch for that . Two summers in the AZ desert, and they‚Äôre still going. They sound great for music, videos, streaming tv, and my favorite- audiobooks. I only have two complaints, which really are small enough that when I need to replace them, I will ABSOLUTELY be getting more Sonys!1. I wish you could use the start/stop button feature on either earbud. I tend to use one at a time, so when the battery dies, and I switch, I can‚Äôt use the start/stop feature on the left earbud.2. Sometimes when charging, they don‚Äôt get good contact, so they don‚Äôt charge. I always check to make sure the light is on, but sometimes it just stops, and you have to adjust it to start charging again.With those two very small complaints taken into consideration, it‚Äôs a very small inconvenience for an extremely high quality product that I use on average, probably 8 hours per day, 6 days per week.If I could give these earbuds a better rating, I would.

title: 3.0 out of 5 stars Okay, but a couple design flaws
author: shang
content: I've been a part time audio engineer for decades, so I have a pretty good ear. Overall they sound pretty good for under $50. The 2 issues I encountered are:1) They don't get loud enough. I used them while I was mowing my lawn and the noise cancelling gets rid of some of the background noise, but not enough to immerse a person in their music if there's something loud in the background.2) They don't go deep enough into the ear canal. In ear monitors need to couple with your ear canal in order to stay in place and reproduce low frequencies well. This made them very light in the bass and if I tried to boost the bass with my phone's EQ, it would start to distort at "high" volumes.If they went about a 1/4" deeper it might take care of both problems. I'll probably look for different ear pieces to attach to these that will go deeper into the ear canal.

timestamp: Reviewed in the United States August 24, 2023
product_name: Panasonic ErgoFit RZ-B310W - True Wireless Earbuds

title: 4.0 out of 5 stars Solid product for the price, but not hifi.
author: hi viz backpack
content: These earbuds are great! They pair with my phone quickly and reliably. Battery life is certainly all I need. They work great for phone calls / Zoom. Plastic is solid, etc. Panasonic engineers really did a good job with all these important "liveability" considerations.Where these earbuds fall short is sound quality. I'd say fidelity from these is in the ballpark of television sound. For news, podcasts, audiobooks, social media, they're smooth and spoken content is perfectly intelligible. But you won't see YoYo Ma listening to music with them. I mean, c'mon, they cost $25-$30. If you want high fidelity, open your wallet.When listening to music, I have other very good options for hifi playback. These little Panasonics are for carrying in my pocket day to day, and if one gets lost, it's not the end of the world thanks to their low price.
timestamp: Reviewed in the United States February 11, 2024
product_name: Panasonic ErgoFit RZ-B310W - True Wireless Earbuds

title: 5.0 out of 5 stars Very nice
author: Bridgette
content: Being a huge fan of the Panasonic ergofit wired buds, these were a prime choice for my first pair of Bluetooth earbuds ever. Suffice to say I love Bluetooth earbuds now and will never go back to wired. These buds are great. The charge lasts forever. With a good custom EQ, and Dolby Atmos ON, they provide very nice bass and clear voices. The sound quality is on par with the wired version, all things being equal, as these do have the extra bass from their larger drivers.The buds are black, clean, and no fuss with a neat little angle in them for the "ergo-fit" gimmick. I don't think they fit any better than other earbuds, but they do look nice. The buds are also quite large with their 10mm drivers, almost seeming oversized. This gives them a more expensive look.Unlike my husband's other brand of wireless buds, these buds have NO LEDs on the buds themselves, which I quite enjoy. No annoying red/blue lights blinking constantly, and also saves battery, I imagine.Pairing was very simple and quick on my S20 Ultra, without reading any instructions whatsoever, and just opening the case, they immediately showed in the Bluetooth connection and paired quickly. They seem to pair far faster and more reliably than my husband's wireless buds. Simply turn bluetooth on, and tap "RZ-B310W". My husband's initial set up for his buds was an annoying dance of pairing each bud separately, and opening and closing the case. These buds both pair at same time, every time for me, and can connect even when they're inside the case charging.The case is nice, minimalistic and has a nice magnetic snap close. No LED screen like my husband's earbuds, but I find that an unnecessary expense. There's a little red LED light to show when it's charging. The tiny case holds many hours of charge, and I'm surprised daily that the buds just keep going, even though I'm wearing them a good portion of the day.The buds snap magnetically into their ports, and I will admit it can be a pain when you go to put them back in figuring out which one goes in which port, as they only go in one way.The buds fit in my ears is "OK", not perfect. I have small ear canals. They do stay in, but I can tell when the seal gets broken if I smile or laugh and they move out of place the tiniest bit.That's a small annoyance rather niche for people with tiny ear canals like myself though.I never read the instructions so figured out by trial and error how to activate the different modes and things like pause. Currently to change mode, I cup my palm against the bud as if to push it further in my ear for a couple seconds until I hear the voice over saying what's been activated. Still haven't figured out exactly where to touch and hold with one finger to change modes, but my way works for me.To pause/play, I press a fingertip against the round back of the bud. Unfortunately it's probably quicker to just use your phone to pause/play, as you cannot just tap the bud but have to press and hold for a second. On the other hand, that's a positive as it's much harder to accidentally hit it, unlike my husband's buds, where he often hangs up mid-call because he pushed the bud for a split second to get it back in his ear fully.So, about the noise cancellation, it's pretty nice! There's definitely a noticeable difference between the three modes. I didn't buy these for noise cancelling, but wanted to try it out as I've never had noise cancelling buds.There's "Ambient Sound", which amplifies your surrounding noise to hear comfortably even while wearing earbuds. Makes hearing others, and safety sounds like traffic, loud and clear. Not ideal to use when just chilling at home, as it makes surrounding noise very loud, but great in public or if walking/jogging/biking on a road or having a conversation with someone else.There's the option "Off" which seems to be just the default experience of wearing normal earbuds. Sound is slightly muffled, but still comes through.Finally, the option for "Noise Cancelling", which is quite striking when you use it for the first time. In my room with an AC on and white noise in the background, it dramatically lowered the apparent noise coming into my ears to a near imperceptible whisper. If I didn't know better, I would've thought there was NO AC or white noise in my room and it was near-silent.So, the noise cancellation works great for continuous sounds, yes. But other dynamic noises like human voices, it doesn't work as well. If you are buying these for the noise cancelling element, like if you, say, live in a noisy house and want to sleep better at night, I'd choose a more robust set with great active noise cancelling. Or if you just want to drown out ALL noise around you. But I will say, with noise cancelling on, and some brown noise playing on the buds from YouTube, that would provide a good night's sleep in a noisy home for sure, and it's been done many times by myself since getting these buds.... Only issue is finding them in the morning as they inevitably fall out with my tossing and turning!But I didn't buy these for noise cancelling, though it was a gimmick I wanted to try. I bought these for sound quality, and they deliver, when set up correctly. I've never been one to just use the default sound settings on my phone/PC for any pair of buds I've had, but my initial impression from the DEFAULT EQ on my S20 Ultra was that, out of the box, the buds were too bass-forward for me, at the loss of necessary mids and highs. They sounded a bit, muffled. In music, I prefer the voice to be at the forefront and crystal clear in the genres I enjoy. I also listen to a lot of podcasts, so I quickly did a custom EQ to suit my needs, and I recommend everyone does for *any* pair of headphones they have, as it can make a huge difference. I do listen to rap and hip-hop occasionally, but if that is your *predominant* preference, these may be perfect for you out of the box without adjustment. For other genres and general listening, in my opinion, these are too bassy. I want the bass to be there, but not as front as it comes in these earbuds.There's a nifty setting on the newer android phones to make a custom EQ right in the sound settings without a separate app, and even a way to get a personalized EQ by testing your hearing, to adjust for the loss of perception that comes with age. I recommend playing around with that and making your own custom equalizer to suit your needs if you don't like the initial sound quality.It's exceedingly rare I get a pair of headphones that sound to my liking out of the box, as these days heavy bass is so championed.All that being said, I'm very satisfied with my first set of wireless buds, and I think Panasonic knocked it out of the park at this price point, just like they did with the ergo-fit wired buds I've loved for years.
timestamp: Reviewed in the United States June 24, 2024

title: 4.0 out of 5 stars For the price they are pretty good, but not a great fit for my son
