title: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great sound, great value, recommend, USE EQUALIZER
author: TG
content: The media could not be loaded. This is one of the best mobile speakers I have heard. It also makes a great speaker phone addition and suppresses noise from either party. A huge difference between just your phone and this when the other party is driving (all car noise is gone as compared to my phone by itself; huge difference). I purchased mine on a Biz trip in Europe, paid 80 Euros for SRS-XE300 Amazon.de .Here are some of my finding which should also help those who have trouble with the sound adjustments (there are many incorrect one-star reviews) and this is my suggestions to get it right:1) the Sony Bluetooth speaker has settings for bass, mid, and treble. They can be set with the Sony music app or directly in your music app as for example Amazon Music (see attached equalizer picture from within Amazon Music app on my mobile device)2) Make sure there is no competing app on your phone to override sound settings.3) Amazon Music has an equalizer (see attached picture in the app) that you can use with preset genres of music or for custom settings. This one seem better than the Sony Music Center app4) If you have two devices connected to it i.e. a mobile phone and a laptop like i had, make sure to disconnect the laptop in my case, so my mobile phone can control the speaker without interference from another device.Some things to know if you like specs and which you cannot find in the product description, but I wanted to know beforehand (but didn't find):1) Audio range is from 20Hz to 20,000 Hz at a 44.1kHz sampling frequency2) speakers are full range type (20Hz-20kHz 49mm x 71 mm), two speakers in enclosure3) Enclosure type is passive radiator. [Sounds fantastic]4) Bluetooth standard/version is 5.2 spec (Maximum line of sight distance 30 meters)5) Unit has built in microphone so you can use as a speakerphone/conference speaker on the go6) Microphone is omni-directional 100Hz-8000Hz (so covers speech spectrum)7) operating range 5'C - 35'C (so in summer protect from direct sunshine).8) Water and salt water resistant IP-67 standard compliant9) Comes with heavy duty 3A charge cable only, no charger. Will need a 3Ampere USB C port charger. 5 hrs charging time with a 3A charger. Forever with any other... get the correct current capable charger of 3A (or more)10) 10 minutes charging provides 70 minutes playback (if you use the proper 3A charger)Couldn't find anything on music power, but is plenty within a 10 meter vicinity I 'ld say.I recommend the Amazon Music App equalizer over the Sony Music Center App which will allow to adjust (lift/lower) base, middle, treble. There may be third party Equalizer apps that you can explore*.In the Amazon app when you look at your song at the right bottom click on "..." (more choices); from there, you'll see the Equalizer to go to. Click on it and you get the screen with the frequency levers to lift or reduce a limited band of audio frequencies (see attached image and video on how to do it and impact).If the video sounds poorly out of your laptop it is your lap top, not the speaker nor the recording. On that one you have to trust me :) .*= I found a third party equalizer called "SOUND Beautifier" which can be downloaded in the Android Play Store free of charge. Play Amazon Music then open this app and "beautify" your sound (at this point this app will overwrite your Amazon Music equalizer settings). Very easy to use, though I prefer a traditional equalizer look/function. See attached screenshot for this app. I like it though. Easy to maximize sound to your liking.Total awesome astonishing sound for a mobile unit. Recommend strongly.
timestamp: Reviewed in the United States March 26, 2024

title: 5.0 out of 5 stars SRS-XE300 - SRS-XG300 - SRS-XG500 review
author: Marco.
content: I'm going to submit the same review for all three speakers. The reason I'm doing that is because my plan is to use them in my backyard around the pool in a party/group configuration.Each speaker has its pros and cons obviously. But I'm going to speak about the size, weight and sound compared to each other. All three have excellent build quality and look really sharp. Each has a really nice fabric accompanied with rubberized plastic that's easy to grip. Each unit also had a nice heavy/dense feel to it. I'm assuming that's attributed to battery size, considering the runtime that these are stated to have. I have not tested the endurance of the batteries yet but will follow up with that as I know more.SRS-XE300 X-Series: this one really punches above its weight. The sound for such a small speaker is actually really good. And it has a surprising amount of bass for its size and the clarity of the treble is wonderful. The configuration of the speaker openings are quite strange on this model, and you wouldn‚Äôt think it would be effective but it really sounds good but correct physical placement of the speaker is the key to get great lows-mids-highs from this. I was quite surprised at the quality of sound for the lowest price.SRS-XG300 X-Series: this is a nice sounding speaker and it really has a great size and weight to it. I was a little disappointed as I thought that it should have had a lot more bass compared to the SRS-XE300 but it does have a sufficient amount. Maybe the smaller XE300 just surprised me with the amount of bass that it has? I ordered a package unit that included a case that is of decent quality. The nice part about the case is that it has a small compartment to house the included USB C charging unit.SRS-XG500 X-Series: this thing is really stout and gets really loud if that's what you want, while still sounding great. For a speaker the size of an old style boombox, the bass will thump your skull. One of the cons for this model is that it doesn't charge via USB C. It uses a barrel tip charger while the other two use USB C. It would be nice if Sony made them all consistent. And compared to the other 2 speakers, this one feels like the battery isn‚Äôt as heavy in comparison to its size. Not sure if that will impact battery life as I‚Äôve not tested that yet.The first time I tried the party/group speaker configuration the sound volume was imbalanced out of each speaker. The way to rectify that is to turn the volume to zero on your Bluetooth device after you've created the group to level-set their volumes at 0. At that point all of their volumes should stay in sync when you volume up via Bluetooth.Full disclosure, I bought the XE300 and the XG500 refurbished. The XG300 was brand new. The refurbished models that I bought were in excellent shape. I would recommend powering them up and playing them for 4-5 hours to make sure that they are in good shape after being refurb‚Äôd.
timestamp: Reviewed in the United States July 19, 2023

title: 4.0 out of 5 stars RUGGED and FLEXIBLE - Good BASS - Midrange and highs a little off - EXCELLENT SPEAKERPHONE
author: R.S.
content: First off - up front - I used to work in the consumer audio field. The company I worked for made bluetooth speakers and other audio devices, I have over 15 years of experience in this particular segment (not in the segment anymore).QUICK TAKE - As someone who knows just how hard it is to engineer and design a portable speaker with exceptional battery life, connectivity and pleasing audio my first take on this device is I'm genuinely impressed.The lack of the fifth star is simply because there's not a half-star option to make it a 4.5-star product. The reason for the .5 docking? The mids and highs tend to be a bit overwhelmed with certain types of music.Jazz - Sounds amazing - great separation of instruments and nice tones (especially piano and guitar)Rock - Sounds great - the speaker can handle a lot of sound at onceR&B / Urban - Heavy bass starts to muddy things up a bit - there's no DISTORTION (which is important to note) but the bass can get overwhelming since it's pretty powerful in this model. Bassheads will absolutely love this speaker.Electronica - Same issue as with the R&B / Urban - if it's a bass-heavy track you will lose detail in the mids and highs.The build quality just feels GOOD in your hand. Nice and solid with the silicone outer shell feeling QUALITY and not cheap. The fabric outer edging is also durable and a nice contrast with the silicone shell. I dunked this sucker in an ice tub and it kept on ticking right afterwards - the IP rating makes this one safe to take with you pretty much anywhere.THE GOOD STUFF:- Exceptional build quality - feels good in the hand and a nice weight- EXCELLENT battery life - rated for 24 hours but will be closer to 17-18 at higher volumes (which is still VERY good battery life)- Amazing to use as a bluetooth conference speaker. My colleagues say my voice sounds better over this speaker than on my bluetooth headset (also Sony) and their voices come out crystal clear on calls- USB C Charging (THANK YOU SONY!)- Easy to use controls - very straightforward and easy to engage- Good audio quality (see comments above) - bordering on excellent with bass tones being a bit overbearing at higher volumes- Sony Music Center APP allows you to tune the speaker and is easy to set up (which does help with some of the bass overdrive, DEFINITELY download this if you purchase, you won't regret it)- When STEREO mode is enabled in APP it adds a much better separation of audio on the speaker (game changer)THE NOT SO GOOD STUFF:- Can be bass-heavy with specific types of music at higher volumes- Stereo separation could be better - but honestly for an outdoor by the pool speaker battery life and volume are keys to enjoying this one - it DOES outperform some of the smaller and popular other Bluetooth portable speakers quite handily though- You really need the app to tune this speaker to make it shine - there's no on device controls to fine tune the audio profile (DEFINITELY TURN ON STEREO MODE - default comes in Mono)WORTH IT? As I said earlier, this speaker impresses. I REALLY wish there was a .5 star option so I could give this one the extra .5, but since people are spending their money I err on the side of caution. I have a pretty huge selection of Bluetooth Speakers to choose from here at home and this model is now my favorite one in its size range. The long battery life and audio quality are great and the product just FEELS like its going to last given the exceptional build quality. Definitely worth a purchase if you're looking for something to have by the pool, take camping, or even a pretty amazing speakerphone for work and team calls.
timestamp: Reviewed in the United States September 10, 2022

title: 4.0 out of 5 stars Really good sound quality, nice features, long battery life (but no 3.5mm Aux port)
author: Customer Review
content: Having tried the SRS-XE200 and this, especially considering the current price of both, I think the better value is this model. That‚Äôs assuming you will be listing to music on this, and taking it places with you. The battery life is 33% larger, lasting a full 24 hours of music playback at half volume. The sound quality is better and more impactful. I really enjoyed listening with this speaker and the smaller one was more ‚Äújust ok‚Äù sounding. I like that the Music Center app (on iOS/Android) supports this speaker and lets you control playback, adjust sound settings, and update the firmware.I think that the current $150 price makes this a decent value if you appreciate having above average sound quality, quick charging, app support, Google fast pair, and other quality-of-life features you wouldn‚Äôt get on a more budget-oriented Bluetooth speaker from a less prominent name brand in electronics. The one disappointment with this product is a lack of 3.5mm headphone jack, for auxiliary connections. I don‚Äôt understand why they couldn‚Äôt have included it for times when you need a wired option.
timestamp: Reviewed in the United States January 30, 2023

title: 4.0 out of 5 stars BIG speaker, great sound
author: Austin
content: When I unboxed this speaker I was surprised how large it was. Our Bluetooth speaker we used for years before was a Bose Soundlink and this one is at least twice the size of that. It‚Äôs got a smooth feel to it and a nice design with speakers that wrap around from top to bottom. I like how you can stand it up vertical or set it down horizontal depending on where you want to place it.I mostly play Spotify music from my phone and this will get pretty loud but the music remains crisp. I would compare the sound output to the newest Echo (the large one, not the Dot). The bass isn‚Äôt anything special in my opinion. You can control the volume from either the speaker itself or your phone but one thing I noticed is you can‚Äôt set the speaker to a certain volume and then control it differently from your phone. What I mean is if you wanted the speaker to be about 50% when your phone is turned up to 100%, that‚Äôs not possible. Min and max volume on your phone is the same min and max volume on the speaker. I like how there‚Äôs a battery button that when you click it, it will tell you how much battery is left. For example, ‚Äúbattery about 40%‚Äù.Overall a sleek looking speaker that‚Äôs easy to charge and has a long lasting battery. It‚Äôs definitely on the heavier side and with it being such a big device, it might be a little difficult to pack for trips, depending on how much space you have. The sound quality is good but I expected a little more from Sony. It‚Äôs a large device so I would think it could get a little louder than it does, but still plenty loud to fill a room. Overall a quality speaker, little high on price but pretty comparable to other well-know brands.
timestamp: Reviewed in the United States September 22, 2022

title: 4.0 out of 5 stars Rugged all-weather Bluetooth speaker.
author: Jane Fairchild
content: This Bluetooth speaker from Sony is waterproof, dustproof, and shockproof making it the perfect ally whenever you're on the go.Its a good size, not especially small, but still small enough to fit into a backpack easily. It fits nicely on a tabletop and can be used either laying down or standing up.There's a decent range of volume available, but its not the speaker for you if you're looking to party all the time. Its just not designed for that.The sound quality is also not the greatest, but its okay. Sound is a little flat, and there's a notable absence of highs and upper mids.But this speaker wasn't meant for audiophile level sound reproduction. Instead its a great speaker to take with you wherever you go without having to worry about dropping it or getting it wet.So far I've used it in the kitchen while cooking up a meal. I'm a messy chef so there's splashing and food everywhere. While I haven't dropped it yet, it doesn't feel especially vulnerable.The controls are easy to press even with dirty hands. And the exterior is easy to wipe clean.Bluetooth pairing with multiple devices went off without a hitch, and switching between the devices was seamless as well.So far battery life has been very good.Overall, I'm looking forward to having it on hand. Its nice knowing that it can handle being shown a little tough love without breaking.Recommended.
timestamp: Reviewed in the United States September 7, 2022

title: 4.0 out of 5 stars Very good speaker, could use better high end
author: Goodeknight
content: Took me a few minutes to figure out this speaker sounds best lying on its side.The speaker has really nice sound, including pretty good bass, but it could use a little more high-end. It's lacking a good tweeter. Still, overall, it produces very good sound quality, even at max volume. Little or no distortion.It has some weight to it, and feels very sturdy, like it could handle a drop from a few feet. That's good, especially for something that will be mobile. It's supposed to be able to handle full submersion in water up to 3 ft for half an hour. I'll take Sony's word for that, because I'm not going to test it myself. So I assume it could very easily withstand a little drizzle or sea spray, or even a heavy rain.I won't be downloading any apps for this, but it was easy enough to connect my phone to it via Bluetooth.By size and weight, this is somewhere between the little portable speakers, and modern style boomboxes with a handle. The sound is right in the middle of that range, too. You're not going to get the same volume or sound profile as a 60 watt boombox, but it will be far superior to most typical (smaller) portable speakers.If that's what you were looking for, I would recommend this.

title: 4.0 out of 5 stars Portable, dustproof speaker; easy to connect with clear, stereo sound; bass could be better

content: The media could not be loaded. I was very pleased overall with the durability and sound of this speaker. In a portable speaker, I want durability. This speaker definitely fits the bill. The charge port is even securely hidden by a rubber flap. The buttons are flush and integrated into the speaker body which I like.The sound of this speaker really carries. I have a small house. When this speaker is cranked up, I can hear it from anywhere in my house clearly. It's reminiscent of the sound of a stereo system rather than a portable speaker. This speaker can also be used as a speakerphone to take calls which is an added bonus. Battery life has been very good, with a reasonable charge time.Overall, this speaker has loud, crisp stereo like sound, is easy to use/set up, and is "IP67 life resistant" so you don't have to worry as much about it when using it on the go.

title: 5.0 out of 5 stars A rugged, water tight, speaker for the outdoors.
author: Bugs
content: The xe300 is Sony's answer to you being outside. The xe300 has a silicone shell with fabric. It feels rubbery and the 2.6Ibs are very manageable with it. The controls are simple and textured, and the usb type C is covered. There is no rgb, this is a no gimmicks portable speaker and all business. It feels great and is rated for 3ft of water for 30mins, dust tight, and feels like it would survive a drop. Functionality the ex300 is fantastic. It picks up bluetooth instantly and is fast enough for no noticeable lag. Many sound bars handle this worse. The performance of the 300 is ahead of the 200. The 300 for example offers strong bass, something the 200 completely lacks. It won't beat an actual base, but it is surprisingly good. The speaker functions best horizontally. This is because the stereo would come from the top and bottom if it was vertical rather than right and left. This is completely unavoidable in any speak like this. It is nice it offers the versatility The sound is decent, not jaw dropping, but really decent. It can get loud, it sounds a little muffled but is better than some sound bars for the same money. Then you take into account this has a 17hr real-time battery life, and then you should realize this is a speaker for the pool, camping, BBQ , projector, or fishing trip. It is light enough to take anywhere. This is a great little speaker for any outdoor activity. Sony and I are hit and miss, but they still have it when it comes to audio.

title: 5.0 out of 5 stars Sony has a winner on its hands: great sound, long battery life, and useful features
author: E. J. Hunyadi
content: I have to admit; Sony is synonymous with quality for me. I got this XE300 Bluetooth speaker with high expectations, and I was not let down. From the substantial feel of this speaker to the initial tones when you power it on for the first time, everything screams quality.Once you get it turned on and connected, the real fun begins. This speaker is loud and has a very nice bass presence. Is it going to over-power someone with a huge PA system? No. But it is loud enough that if you set it on your picnic table or on the towel on the beach in the middle of your gathering, you need to be careful to not have it on too loud, or you won't hear your friends and family talking!Bluetooth is super simple to connect, and while it's not necessary, there are Sony apps available for free to enhance your experience with this XE300.While Sony says sound is multi-directional, I found this to be about 90% true; there is one direction where it is obviously louder, but that's to be expected with a speaker like this. title: 3.0 out of 5 stars Missing Features
author: A. Antonio
content: Sony usually makes excellent audio equipment and they charge a premium for it. In this case, they made a few missteps.SOUNDThe out of the box sound quality is surprisingly subpar. It sounds muddled and it's VERY heavy on the bass. If you download their Music Center app, which is separate from their Headphones app, you can turn on ClearAudio+. This helps a lot. It improves the muddling, but it's still heavy on the bass. If you turn on ClearAudio+ you can't turn down the bass.APPThe app is okay, but it demands the question - Why is there a Music Center and a Headphones app? They could easily be combined. Together they would make a decent app, but apart they both lack features and you won't use them often.BUILDThe build is up to Sony's standards. It's solid and has a good weight to it. There is no evidence of corners being cut.FEATURESThere is where this speaker gets a big ding. Other speakers in a similar price range have better features. For instance - reverse charging and aux input are not present in this speaker. A similar speaker from JBL has those options, at a lower price point. This one is pretty bare bones when it comes to features.BATTERYThe battery life is legit. I've use this to play a few hours of music and roughly 18hrs of standby and phone calls. The battery is only down to 80%. The 24hr claim is for actual playback.SIDE NOTEA lot of speakers fire up, out the sides, or through a series of front facing speakers. This one is a little odd in that regard. This one fires out of the narrow strip of fabric. You have to pay attention to what direction that's pointing, as it has a huge impact on the sound.Basically there are better speakers in this price range. It's hard to find a good reason to recommend this speaker.

title: 3.0 out of 5 stars What happened to the once mighty Sony??????

content: So let me start off by saying I'm not an audiophile by any means, but I love listening to music; at work, in the car and at home, so I own plenty of bluetooth speakers and what better way to test the XE300 then by doing a blind test against some of them.I put the Sony up against the Sonos Roam, the Soundcore Flare 2 and the Soundcore Boombox Motion Plus. Yes I know they aren't all marketed as equal, but the prices are actually all pretty close (except for the Flare).After connecting them to my Samsung S22 Ultra each, I played 2 different songs on each device. In my opinion the Sony had the worst sound all the four. It sounded cloudy and muffled, even the bass wasn't that good. My wife as well as my 7 year old daughter (who sometimes I think is tone deaf) also choose the Sony speaker as the worst of the 4.I'm not sure if this can be fixed by a firmware update or maybe we just got a bad speaker but I was very surprised on how bad the sound was.I can't really recommend this portable speaker at all.P.S. title: 3.0 out of 5 stars The SRS-XE300 Didn't Meet my Expectations
author: Rob S
content: *Please note this is a review for the larger SRS-XE300.*I purchased this looking for a midsize travel speaker to use when carrying around my larger SRS-XG300 ("mini" boombox) isn't practical - ex. getting on a plane.Being so happy with that speaker, I decided to give the SRS-XE300 a try. But...I found myself a bit under-whelmed.PROS:- I was impressed with all the tinkering afforded by the application - my favorite feature in particular are the battery health features that limit charging to 90%: the first and last 10% of discharging/charging a lithium battery are where most of the wear occurs. Since Bluetooth speakers are hard to repair, ensuring battery longevity is important to me. But it does a great job offering lots of other controls over other sound features: stereo vs. mono mode, EQ, etc.- The bass was quite impressive for the size.- I didn't experience much distortion even when cranking it to higher volume levels.CONS -- It seems like this iteration of Sony speaker put a diffuser to help "direct" sound out of one side of the speaker - and I found that this significantly degraded treble performance off-axis. I have hearing difficulties, and even after fiddling with the EQ and volume, I was never happy with the clarity of vocals especially if I wasn't standing directly in-line with that opening. Increasing the volume would make it uncomfortably loud. Perhaps it wouldn't have been as big of an issue had I purchased *two* XE300's to make a very directional stereo pair, but at that point the space savings over the XG300 would be moot--not to mention the increase in cost..I ended up returning this for the JBL Flip 6 and that design seems to work better for me, though the bass response is nowhere near as impressive as this nor is the app's feature set.Overall: I think this is worth a try, but personally, if a small size is not a factor, I would HIGHLY recommend making the jump up to the SRS-XG300 - now THAT is a kickass speaker.
timestamp: Reviewed in the United States September 9, 2023

title: 5.0 out of 5 stars This is the IT speaker
author: Noah
content: Firstly, I must say that the sound quality is absolutely incredible. These speakers provide an immersive audio experience, allowing you to truly feel the music and get lost in its rhythm. Whether you're enjoying your tunes or cranking up the volume for a dance party, this speaker is guaranteed to impress. The bass is deep and punchy, adding that extra kick to your music.One aspect that really stood out to me is its portability. Despite its powerful sound output, this speaker is surprisingly compact and lightweight. You can effortlessly carry it with you wherever you go, be it a picnic or a fun beach gathering. Moreover, with its IP67 rating, it's designed to withstand dust and water, making it ideal for all kinds of escapades.Connecting to this speaker couldn't be easier thanks to its Bluetooth functionality. Pairing it with my phone was a breeze, and I experienced no issues with the connection throughout my usage. Furthermore, the speaker offers a range that grants me freedom of movement without any concerns about losing connectivity.Battery life is always a concern when using speakers; however, the Sony SRS-XG300 has got you covered in that department. With a 24-hour battery life, you can enjoy music all day and night without needing to worry about recharging. It even comes with a USB port, allowing you to conveniently charge your devices while on the move.Finally, the design is sleek and contemporary. It's evident that Sony has meticulously considered every aspect, from the construction to the user controls. The LED lights bring an element that enhances the atmosphere and perfectly complements the music.If you're looking for a great speaker for a little more price this is the one. Its the perfect speaker to use everyday whether its inside or out.
timestamp: Reviewed in the United States July 23, 2023

title: 5.0 out of 5 stars Absolutely incredible battery
author: Rodney Molidor
content: This Sony XG500 boombox sounds good and has absolutely world-class battery life, and fast charging. However there are better sounding speakers for the money, and some that cost far less that sound just as good(Skullcandy barrel xt for example). This boombox has great features, including TWO USB-A ports so you can use one to play music from a USB stick, and another to charge your phone, plus a mic/guitar input! For me, the battery life is hugely important, and I can not overstate how long this battery lasts and how quickly it charges back up. FAR superior to all the others I have owned. And it sounds good, not the best, but plenty good enough. I absolutely love it.
timestamp: Reviewed in the United States July 23, 2024

title: 5.0 out of 5 stars A speaker worthy of the Sony name
author: Efrem Alexander
content: This is a outstanding speaker, once you tune it with some EQ adjustments, out of the box the sound signature is warm and could be off-putting if you're expecting more clarity, but it is there you just have to know how to set it up. First make sure the LDAC is engaged and I also found the live setting to get more clarity and sparkle than the megebass setting and last but not least use a third party music app (I recommend Musicolet) it has multiple EQ band settings and also preamp to boost the volume of your music.With these 3 factors addressed this speaker produces some of the most well-balanced sound of all my Bluetooth speakers especially for its size, just like a fine instrument, it has to be tuned to get the best sound quality from it!!
timestamp: Reviewed in the United States July 15, 2024

title: 4.0 out of 5 stars Sounds Great When Dialed In
author: Mike Blumenberg
content: Out of the box, this speaker sounds pretty mediocre. But just tinker with the EQ, and it comes to life. It's a little big, and kinda heavy, but the built in handle makes transport a breeze - and it lays flat when not in use. The speaker is very well designed, and looks great. It gets fairly loud, but nothing too crazy. The JBLs definitely get louder, but I like the sound quality of the Sony better. At low to mid volumes, you can get over 12 hours of constant playing from the speaker. At near full volume, it's more like 6-8. If you like how it looks, and are in the market for this style speaker, give it a shot. I think you'll like it.

timestamp: Reviewed in the United States August 4, 2024

title: 5.0 out of 5 stars Speaker With Feature and Skill! (Bow Hunting Skills, Numchuck skills, you know the rest....)
author: Natascha
content: +The sound is amazing,+the battery life seems to last forever (especially if you turn off lights and bass boost, but even leaving them on...I'm still so impressed)+It looks super nice. I use this primarily as a home speaker actually that I move around at times, and I think it's a great speaker serving that role, too. I find it impressive truly as an ALL IN ONE product, you know? I must say, even after reviews, this speaker is better experienced in person than the reviews can even show. It's truly impressive. I think when asking if you should buy this or not, the answer is definitely YES if you want the extra features. For example,++ being able to turn this into a guitar amp is gonna make me feel especially cool when I very poorly sing and play guitar. I don't know how often I'll use this, but to have that as an option as actually pretty freaking sweet.++ Being able to charge things from my speaker, even if pretty slowly, is cool and useful.++ Being able to plug in an amazon echo into this speaker and have Alexa voice activated assistance is also freaking sweet. Having such a long battery life is a convenience even just using this mostly as a home speaker.This speaker really does rock! ;) It has numchuck skills, bow hunting skills, it just has skillz. It's NOICE!(I hope this review helps someone in some way. Remember to embrace your inner Napoleon.)which one, you say?You decide!Do you want this even at all AND you have the money? If so, go for it! If you want to spend less and don't mind lacking a few features, (features lik a guitar amp plug, an aux plug, two usb a charging ports, and a super long battery life), consider other options like the Soundcore Motion Boom Plus. You can spend half the price and get something that sounds really, really good still if just having something that plays good sounding music is your primary concern. It will lack some features, but they may be things you wouldn't really prioritize or use often anyway on a more feautre ridden speaker. Being poor, sometimes spending more really pays off, but it doesn't always. Sometimes I'm just as satisfied with a product at a lower price that still has 98% of the other features in common with higher priced items. Does paying more pay off here? Well, I think for the most part yes. I think the features really are fun.

title: 4.0 out of 5 stars Still deciding if I love it
author: Fawn
content: I'm not crazy about the fact that you cannot disable the microphone because it prevents me from dictating on my phone if I have it connected, and I also think it tends to be a little bass heavy without adjusting the equalizer in the app, and the app is kind of outdated in my opinion. That being said, I do love having a large portable speaker that I can put in any room of the house and fill it with music or whatever. It's a bit heavy at 5 pounds and should definitely have had a better base for stability because I'm not sure how well it would survive a fall. It also doesn't seem to ever power off despite the settings I chose for that very reason. That being said, the battery life is ridiculously long and I can leave it on all day without any issues. I do love Sony products but I'm also glad I got this on a promotional sale ($100 off) because I likely wouldn't have paid the normal price. I also love that it has USB-C charging, as well an extra USB port to charge my phone.

title: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great Buy for outdoor needs

content: I switched to this speaker after using the waterproof JBL speaker. Here are the reasons why this was the right decision even though this speaker cost a little more.1. Battery life. Sound levels. It has a great sound and packs a punch. The bass is strong. The treble could be clearer.4. It does have an auxiliary input even though it doesn‚Äôt specifically say that in the descriptions on amazon. Bluetooth works great too and is easy to connect.5. It is larger than the jbl speaker and heavier too but that is to be expected if my other points matter to you too.6. Dont buy the case that gets suggested with the product. title: 5.0 out of 5 stars This was a really great buy!

content: I'm always in the market for quality bluetooth speakers. When the opportunity presented itself to buy this unit for under $200, it was an absolute no-brainer. It plays loud. Crystal clear loud with a deep punchy bass to boot! And the battery? Well, we had this speaker at a at rendezvous of a motley lot of characters deep within the twigs of the Nicolet National Forest in northern Wisconsin where it was playing at minimum 12-hours straight with plenty to go and only plugged in on a recharge simply because we were not using it. I haven't tested out the guitar plug-in, as of yet. So I cannot report on that aspect. But the lights are cool especially during nightfall if you're into that sort of thing. Oh, and this unit is certifibly solid. It can literally be dragged through a swamp during monsoon season and it won't miss a beat or soak up a molecule of moisture with its superior water tight design. is great when your spending the weekend in camp or at the beach when a sudden downpour shows up on an otherwise sunny day! In closing, in my humble opinion this JBL PartyBox 110 is a rugged, well-built, compact unit thatin my humble opinion sounds great! and I would have been completely satisfied satisfied with the purchase been an awesome little speaker I'd pay more than I have for it.

title: 1.0 out of 5 stars Something Wasn't Right!!!!!
author: MELLY Z
content: I'm giving one star do to the fact that I felt something was "off" about the speaker itself as soon as I pulled it out of the box. It came with the cords and instruction manual BUT the speaker itself had no factory stickers or protective film. I found it odd because everyone knows upon purchasing new products - there is usually SOMETHING (such as a sticker and/or protective film) giving the purchaser some type of assurance that they just bought a BRAND NEW product. But I just tried brushing it off and plugged that baby in. I charged it and played a couple songs but that was it. It was late and so it wasn't until New Year's Eve that I had actually tried out the volume level and "MEGA BASS" feature and I noticed the second time I actually powered it on that there was definite distortion or static. My friend who was over noticed it as well. So after playing detective and after watching multiple un-boxing videos of the SONY SRS-XG500 I noticed they all came fresh up outta the box with two blue stickers located on the front of the speaker. MINE HAD NOTHING.I called SONY and they confirmed that it most definitely should have had the new stickers attached. They had me to two different reset features in hopes to fix the sound trouble - but to no avail.They (SONY) is sending me a pre-paid shipping label and sending me a NEW SONY SRS-XG500 from the actual warehouse. I WHOLEHEARTEDLY BELIEVE I WAS SOLD A "RETURNED/REFURBISHED" speaker. I own a SONY speaker and its pretty old - RDH-GTK37 which has been through three pretty big parties and my daily listening habits with nothing to complain about.Just thought ya'll should know.
timestamp: Reviewed in the United States January 3, 2023

title: 1.0 out of 5 stars Amazing Speaker, Horrible Experience

timestamp: Reviewed in the United States July 16, 2024

title: 4.0 out of 5 stars Underwhelming performance
author: M. Alvarez
content: So, the positives right up front. Very small and portable. Simplistic but stylish. Easy to use and setup. Love the dedicated Bluetooth. Comes well packaged from Sonos. Very small and for its size, puts out good volume.Now the potential cons. I have a Sonos Arc and the Sonos Move (1st Gen). Got them both for a great sale price and the sound quality never ceases to impress me. Especially the Move, which even at very high volumes plays great music from rock, country and rap. I bought the roam to be more portable than my Move, which I use on the deck, poolside or at small gatherings. The Roam was more for hiking, beach trips and casual listening washing the car, etc. I have to say I am not impressed. It sounds decent at its highest volume although you can tell you‚Äôve reached its limit. I never feel like any of my other Sonos products have hit a limit even at 100% volume. It also sounds almost flat and very mono sounding vs steep or simulated stereo. Worse, it‚Äôs okay with rock or country or anything that has very little bass, but don‚Äôt try and play any kind of rap or hip hip. The bass is almost non-existent and really makes it feel like you‚Äôre pushing the speakers beyond their capabilities.Granted, most small portable like this would have similar issues, but when I listen to my sons JBL Flip 5, which costs less than half the price, I feel like the bass is much richer and the sound is louder, but of relatively similar quality as the Sonos, which is very disappointing. Maybe I‚Äôm missing the mark on its intended use, but I don‚Äôt think so. For small sound and high portability, it‚Äôs okay, but feels overpriced when compared to a couple others for what it offers.Would have considered a slightly larger roam in its 2nd generation for larger speakers or drivers or a dedicated bass port. I‚Äôll have to sample it for a while and along others. I‚Äôm on the fence keeping it vs returning it. I‚Äôll update my decision later.UPDATE: okay, after using it down at the beach, I would have to say my opinion has changed some. While I still would like a bit more volume, it‚Äôs pretty good for small spaces and close to me or around the pool or campfire. Sound has grown on me for most music and I recognize what it is for its ultra portability. Battery life is good and it‚Äôs been easy to pair. Loud enough to enjoy, but not so loud as to annoy others around me at the beach. I bought it at full price for $179. If you wait for Prime Day or other major sales days, it drops to $143, which is a much more reasonable price where it‚Äôs worth it.
timestamp: Reviewed in the United States July 8, 2024

title: 4.0 out of 5 stars Quality speaker
author: SC
content: OK I'll start with the elephant in the room... Either great reviews or poor reviews. The speaker is very good with rich bass and very clean sound production. The volume is good but it's a 7 inch device so it's not going to blow you out of the room. The first thing people say is that it is amazing for it's size. I agree and appreciate it for the amazing sound and portability. This is easy competition for Beats pill or the Bose versions in this size group and better in many ways. One of the ways is the tech. Also known as the bad reviews, at least for now. They need to update some areas with the software and the app. This needs to work perfect for what it cost (I hope you hear me Sonos!). If they fix the connectivity and wifi issues this is a winner. If you want a great piece of hardware with stand alone function it's a winner. For owners of other Sonos products having issues, they owe you an apology and a quick solution. I use it alone and have not added it to my system for this reason. I hope you can make a decision to buy or wait based on this info. I am happy but if I were trying to add this to my Sonos 1 I would not be.
timestamp: Reviewed in the United States June 12, 2024

title: 1.0 out of 5 stars Buyer beware WiFi connection and Customer Service horrible
author: Road Runner
content: I bought this speaker 6 months ago, barely used it. It will not connect to WiFi despite hours of waiting for customer service to assist. After I finally got a customer service agent, reset device several times, it connected once and hasn‚Äôt connected since. Seller said go to Sonos. Sonos is impossible to get customer service agent been trying for 3 days. No one calls you back, chat line tells you contact support number but Sonos has NO support! Don‚Äôt waste your money buying this. Not worth the money. Stick with Bose!

title: 1.0 out of 5 stars Horrible service

content: I could not link to other Sonos Roam speakers or bluetooth - Spent 1 1/2 chat hours with Sonos support and 5 hours live (each time waiting for 1 hr before connented to a person) Got disconnected both times and they not try to reconnect - they both had my email and cell number. 6 1/2 hrs and no resolution -Worst service I have ever dealt with and will not reccomend to anyone.Poor service will eventually collapse a company - especially this bad.Jim T

title: 1.0 out of 5 stars Cannot pair two of these without wi-fi.
author: jdawz
content: Amazing that they made an outdoor, portable waterproof speaker that cannot pair at all unless you are in wi-fi. 55 minute wait for tech support only to find out you are out of luck with two of these without wifi. If you only want one speaker it is ok but the JBL Flip 6 at $99 is just as good.
timestamp: Reviewed in the United States May 22, 2024

content: Not consistent qi charging and bluetooth a pain to connect. Megaboom much better.
